appia: <entryFree id="n3154" type="main" key="Appi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Appĭa</orth>, v. Appius.</entryFree>
appianus: <entryFree id="n3155" type="main" key="Appi^a_nus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Appĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>Appia</etym>, <sense id="n3155.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pertaining to Appia</hi> (a town in Phrygia Major): <cit><quote lang="la">legati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 7</bibl></cit>; and <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Appĭāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Appia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 29, 29, § 105</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n3156" type="main" key="Appi^a_nus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Appĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>Appius</etym>, <sense id="n3156.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to Appius</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">libido,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 29</bibl></cit>: mala, <hi rend="ital">apples</hi> (of great excellence), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 14, 15, § 49</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n3157" type="main" key="Appi^a_nus3" n="3"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Appĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n3157.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Appian</hi>, of a castle in Rhætia: <cit><quote lang="la">viride, quod Appianum vocatur,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>a kind of poor green soil</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 6, 29, § 48</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
appias: <entryFree id="n3158" type="main" key="Appias"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Appias</orth>, <itype>ădis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n3158.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An epithet of the nympi at the fountain of Aqua Appia</hi> (v. Applus), whose waters gushed forth near the temple of Venus: <cit><quote lang="la">Non illas lites Appias ipsa probat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 660</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 1, 82</bibl>.—Hence, transf., to <hi rend="ital">her statues</hi>, found at the neighboring temple of Venus: <cit><quote lang="la">Appiadesque deae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:452" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 452</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n3158.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An epithet of Minerva</hi>, given by Cicero jestingly, to flatter Appius Pulcher, in imitation of the appellative Pallas, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 1</bibl> Manut.</sense></entryFree>
appietas: <entryFree id="n3159" type="hapax" key="Appi^e^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Appĭĕtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n3159.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the ancient nobility of the Appian family</hi>, a word formed jocosely by Cicero: Appietas aut Lentulitas, <hi rend="ital">the nobility of Appius</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Lentulus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:7:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 7, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
appingo: <entryFree id="n3160" type="main" key="appingo1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ap-pingo</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">adp-</orth>, <itype>Baiter</itype>, K. and H.), <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n3160.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to paint upon</hi> something (very rare): Delphinum silvis adpingit, fluctibus aprum, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">colorem vetusculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Or. 1, p. 229" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Or. 1, p. 229</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:2" default="NO">2</bibl>, p. 257; Laud. Neglig. 2, 371.—In Cic. in epistolary style, also of writing, <hi rend="ital">to add by writing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to</hi> <cb n="APPL" /> <hi rend="ital">write</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">adpinge aliquid novi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 8, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n3161" type="main" key="appingo2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ap-pingo</orth>, <itype>ĕre, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>pango</etym>, <sense id="n3161.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to fasten</hi> or <hi rend="ital">joint to</hi>: aliquid alicui rei, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=8" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 8</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
appiolae: <entryFree id="n3162" type="main" key="Appi^o^lae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Appĭŏlae</orth> (better <orth extent="full" lang="la">Apĭ-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n3162.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city of Latium</hi>, <hi rend="ital">probably near Bovillœ</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:35:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 35, 7</bibl> Weissenb.</sense></entryFree>
appius: <entryFree id="n3163" type="main" key="Appi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Appĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Appĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (abbrev. App.). <sense id="n3163.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Roman prœnomen</hi>, esp. of persons of the gens Claudia; hence, </sense><sense id="n3163.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Appĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Appian.</hi> </sense><sense id="n3163.2" n="A" level="2"> Appia via, <hi rend="ital">the Appian Way</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a well-known high - road</hi>, <hi rend="ital">begun by the censor Appius Claudius Cœcus</hi> (about 442 A. U. C.), which began in Rome at the Porta Capena, and passed in a direct line to the Albanian Mountains, and thence through the Pontine Marshes to Capua; later it was continued to Brundisium, perh. by Trajan (the stones were large polygons of basaltic lava; <cit><quote lang="la">parts here and there are yet in existence),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:18:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 18, 55</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 6, 15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ad Q. Fr. 1, 1, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:7:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 7, 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:29:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 29, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 5" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aquaed. 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 131</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Müll. Roms Camp. 2, 230.—Called also Appī via,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 6, 26</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and simply Appia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:4:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 4, 14</bibl></cit>, al.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 12</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3163.3" n="B" level="2"> Appia aqua, <hi rend="ital">the aqueduct which this same Appius constructed;</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 5" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aquaed. 5</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 29</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n3163.4" n="C" level="2"> Appii Forum, <hi rend="ital">a small market-town in Latium</hi>, <hi rend="ital">founded by the same Appius</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the left side of the Via Appia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the midst of the Pontine Marshes</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Foro Appio</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:28:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 28, 15</bibl>; cf. Mann. Ital. I. 637 and 638.</sense></entryFree>
applaudo: <entryFree id="n3164" type="main" key="applaudo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ap-plaudo</orth> (post-class. <orth extent="full" lang="la">applōdo</orth>）<itype />, (<orth extent="full" lang="la">adp-</orth>, <itype>Ritschl</itype>, Fleck., Müll.; <orth extent="full" lang="la">app-</orth>, Merk.), <itype>si, sum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n3164.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To strike</hi> one thing <hi rend="ital">upon</hi> another, <hi rend="ital">to clap</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cavis applauso corpore palmis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:352" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 352</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adplauso tela sonat latere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:1:66" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 1, 66</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:16:357" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 16, 357</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ovum applosum ad terram,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Get. 3</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Elog. 6</bibl>: terrae (<case>dat.</case>), <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 6, p. 184, 34</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">9</bibl>, p. 236, 21.—</sense><sense id="n3164.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to clap the hands in approbation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to applaud</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacerdotes applaudebant manibus suis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,049:5:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Jer. 5, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adplaudere atque adprobare fabulam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:5:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 5, 2, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nobis clare adplaudite,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:9:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 5, 9, 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agite, adplaudamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:5:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 5, 2, 13</bibl></cit>: cui generi civium maxime adplaudatur? * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:chapter=54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 54</bibl>, where B. and K. read <hi rend="ital">plaudatur.</hi></sense></entryFree>
applausor: <entryFree id="n3165" type="hapax" key="applausor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">applausor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adp-</orth>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>applaudo</etym>, <sense id="n3165.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one that expresses approbation by clapping of hands</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an applauder</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Idem populus ille aliquando scaenici imperatoris spectator et applausor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:46" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 46</bibl></cit>, where Keil now reads <hi rend="ital">plausor.</hi></sense></entryFree>
applausus: <entryFree id="n3166" type="main" key="applausus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">applausus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adp-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of applaudo.</entryFree>
applex: <entryFree id="n3167" type="hapax" key="applex"><orth extent="full" lang="la">applex</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adp-</orth>), <itype>ĭcis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>applico</etym>, <sense id="n3167.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">closely joined</hi> or <hi rend="ital">attached to</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">adpliciore nexu inhaerebat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 10, p. 249, 21</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
applicatio: <entryFree id="n3168" type="main" key="appli^ca_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">applĭcātĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adp-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym> (only in Cic.). <sense id="n3168.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A joining</hi> or <hi rend="ital">attaching</hi> one's self <hi rend="ital">to;</hi> hence, trop., <hi rend="ital">an inclining to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inclination</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">adplicatio animi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:8:27" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 8, 27</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n3168.1" n="II" level="1"> Judic. t. t., <hi rend="ital">a placing of one's self under the protection of a superior</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clientship</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jus applicationis,</quote> <trans><tr>the right of inheriting the effects of such a client</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:39:177" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 39, 177</bibl></cit> (cf. applico, I. B. 2.).</sense></entryFree>
applicatus: <entryFree id="n3169" type="main" key="appli^ca_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">applĭcātus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adp-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, v. <itype>applico</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> 1.</entryFree>
applicitus: <entryFree id="n3170" type="main" key="appli^ci^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">applĭcĭtus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adp-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, v. <itype>applico</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> 2.</entryFree>
applico: <entryFree id="n3171" type="main" key="appli^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ap-plĭco</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">adp-</orth>, <itype>Ritschl</itype>, Fleck., Baiter, Weissenb., Halm, in Quint.; <orth extent="full" lang="la">app-</orth>, Merk., Kayser, Halm, in Nep. Rib.), āvi and ui, ātum and <itype>ĭtum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> (applicui appears to have first become prevalent in the time of Cic., and is the com. form in Vulg.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; applicavi is used by Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 860</bibl> P.; Varr. ib.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:prol. 23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. prol. 23</bibl>; Auct. B. Alex. 17 <sense id="n3171.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:16:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 16, 46</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">24, 66</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:39:177" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 39, 177</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 13, 55</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:91:316" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 91, 316</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:13:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 13, 43</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 51, 153</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:27:77" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 27, 77</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 20, 65</bibl>; and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:11:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 3, 11, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:4:7:4" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 4, 7, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 2, 1, § 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,011:30:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Reg. 30, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,034:33:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Eccli. 33, 12</bibl>; ib. Osee, 7, 6. It is found in the best MSS. and edd.; cf. Zumpt ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:page=240" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. p. 240</bibl>, and Neue, Formenl. II. pp. 477 and 479. Still later than applicui, the <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi> applicitum became prevalent, Inscr, Neap. l. 6916; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4570</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:22:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 22, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:24:18" default="NO">4, 24, 18</bibl>; Quint. <cb n="APPL" /> 1, 2, 26; 2, 4, 30; 4, 2, 117; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:17:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 17, 23</bibl>; cf. Neue, Formenl. II. p. 551, and v. <pos>P. a.</pos> infra; cf. plico and its compounds, complico, explico, implico, etc.); orig., <hi rend="ital">to join</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fasten</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">attach to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to affix;</hi> hence, <hi rend="ital">to bring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">add</hi>, <hi rend="ital">put</hi>, <hi rend="ital">place to</hi> or <hi rend="ital">near to</hi>, etc. (very freq., esp. in trop. signif. and in more elevated style; in Plaut. twice; in Ter. four times; <cit><quote lang="la">in Cic. epistt. only once,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:11:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 11, 3</bibl></cit>; never in Tac.; syn.: admoveo, adjungo, addo, adhibeo, adicio). </sense><sense id="n3171.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n3171.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>; constr. usu. with <hi rend="ital">ad;</hi> rarely with <case>dat.</case> </sense><sense id="n3171.3" n="a" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">se ad arbores,</quote> <trans><tr>to lean against</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 27</bibl></cit> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">trunco se applicuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:9:9" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 12, 9, 9</bibl></cit>): <cit><quote lang="la">applicuit ambos ad eum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:48:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 48, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,023:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> 1 Macc. 9, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">umeros ad saxa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 160</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sinistrum (cornu) ad oppidum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se ad flammam,</quote> <trans><tr>to approach</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:27:77" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 27, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sudarium ad os,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:25 al" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 25 al.</bibl></cit>— </sense><sense id="n3171.4" n="b" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ratem (sc. rati),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:28:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 28, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flumini castra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 32, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corporibus adplicantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(asellum) ulmo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:750" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 750</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanctos applicabit sibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,004:16:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Num. 16, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,016:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> 2 Par. 2, 16</bibl>.—Also with <hi rend="ital">local adv.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">boves illuc,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:543" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 543</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3171.5" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n3171.6" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To connect with</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to add to</hi> a thing: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ad honestatem adplicetur (voluptas),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:12:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 12, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">annum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:28:9" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 6, 28, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adplicare verba verbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:10:17" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 10, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:3:19" default="NO">7, 3, 19</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3171.7" n="2" level="3"> Se or animum, <hi rend="ital">to attach</hi>, <hi rend="ital">apply</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">devote one's self</hi> or <hi rend="ital">one's mind to</hi> a person or thing: <cit><quote lang="la">illae extemplo se (ad eos) adplicant, adglutinant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:2:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 2, 2, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hi se ad vos adplicant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:4:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 4, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:4:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. 5, 4, 21</bibl>: ad Siculos se adplicavit, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 860</bibl> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">se ad alicujus familiaritatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:16:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 16, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sicilia se ad amicitiam fidemque populi Romani applicavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 1</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:9:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 9, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:39:177" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 39, 177</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:11:3 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 3, 11, 3 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad Atheniensium societatem se applicare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Arist. 2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Arist. 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Certa res est ad frugem adplicare animum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:1:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 1, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animum aegrotum ad deteriorem partem adplicat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 2, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad virtutem animus se adplicat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:14:48" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 14, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aures modis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:11:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 11, 8</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,002:72" default="NO"><author>id.</author> C. S. 72</bibl> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">admovere aures, s. v. admoveo, and adhibere aures,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:chapter=3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Arch. 3</bibl></cit>): sese ad convivia, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:11:2:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 11, 2, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">se ad studium musicum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:prol. 23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. prol. 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me ad eundem quem Romae audiveram Molonem applicavi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:91:316" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 91, 316</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se ad philosophiam, ad jus civile, ad eloquentiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:32:115" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 32, 115</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se ad scribendam historiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:13:55 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 13, 55 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n3171.8" n="3" level="3"> Crimen alicui, <hi rend="ital">to charge one with a crime</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:66:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 66, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3171.9" n="II" level="1"> Esp., naut. t. t., navem, or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> applicari, and in the <hi rend="ital">act.</hi> as <pos>v. n.</pos> (cf. 1. appello, II.), <hi rend="ital">to drive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">direct</hi>, <hi rend="ital">steer</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">bring a ship anywhere</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to land</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to bring to</hi> land: <cit><quote lang="la">navim ad naufragum applicarunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:chapter=2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2</bibl></cit>. 51, 153: ad Heraeum naves adplicuit, Liv 33, 17; <cit><quote lang="la">37, 12, 5: adplicatis nostris ad ter ram navibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 101</bibl></cit> Held.: <cit><quote lang="la">Ciae telluris ad oras Applicor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:598" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 598</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">applicor ignotis (sc. terris),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:7:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 7, 117</bibl></cit> Ruhnk. and Loers.—With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">applicor in terras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:16:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 16, 126</bibl></cit> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">appellere in aliquem locum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 3</bibl></cit>, and 28, 42): ad terram adplicant, Auct. B. Hisp. 37 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:4:21" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 4, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:12:2" default="NO">2, 12, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:16:4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 16, 4</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">acc. of place whither</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliā applicuimus Samum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:20:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 20, 15</bibl></cit>.—With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">quocumque litore adplicuisse naves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:32:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 32, 4</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">et applicuerant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,002:6:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Marc. 6, 53</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: quo accedam? quo adplicem? Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:19:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 19, 44</bibl>: quae vis immanibus applicat oris, <hi rend="ital">drives</hi> or <hi rend="ital">brings you</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:616" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 616</bibl> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nos Libycis tempestas adpulit oris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 377</bibl></cit>): <cit><quote lang="la">sublimis rapitur (Medea) et Creteis regionibus applicat angues,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>her dragon-chariot</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:223" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 223</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n3171.10" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">applĭcātus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adp-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> </sense><sense id="n3171.11" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Placed upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lying upon</hi> or <hi rend="ital">close to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attached to</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aures,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:7:5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 7, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Leucas colli adplicata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 17</bibl></cit>, and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 4, 5, § 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nervi adplicati ossibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:217" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 37, 88, § 217</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3171.12" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Inclined</hi> or <hi rend="ital">adapted to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">directed to</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omne animal adplicatum esse ad se diligendum,</quote> <trans><tr>inclined to self-love</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:13:34" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 4, 13, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vehemens ad aliquam rem applicata occupatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:25:36" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 25, 36</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi>, and <pos>adv.</pos> not used.—</sense><sense id="n3171.13" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">ap-plĭcĭtus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adp-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">applied</hi> or <hi rend="ital">joined to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attached to</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">adplicitum est cubiculo hypocauston,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:17:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 17, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">trunco palus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:22:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 22, 2</bibl></cit>: vites arboribus adplicitae,<pb n="143" /> <cb n="APPO" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:2:26" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 2, 26</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">pressus et velut adplicitus rei cultus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:117" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 117</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
applodo: <entryFree id="n3172" type="main" key="applo_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">applōdo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adp-</orth>), v. applaudo.</entryFree>
apploro: <entryFree id="n3173" type="main" key="applo_ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ap-plōro</orth> (K. and H.), <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n3173.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to lament</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deplore a thing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to weep at</hi> or <hi rend="ital">on account of</hi> (perh. only in the two foll. exs.). </sense><sense id="n3173.1" n="a" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">querebar applorans tibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:11:12" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 11, 12</bibl></cit> K. and H.—</sense><sense id="n3173.2" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum jam adploraveris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 4:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 4, 2</bibl></cit> Haase.</sense></entryFree>
applosus: <entryFree id="n3174" type="main" key="applo_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">applōsus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adp-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of applodo, v. applaudo.</entryFree>
appluda: <entryFree id="n3175" type="main" key="applu_da"><orth extent="full" lang="la">applūda</orth>, v. apluda.</entryFree>
applumbo: <entryFree id="n3176" type="main" key="applumbo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ap-plumbo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adp-</orth>), <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n3176.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to apply lead to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to solder;</hi> only found in the <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 271" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 271</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">statua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:12:2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 47, 12, 2</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:19:1:17:section=8" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 19, 1, 17, § 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:6:1:23" default="NO">6, 1, 23</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
appono: <entryFree id="n3177" type="main" key="appo_no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ap-pōno</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">adp-</orth>, <itype>Ritschl</itype>, Fleck., Lachm., Baiter, Halm; <orth extent="full" lang="la">app-</orth>, Merk., Kayser, K. and H., Weissenb.), <itype>pōsŭi, pŏsĭtum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> (<sense id="n3177.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi> apposivi, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:3:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 3, 31</bibl>; App. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 898</bibl> P.; cf. pono), <hi rend="ital">to place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">put</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">lay at</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near</hi> or <hi rend="ital">by the side of</hi> a thing; <hi rend="ital">to apply to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">add</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unite</hi>, etc. (class. in prose and poetry; syn.: addo, adicio, adjungo). </sense><sense id="n3177.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n3177.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">adpone hic mensulam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 3, 150</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">appositas instruxere epulis mensas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:570" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 570</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:8:831" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 831</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sitellam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:6:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 6, 11</bibl></cit>: <hi rend="ital">Sy.</hi> Onus urget. <hi rend="ital">Mi.</hi> At tu adpone, <hi rend="ital">put it down then</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:4:2:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 4, 2, 35</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">illam alteram apud me, quod bonist, adponito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:3:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 4, 3, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">munera eorum illis apponentur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Bar 6, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">At istos rastros interea tamen adpone,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:1:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 1, 1, 37</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:3:10 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. 4, 3, 10 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aër Omnibus est rebus circumdatus adpositusque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1036" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1036</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:373" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 373</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes columnae machinā appositā dejectae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:55:section=144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 55, § 144</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">notam ad malum versum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:chapter=30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 30</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 6</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:16" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 16</bibl>: manus ad os (eorum more, qui secreto aliquid narrant, Manut.), Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">scalis appositis urbem defenderunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adpositā aure ad glaciem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 28, 42, § 103</bibl></cit>: adpositum <hi rend="ital">in</hi> mensā lumen, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">paenulam ad vulnus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:49" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 49</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">dominum Adpositum flavis in Simoenta vadis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:9:12" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 9, 12</bibl></cit>.—So freq. of the putting on of garments, crowns, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">cur tamen appositā velatur janua lauro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:1:39" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 1, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gemmas toris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:9:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 9, 60</bibl></cit> Loers; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">the same,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:7:100" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">meretrix Appositā populum submovet ante serā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:14:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 3, 14, 10</bibl></cit> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ponere seram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:347" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 347</bibl></cit>): <cit><quote lang="la">candelam valvis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to set fire to</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:98 al" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 9, 98 al.</bibl></cit>— </sense><sense id="n3177.3" n="B" level="2"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n3177.4" n="1" level="3"> Freq. as t. t. of food, dishes, <hi rend="ital">to serve up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">set before one</hi> (cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">parati/qhmi</foreign>; <cit><quote lang="la">the simple verb pono is often so used, q. v.): adposita sit cena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apposuit eis mensam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:16:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 16, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adpositum est ampliter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 160</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apposuit patellam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cenabat apud eum: argentum ille ceterum purum apposuerat, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 22, 49</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:32:91" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 32, 91</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 6, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:210" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 51, 78, § 210</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">convivis panem et obsonia apponere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:37" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 37</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Caes. 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Galb. 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Appositaque est eis ciborum magna praeparatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,014:6:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 4 Reg. 6, 23</bibl></cit> al.; <cit><quote lang="la">Albanum sive Falernum Te magis appositis delectat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:8:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 8, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 8, 69 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n3177.5" n="2" level="3"> Aliquem alicui or alicui rei, <hi rend="ital">to appoint</hi> or <hi rend="ital">designate one to any service</hi> or <hi rend="ital">duty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to place in any station</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to join to as an aid</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">custodem Tullio me apponite,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:16:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Div. in Caecil. 16, 51</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 60</bibl>; cf.: adpositus custodiae (<case>dat.</case>), <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 6</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">2, 68: accusator apponitur civis Romanus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:29:section=74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 29, § 74</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1, 5</bibl>, § 41 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">calumniatores,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praevaricatorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non illicitatorem venditor adponet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:15:61" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 15, 61</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 54</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">custodes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Dion, 4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dion, 4, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">moderator et magister consulibus appositus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:18:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 18, 6</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">rectorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:48" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scrutatores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:35 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 35 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n3177.6" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To put to</hi> something <hi rend="ital">by way of increase</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to add to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">superadd</hi> (rare; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">addo, adicio): nihil his novum adposivi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:3:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 3, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 4, 3, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aetas illi, quos tibi dempserit, adponet annos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:5:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 5, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exemplum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:13:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 13, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quis apposuerit ad haec, apponet Deus super illum etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,027:22:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Apoc. 22, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:49:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Gen. 49, 32</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3177.7" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n3177.8" n="A" level="2"> Of the mind, <hi rend="ital">to apply</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">appone cor ad doctrinam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,029:22:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Prov. 22, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apposui cor meum, ut etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,030:8:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Eccl. 8, 16</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3177.9" n="B" level="2"> In eccl. Lat., after the Hebrew, of an act, <hi rend="ital">to do</hi> <cb n="APPO" /> <hi rend="ital">further</hi>, <hi rend="ital">also to do</hi> something: <cit><quote lang="la">non apponet, ut complacitior sit adhuc?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:76:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 76, 8</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Act. 12, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">apposuerunt adhuc peccare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:77:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Psa. 77, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">88, 23</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3177.10" n="C" level="2"> With a <hi rend="ital">dat. of end</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to set down for something</hi>, <hi rend="ital">count</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reckon</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">consider as</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to hold as</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">cum is nil promereat, postulare id gratiae adponi sibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:1:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 1, 32</bibl></cit> (addi in gratiam suam, Don.): <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid lucro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:9:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 9, 15</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">appŏsĭ-tus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adp-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">put</hi> or <hi rend="ital">applied to</hi>, etc. </sense><sense id="n3177.11" n="A" level="2"> Of relations of space, <hi rend="ital">placed</hi> or <hi rend="ital">situated at</hi> or <hi rend="ital">near to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contiguous to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bordering upon;</hi> constr. with <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">regio mari adposita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 18, 22, § 126</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">platanus itineri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 12, 1, 5, § 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">castellum Lupiae flumini adpositum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 7</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">audacia fidentiae non contrarium, sed appositum ac propinquum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:54:165" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 54, 165</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n3177.12" n="B" level="2"> Metaph. </sense><sense id="n3177.13" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Fit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proper</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suitable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">appropriate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">apposite</hi>, etc. (like aptus, q. v.; hence in MSS. freq. interchanged with it; cf. Spald. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:11:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 11, 9</bibl>); constr. with <hi rend="ital">ad</hi> (in this signif. very freq. in Varr. and Cic.; <cit><quote lang="la">elsewhere very rare, perh. not found except in Quint. and Gell.): ager ad vitem adpositus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:7:5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 7, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loca adposita ad faenum, ad vinum, ad oleum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 1:23:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 23, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equus ad medendum adpositus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 2:7:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 7, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(gallinae) adpositissimae ad partum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 3:9:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 9, 9</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">2, 10, 4: menses ad agendum maxime appositi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 5, 41</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 3, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">multo appositior ad deferenda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">argumentatio appositissima ad judicationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 14</bibl></cit>. —* </sense><sense id="n3177.14" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Inclined to;</hi> constr. with <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">judex juri magis an aequo sit adpositus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:3:11" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 3, 11</bibl></cit> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">adclinis falsis animus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 2, 6</bibl></cit>).—</sense><sense id="n3177.15" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">appŏsĭtum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, in rhet. and gram., <hi rend="ital">an epithet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">adjective</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">adposita, quae epitheta dicuntur, ut dulce mustum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:2:10" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 2, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:14:3" default="NO">2, 14, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:24" default="NO">9, 4, 24</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">appŏsĭtē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">suitably</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fitly</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">ad persuasionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. Spald ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:15:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 15, 3</bibl> praeclare et apposite et facete scribere, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:23:11" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 23, 11</bibl> (<hi rend="ital">comp.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">sup</hi> not used).</sense></entryFree>
apporrectus: <entryFree id="n3178" type="hapax" key="apporrectus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">apporrectus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adp-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> <etym>as if from ap-porrigo</etym>, <sense id="n3178.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">stretched</hi> or <hi rend="ital">extended near</hi> a thing: <cit><quote lang="la">draco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:561" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 561</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
apportatio: <entryFree id="n3179" type="hapax" key="apporta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">apportātĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adp-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>apporto</etym>, <sense id="n3179.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a conveying</hi>, <hi rend="ital">carrying to a place</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad urbem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
apporto: <entryFree id="n3180" type="main" key="apporto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ap-porto</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">adp-</orth>, <itype>Ritschl</itype>, Fleck., Lachm., Baiter; <orth extent="full" lang="la">app-</orth>, Kayser), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n3180.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to bring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">carry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conduct</hi>, <hi rend="ital">convey to;</hi> lit. and trop. (most freq. in ante-class. per. and in Cic.; in the latter only in its lit. signif.; and in poetry perh. only anteclass., later replaced by adferre; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: importo, adfero, adveho, inveho): alia adportabunt filiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:1:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">divitias domum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:3:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 3, 1, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Quid nam adportas?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 5, 2, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:prol. 24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. prol. 24</bibl> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:prol. 70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. prol. 70</bibl>); so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> And. 1, 1, 46</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ad. 5, 4, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 3, 1, 18</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 4, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">insolitam rem auribus adportare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bonum adporto nuntium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,012:18:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Reg. 18, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">morbos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:221" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 221</bibl></cit>, and perh. not elsewhere: si nihil quicquam aliud vitī adportes tecum, Caecil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:8:25" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 8, 25</bibl>, and <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 247, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cochleas de Illyrico,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:14:4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 14, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">signa populo Romano apportare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa undique adportans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:42:151" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 42, 151</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Indicum adportatur ex Indiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 6, 25, § 43</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:6" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 6</bibl>.—In Plaut., adporto adventum, <hi rend="ital">to bring an arrival</hi>, for advenio, <hi rend="ital">to arrive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">come to</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Huc autem quom extemplo adventum adporto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:3:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 3, 1, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
apposco: <entryFree id="n3181" type="main" key="apposco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ap-posco</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adp-</orth>), <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n3181.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to demand in addition to</hi> something (only in the two foll. exs.): haec talenta dotis adposcunt duo, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:7:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 7, 10</bibl> Bentl. and Ruhnk.: si plus apposcere visus (est), * <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 100</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
apposite: <entryFree id="n3182" type="main" key="appo^si^te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">appŏsĭtē</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adp-</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos>, v. appono, <sense id="n3182.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
appositio: <entryFree id="n3183" type="main" key="appo^si^ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">appŏsĭtĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adp-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>appono</etym>, <sense id="n3183.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a setting before.</hi> </sense><sense id="n3183.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: epularum, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,034:30:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Eccli. 30, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cucurbitae,</quote> <trans><tr>the application of</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 3:5" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 3, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3183.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">criminis,</quote> <trans><tr>the imputation of crime</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Com. 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
appositum: <entryFree id="n3184" type="main" key="appo^si^tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">appŏsĭtum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adp-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. <itype>appono</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> B. 3.</entryFree>
appositus: <entryFree id="n3185" type="main" key="appo^si^tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">appŏsĭtus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adp-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, v. <itype>appono</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> <cb n="APPR" /></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n3186" type="main" key="appo^si^tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">appŏsĭtus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adp-</orth>), <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>appono</etym>; in medicine, t. t., <sense id="n3186.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an applying</hi>, <hi rend="ital">application</hi> (only in post-Aug. prose and in <hi rend="ital">abl. sing.</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">(Mystidanum) volvae prodest adpositu, fotu et inlitu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:164" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 9, 82, § 164</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:22" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 5, 13, § 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:24" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 6, 15, § 24</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, p. 91</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
appostulo: <entryFree id="n3187" type="hapax" key="appostu^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ap-postŭlo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adp-</orth>) [ad <sense id="n3187.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">intens.</hi>], <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to entreat</hi> or <hi rend="ital">solicit importunately</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid alicui,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Mon. 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
appotus: <entryFree id="n3188" type="main" key="appo_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ap-pōtus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adp-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> (ad <sense id="n3188.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">intens.</hi>), <hi rend="ital">drunk</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intoxicated</hi> (only in the foll. exs.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 126</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:3:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 2, 3, 75</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:7:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 2, 7, 8</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:7:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 7, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
apprecio: <entryFree id="n3189" type="main" key="appre^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">apprĕcĭo</orth>, v. appretio.</entryFree>
apprecor: <entryFree id="n3190" type="main" key="appre^cor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ap-prĕcor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adp-</orth>), <itype>āri</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos>, <sense id="n3190.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to pray to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to adore</hi>, <hi rend="ital">worship</hi> (very rare, perh. only in Hor. and App.): Rite deos prius adprecati, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:15:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 15, 28</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 11, p. 266, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">deam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11</bibl></cit>, p. 4, 1.</sense></entryFree>
apprehendo: <entryFree id="n3191" type="main" key="appre^hendo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ap-prĕhendo</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">adp-</orth>, Fleck., Baiter, Halm; <orth extent="full" lang="la">app-</orth>, Kayser) (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> sometimes apprendo: adprendas, Caecil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 9</bibl>; <sense id="n3191.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">apprensus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:4:43" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 4, 43</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">apprendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:653" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 13, 653</bibl></cit>), <itype>di, sum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to lay hold upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to seize</hi>, <hi rend="ital">take hold of</hi> (class., esp. in prose; syn.: prehendo, comprehendo, cupio, arripio, corripio). </sense><sense id="n3191.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n3191.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Alterum alterā adprehendit eos manu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:5:1:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 5, 1, 64</bibl></cit>, where Fleck. reads <hi rend="ital">prehendit</hi>: Pone (me) apprendit pallio, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:6:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 6, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">adprehendens pallium suum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,013:11:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 3 Reg. 11, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">atomi aliae alias adprehendentes continuantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:20:54" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 20, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adprehendit cornu altaris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,013:2:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 3 Reg. 2, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vites sic claviculis adminicula tamquam manibus adprehendunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:47:120" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 47, 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">morsu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 24, 28, § 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quantum adprehenderint tres digiti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:2:26" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 2, 26</bibl></cit>.—So of <hi rend="ital">seizing hold of</hi> the hand, or <hi rend="ital">embracing the person</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">manum osculandi causā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:72" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 72</bibl></cit> (prehendere manum is found in <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 31</bibl>, and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:56:240" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 56, 240</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">manum adprehendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:19:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 19, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:41:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Isa. 41, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,002:1:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Marc. 1, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Act. 3, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus adprensis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:8 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 8 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adprehensum deosculatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,029:7:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Prov. 7, 13</bibl></cit>.—Also in entreaty: <cit><quote lang="la">conscientiā exter ritus adprehendit Caecilium, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 5, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3191.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n3191.4" n="1" level="3"> Of discourse: <cit><quote lang="la">quidquid ego apprehenderam statim accusator extorquebat e manibus,</quote> <trans><tr>whatever I had brought forward</tr>, <tr>alleged</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:19:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 19, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi caute adprehenditur,</quote> <trans><tr>is laid hold of</tr>, <tr>employed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:2:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 2, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3191.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To grasp with the mind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to understand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">comprehend</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">passio apprehensa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 3:5:70" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 3, 5, 70</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Val. 11</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3191.6" n="3" level="3"> For complector, <hi rend="ital">to embrace</hi>, <hi rend="ital">include</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">casum testamento,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:28:2:10" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 28, 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">personam filii (sc. in stipulatione),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:45:1:56" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 45, 1, 56</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3191.7" n="II" level="1"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">to seize</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to take</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">lay hold of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to apprehend</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">a militibus adprehensus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:14:26" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 14, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">furem adprehendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:13:7:11" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 13, 7, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fugitivum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:4:1" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 11, 4, 1</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n3191.8" n="A" level="2"> * In milit. lang., <hi rend="ital">to take possession of</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">adprehendere Hispanias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 10, 8 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 112</bibl>: Pharon prehendit); and in gen. <hi rend="ital">to lay hold of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to get</hi>, <hi rend="ital">secure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">obtain</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">adprehende vitam aeternam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,015:6:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Tim. 6, 12</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">6, 19: justitiam,</quote> <trans><tr>righteousness</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,006:9:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Rom. 9, 30</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3191.9" n="B" level="2"> As med. t., of disease, <hi rend="ital">to seize</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ubi libido veniet nauseae eumque adprehendit, decumbat etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 156, 4</bibl></cit>.—So in gen. <hi rend="ital">of fear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trouble</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">tremor adprehendit eam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,049:49:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Jer. 49, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,024:9:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> 2 Macc. 9, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">angustia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,049:50:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Jer. 50, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stupor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:5:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Luc. 5, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tentatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,007:10:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> 1 Cor. 10, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
apprehensibilis: <entryFree id="n3192" type="main" key="appre^hensi^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">apprĕhensĭbĭlis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adp-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>apprehendo</etym>, <sense id="n3192.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that can be understood</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intelligible</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 3:15" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 3, 15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Val. 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
apprehensio: <entryFree id="n3193" type="main" key="appre^hensi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">apprĕhensĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adp-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym> (late Lat.). <sense id="n3193.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a seizing upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">laying hold of</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">arae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 3, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3193.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">apprehension</hi>, <hi rend="ital">understanding</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 1:8" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 1, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:2:28" default="NO">2, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 5:4 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tard. 5, 4 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
apprendo: <entryFree id="n3194" type="main" key="apprendo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">apprendo</orth>, v. apprehendo.</entryFree>
apprenso: <entryFree id="n3195" type="hapax" key="apprenso"><orth extent="full" lang="la">apprenso</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adp-</orth>), <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n3195.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. freq.</hi> [apprendo, i. e. apprehendo], <hi rend="ital">to seize</hi> something <hi rend="ital">with eagerness;</hi> of the air, <hi rend="ital">to catch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">snuff up</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">naribus auras,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Grat.</author> Cyn. 239</bibl></cit> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:376" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 376</bibl>: patulis captavit naribus auras).</sense></entryFree>
appretio: <entryFree id="n3196" type="main" key="appre^ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ap-prĕtĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adp-</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>pretium</etym> (only in eccl. Lat.). <sense id="n3196.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To value</hi> or <hi rend="ital">estimate at a price</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to appraise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rate</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Res Carn. 20 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl> al.—</sense><sense id="n3196.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To purchase</hi>:<pb n="144" /> <cb n="APPR" />  pretium adpretiati, <hi rend="ital">of him on whom a price was set</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who was bought</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:27:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 27, 9</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">in gen.,</quote> <trans><tr>to appropriate to one's self</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Res. Carn. 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
apprime: <entryFree id="n3197" type="main" key="appri_me_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">apprīmē</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adp-</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos>, v. apprimus.</entryFree>
apprimo: <entryFree id="n3198" type="main" key="appri^mo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ap-prĭmo</orth> (better <orth extent="full" lang="la">adp-</orth>), <itype>essi, essum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n3198.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to press to</hi> (post- Aug. and rare): <cit><quote lang="la">ad ossa carnes adprimere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 1, 5, § 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid pectori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 36, 54, § 128</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:68 al" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 9, 41, § 68 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">adpressit dextram ejus jugulosque occurrit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:16:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 16, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scutum pectori adpressum,</quote> <trans><tr>fitting close to</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 21</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
apprimus: <entryFree id="n3199" type="main" key="appri_mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ap-prīmus</orth> (better <orth extent="full" lang="la">adp-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> (ad <sense id="n3199.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">intens.</hi>), <hi rend="ital">the very first;</hi> only once in Liv. Andron.: <cit><quote lang="la">Ibidemque vir summus adprimus Patroclus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:6:7:11" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 6, 7, 11</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">ap-prīmē</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adp-</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">first of all</hi>, <hi rend="ital">before all</hi>, <hi rend="ital">especially</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exceedingly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very</hi> (most freq. in ante- and post-class. per.; in the class. per. only in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:13:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 13, 4</bibl>; for in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:9:32" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 9, 32</bibl>, the reading should be a primo; v. Madv. ad h. l.; syn.: in primis, praecipue, ante omnia); with <hi rend="ital">adjj.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">verbs.</hi> </sense><sense id="n3199.1" n="A" level="2"> With <hi rend="ital">adjj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">adprime nobilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 1, 2, 6</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:4:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 4, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">adprime probus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:4:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 4, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adprime probo (genere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:2:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 2, 2, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utile,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obsequens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:2:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 2, 2, 5</bibl></cit> (vehementissime, Don.): <cit><quote lang="la">adprime doctus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:2:17" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 2, 17</bibl></cit>: adprime boni, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:13:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 13, 3</bibl>.—Once with the <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi>: adprime summo genere gnatus, Quadrig. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:11:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 11, 7</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n3199.2" n="B" level="2"> With <hi rend="ital">verbs</hi> (post-class.): adprime potuit obtingere Socrati, App. de Deo Socr. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:Flor. 3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Flor. 3</bibl> (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 134</bibl>, the reading of Servius and Arus. Mess. p. 214 Lind. is: flos apprima tenax; apprima being here used as <pos>adv.</pos>, like acerba, acuta al.; for which, however, the best MSS. and editt. have <hi rend="ital">ad prima;</hi> v. Wagn. and Rib. ad h. l.).</sense></entryFree>
approbatio: <entryFree id="n3200" type="main" key="appro^ba_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">apprŏbātĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adp-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>approbo</etym>. <sense id="n3200.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An approving</hi>, <hi rend="ital">allowing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assenting to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">approbation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">acquiescence</hi> (most freq. in Cic.): <cit><quote lang="la">id volgi adsensu et populari approbatione judicari solet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:49:185" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 49, 185</bibl></cit>: <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:1:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 1, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc decorum movet adprobationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:28:98" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 28, 98</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hominum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 23</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">non adprobationes solum movere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:71:236" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 71, 236</bibl></cit>. —Hence, approbatio testium, <hi rend="ital">approbation</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">reception</hi>, Auct. ad <bibl default="NO"><author>Her.</author> 2, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3200.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Proof</hi>, <hi rend="ital">confirmation</hi> (only in Cic.): <cit><quote lang="la">haec propositio indiget approbationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:36" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 36</bibl></cit> and 37: <cit><quote lang="la">assumptionis,</quote> <trans><tr>proof of the minor proposition</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 34</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
