approbator: <entryFree id="n3201" type="main" key="appro^ba_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">apprŏbātor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adp-</orth>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n3201.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who gives his assent</hi> or <hi rend="ital">approval</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an approver</hi> (perh. only in the two foll. exs.): quamvis non fueris suasor et impulsor profectionis meae, adprobator certe fuisti, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 7, 2</bibl>: verbi, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:21:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 21, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
approbe: <entryFree id="n3202" type="main" key="appro^be_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">apprŏbē</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adp-</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos>, v. approbus.</entryFree>
approbo: <entryFree id="n3203" type="main" key="appro^bo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ap-prŏbo</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">adp-</orth>, Fleck., Bait., Halm, Weissenb.; <orth extent="full" lang="la">app-</orth>, Kayser), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n3203.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To assent to as good</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to regard as good</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to approve</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to favor</hi> (freq. and class.; syn.: probo, laudo): id si non fama adprobat, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:4:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 4, 5, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(populus Romanus) meum jus jurandum unā voce et consensu approbavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">approbatā laudatāque Cottae sententiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:34:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 34, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid magno clamore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:10:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Arch. 10, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legiones clamore donum adprobantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 37</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:41" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 41</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilium vehementer adprobare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> ad Q. Fr. 3, 4</bibl></cit> et saep.—So of the gods, <hi rend="ital">to allow a thing to take place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to favor</hi> (cf. admitto, II. B.): <cit><quote lang="la">quod actum est di adprobent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 9, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">musis omnibus adprobantibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 23, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:prol. 13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. prol. 13</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3203.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To show as being good and true</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to make evident</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to prove</hi>, <hi rend="ital">demonstrate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">confirm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">establish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc autem nihil attinet approbari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:36" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 36 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">innocentiam adprobare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">excusationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 42</bibl></cit>.—With <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vivere eos approbant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:57:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 57, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo magis degenerāsse eum a civili more approbaret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:17" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cajo talem et se et exercitum approbavit, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:6 al" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 6 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n3203.2" n="III" level="1"> Aliquid alicui adprobare, <hi rend="ital">to make good to one</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to render acceptable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">satisfactory</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">opus manu factum regi adprobavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 9, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prima castrorum rudimenta duci adprobavit,</quote> <trans><tr>his first military duties he learned to the satisfaction of his commander</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:19:2:24" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 19, 2, 24</bibl>; cf. Herz. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 63</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
approbus: <entryFree id="n3204" type="main" key="appro^bus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ap-prŏbus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adp-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ad <hi rend="ital">intens.;</hi><cb n="APPU" />  cf. apprimus</etym>, <sense id="n3204.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very good</hi> or <hi rend="ital">excellent;</hi> as an <pos>adj.</pos> once: adulescens adprobus, Caecil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:7:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 7, 9</bibl>.—Once as <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ap-prŏbē</orth>: <cit><quote lang="la">ni me ille et ego illum novissem adprobe,</quote> <trans><tr>very well</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:2:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 2, 117</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
appromissor: <entryFree id="n3205" type="main" key="appro_missor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">apprōmissor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adp-</orth>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>appromitto</etym>, <sense id="n3205.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who is security for another</hi>, <hi rend="ital">security</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bail</hi> (only in jurid. Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:45:1:5" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 45, 1, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:46:3:43" default="NO">46, 3, 43</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=13" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
appromitto: <entryFree id="n3206" type="hapax" key="appro_mitto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ap-prōmitto</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adp-</orth>), <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n3206.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to promise in addition to</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">also in one's own name</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cumque id ita futurum T. Roscius Capito appromitteret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:9:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 9, 26</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
approno: <entryFree id="n3207" type="hapax" key="appro_no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ap-prōno</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adp-</orth>), <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n3207.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to bow down forwards;</hi> hence, se, <hi rend="ital">to fall down</hi> (upon the knees), <hi rend="ital">to kneel</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 111</bibl> Elm.</sense></entryFree>
appropero: <entryFree id="n3208" type="main" key="appro^pe^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ap-prŏpĕro</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">adp-</orth>, <itype>Ritschl</itype>, Fleck., Baiter, Halm, Weissenb.; <orth extent="full" lang="la">app-</orth>, <itype>Merkel</itype>, Kayser), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <sense id="n3208.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to hasten</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accelerate</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">festino, accelero, maturo, volo, provolo, curro, accurro): opus adeo adproperatum est, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (res) summā ope adproperata erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 26, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:25" default="NO" valid="yes">27, 25</bibl>: intercisis venis mortem adproperavit, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:16:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 16, 14</bibl> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">adcelerare mortem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:773" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 773</bibl></cit>).—With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> as object: <cit><quote lang="la">portasque intrare patentes Appropera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:584" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 584</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3208.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to fly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hasten</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hurry somewhere</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">adde gradum, adpropera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 3, 3</bibl></cit>: adproperat, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 3, 1, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">eum, ut adproperet, adhorteris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 6, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ad Q. Fr. 2, 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad cogitatum facinus approperare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:chapter=15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
appropinquatio: <entryFree id="n3209" type="main" key="appro^pinqua_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">apprŏpinquātĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adp-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>appropinquo</etym>, <sense id="n3209.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an approach</hi> (in time), <hi rend="ital">drawing near</hi> (very rare; <cit><quote lang="la">perh. only twice in Cic.): adpropinquatio mortis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:11:33" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 11, 33</bibl></cit> Baiter; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:19:66" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 19, 66</bibl>: partus Faustinae, Marc. Aur. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:ad M. Caes. 5:45" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> ad M. Caes. 5, 45</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
appropinquo: <entryFree id="n3210" type="main" key="appro^pinquo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ap-prŏpinquo</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">adp-</orth>, <itype>Baiter</itype>, Weissenb.; <orth extent="full" lang="la">app-</orth>, Kayser), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n3210.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to come near</hi>, <hi rend="ital">draw nigh to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to approach.</hi> </sense><sense id="n3210.1" n="I" level="1"> Of place. </sense><sense id="n3210.2" n="a" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad summam aquam adpropinquare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:23:64" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 4, 23, 64</bibl></cit>: ad portam, Auct. B. Hisp. 3; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2</bibl> al.: <cit><quote lang="la">ad juga montium adpropinquare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 58</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3210.3" n="b" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">finibus Bellovacorum adpropinquare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">munitionibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ejusmodi locis esset adpropinquatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 79</bibl></cit> (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 4, 10</bibl>, and Auct. B. Hisp. 5, the readings vary between the <case>dat.</case> and <case>acc.</case>): <cit><quote lang="la">moenibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:13:8" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 13, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">castris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:10" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> al.—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">illi poena, nobis libertas appropinquat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 4, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">catulus ille, qui jam adpropinquat, ut videat,</quote> <trans><tr>is near seeing</tr>, <tr>will soon see</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:14:48" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 14, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Erant centuriones, qui jam primis ordinibus adpropinquarent,</quote> <trans><tr>were near obtaining the first rank</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 44</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3210.4" n="II" level="1"> Of time: <cit><quote lang="la">jamque hiems adpropinquabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum dies comitiorum adpropinquaret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:34:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 34, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:39:8 al" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 39, 8 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:14 al" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 14 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tuus adventus adpropinquat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rei maturitas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ad Q. Fr. 3, 8 al.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
appropriatio: <entryFree id="n3211" type="hapax" key="appro_^pri^a_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">apprō^prĭātĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adp-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>approprio</etym>, <sense id="n3211.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a making one's own</hi>, <hi rend="ital">appropriation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ciborum (i. e. converting into blood, etc.),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 2:13" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 2, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
approprio: <entryFree id="n3212" type="hapax" key="appro_^pri^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ap-prō^prĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adp-</orth>), <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n3212.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make one's own</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to appropriate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cibum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 4:3" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 4, 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
approximo: <entryFree id="n3213" type="hapax" key="approxi^mo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ap-proxĭmo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adp-</orth>), <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n3213.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be</hi> or <hi rend="ital">draw near to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">approach</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Jud. 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
appugno: <entryFree id="n3214" type="main" key="appugno"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ap-pugno</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">adp-</orth>, Halm), <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n3214.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to fight against</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attack</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assault</hi> (only in Tac. in the three foll. exs.): <cit><quote lang="la">castra adpugnare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">castellum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">classem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 81</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
appuleius: <entryFree id="n3215" type="main" key="Appu^le_ius"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Appŭlēius</orth> (also, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Āpŭl-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n3215.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of several Romans</hi>, among whom the most distinguished were, </sense><sense id="n3215.1" n="I" level="1"> L. Appuleius Saturninus, <hi rend="ital">a turbulent tribune of the people</hi> (about A.U.C. 653): <cit><quote lang="la">post Gracchos eloquentissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:62:224" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 62, 224</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3215.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A native of Madaura</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in Africa</hi>, who was a spirited and flowery, but sometimes bombastic writer of the second century. His principal work yet extant is called Metamorphoseon sive de Asino Aureo libri XI.; cf. Bähr, <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> Gesch. p. 422 sq.; Teuffel, Rom. <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> § 362.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n3215.3" n="III" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Appŭlēius</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Appuleius</hi>: lex, proposed by <cb n="APRI" /> the tribune Appuleius, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:chapter=21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 21</bibl>; id: Leg. 2, 6; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:16" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
appulia: <entryFree id="n3216" type="main" key="Appu_li^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Appūlĭa</orth> (better, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Āpūl-</orth>; v. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:Lagun. Luc. 2:608" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> Lagun. Luc. 2, 608</bibl>; cf. also Jahn ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 4, 10</bibl>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <sense id="n3216.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A province in Lower Italy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at the north of Calabria</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and east of Samnium</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on both sides of the Aufidus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">which divides it into Daunia and Peucetia</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Puglia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 77</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 3, 4, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:3:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 3, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:155" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 155</bibl>; cf. Mann. Ital. 2, 3.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n3216.1" n="II" level="1"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n3216.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Appūlĭcus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Āpūl-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Appulian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mare Apulicum,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>the Adriatic Sea</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:24:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 24, 4</bibl></cit> (K. and H., <hi rend="ital">publicum</hi>).—</sense><sense id="n3216.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Appŭlus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Āpŭl-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, the same: <cit><quote lang="la">gens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:1:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 1, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Daunus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:14:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 4, 14, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Vultur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 4, 9</bibl></cit> al.</sense></entryFree>
appulsus: <entryFree id="n3217" type="main" key="appulsus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">appulsus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adp-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of 1. appello.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n3218" type="main" key="appulsus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">appulsus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adp-</orth>), <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>1. appello</etym>, <sense id="n3218.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a driving to</hi> some place. </sense><sense id="n3218.1" n="I" level="1"> In the lit. signif. only in the jurists: <cit><quote lang="la">pecoris,</quote> <trans><tr>a driving of a flock to drink</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:19:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 43, 19, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3218.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n3218.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A landing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bringing to land</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab litorum appulsu arcere, Liv, 27, 30: oppidum celerrimum adpulsu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">utrinque prora paratam semper adpulsui frontem agit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 44</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3218.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">An approaching</hi>, <hi rend="ital">approach</hi>, in gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">pars terrae adpulsu solis exarsit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:10:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 10, 24</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3218.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">An effect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">influence caused by approach</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">frigoris et caloris adpulsus sentire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:56:141" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 56, 141</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deorum adpulsu homines somniare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:30" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 30 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
apra: <entryFree id="n3219" type="gloss" key="a_^pra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ā^pra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>aper</etym>, <sense id="n3219.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a wild sow</hi>, Plin. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 698</bibl> P.; v. aper.</sense></entryFree>
aprarius: <entryFree id="n3220" type="main" key="a_^pra_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ā^prārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n3220.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">relating to wild hogs</hi> (in jurid. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">retia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:7:22" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 33, 7, 22</bibl></cit>; so Sent. 3, tit. 7.</sense></entryFree>
apricatio: <entryFree id="n3221" type="main" key="a_^pri_ca_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ā^prīcātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>apricor</etym>, <sense id="n3221.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a basking in the sun</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a sunning</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">Unam mehercule tecum apricationem in illo lucrativo tuo sole malim quam etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 11, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi potest illa aetas (senectus) calescere apricatione melius?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:16:57" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 16, 57</bibl></cit> (perh. not elsewhere in Cic.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:8:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 8, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
apricitas: <entryFree id="n3222" type="main" key="a_^pri_ci^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ā^prīcĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>apricus</etym>, <sense id="n3222.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the quality of</hi> apricus, <hi rend="ital">sunniness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sunshine</hi> (only postAug.): <cit><quote lang="la">regio apricitatis inclytae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 16, 18, § 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tepidi aëris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:36:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 36, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diei,</quote> <trans><tr>the clearness of the day</tr>, <tr>sunshine</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:4:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 4, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:15:4" default="NO">8, 15, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
apriclus: <entryFree id="n3223" type="main" key="a_^pri_clus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ā^prīclus</orth>, v. apriculus.</entryFree>
aprico: <entryFree id="n3224" type="main" key="a_^pri_co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ā^prīco</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>apricus</etym>, <sense id="n3224.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to warm in the sun</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 38</bibl>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Carm. ad Cyther. 13, 311</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
apricor: <entryFree id="n3225" type="main" key="a_^pri_cor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ā^prīcor</orth>, <itype>āri</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n3225.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to sun one's self</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bask in the sun</hi>: in sole, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 76, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Alexander offecerat Diogeni apricanti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:32:92" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 32, 92</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:4:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 4, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:184" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 25, 60, § 184</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
apriculus: <entryFree id="n3226" type="main" key="a_^pri^cu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ā^prĭcŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>aper</etym>, <sense id="n3226.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small fish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">similar in appearance to the wild hog</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 296, 34</bibl> Elm. (<bibl default="NO"><author>Enn.</author> ib. 299, 15</bibl>, contracted, apriclus).</sense></entryFree>
apricus: <entryFree id="n3227" type="main" key="a_^pri_cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ā^prīcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>qs. contr. from apericus, from aperio, Doed. Syn. III. p. 170; for the long <hi rend="ital">i</hi>, cf. antīcus, postīcus; acc. t oothers, kindr. with old Germ. ābar; mid. Germ. aeber, = dry, warm</etym>, orig., <sense id="n3227.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">lying open</hi>, <hi rend="ital">uncovered</hi>, or, acc. to the second etymol., <hi rend="ital">warm</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Qui tulit aprico frigida castra Lare,</quote> <trans><tr>under the open heaven</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:5:10:18" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 5, 10, 18</bibl></cit>, where Müller reads <hi rend="ital">e parvo.</hi>—Hence, with esp. ref. to the warmth of the sun, <hi rend="ital">exposed to the sun</hi> or <hi rend="ital">to the warmth of the sun</hi>, <hi rend="ital">open to the sun</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sunny.</hi> </sense><sense id="n3227.1" n="I. A." level="1"> Of places (class. in prose and poetry): <cit><quote lang="la">loci ... opaci an aprici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:chapter=10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Part. Or. 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hortus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 16, 18</bibl></cit> (perh. not elsewhere in Cic.): <cit><quote lang="la">colles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">campus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 8, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:162" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 162</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:18:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 3, 18, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agger,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:8:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 8, 15</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n3227.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ā^prīcum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a sunny spot</hi>, <hi rend="ital">place.</hi> </sense><sense id="n3227.3" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">buxus amat aprica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 16, 28, § 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aprica Alpium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 7, 20, § 43</bibl></cit>.—And </sense><sense id="n3227.4" n="2" level="3"> * <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">in apricum proferre,</quote> <trans><tr>to bring to light</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 6, 24</bibl></cit> (= in apertum, Cruq.).—</sense><sense id="n3227.5" n="C" level="2"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, of other objects exposed to the sun, <hi rend="ital">delighting</hi> or <hi rend="ital">growing in the sunshine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:331" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 331</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mergi,</quote> <trans><tr>basking in the sun</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 128</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:26:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 26, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:179 al" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 179 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n3227.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n3227.7" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Clear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pure</hi> (only in Col.): <cit><quote lang="la">caeli status,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3:27" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 3, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apricissimus dies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:14:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 14, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3227.8" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Coming from the sunny quarter</hi>, i.e. <hi rend="ital">from the south</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">flatus,</quote> <trans><tr>the south wind</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:5:8" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 5, 8</bibl></cit>—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3:24" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 3, 24</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi> not used. <pb n="145" /> <cb n="APTO" /></sense></entryFree>
aprilis: <entryFree id="n3228" type="main" key="A_^pri_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ā^prīlis</orth>, <itype>is</itype> <etym>qs. contr. from aperilis, from aperio; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:33, p. 86" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, 33, p. 86</bibl> Müll.; Cincius ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. G. 1, 43</bibl></etym> (orig. <pos>adj.</pos>; sc. mensis), <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n3228.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the month of April</hi> (as the month in which the earth <hi rend="ital">opens</hi> and softens): <cit><quote lang="la">Sex ubi luces Aprilis habebit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:901" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 901</bibl></cit>.—With mensis expressed: <cit><quote lang="la">mense Aprili,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:39:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 39, 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Qui dies mensem Veneris marinae Findit Aprilem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:11:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 11, 15</bibl></cit>.—<pos>Adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to April</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Nonarum Aprilium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:11:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 11, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 9, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Datis mane a. d. Id. April. Scriptis litteris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,059:2:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ad Brut. 2, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Apriles Idus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:621" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 621</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
aprineus: <entryFree id="n3229" type="main" key="a_^pri_ne^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ā^prīnĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, v. aprinus.</entryFree>
aprinus: <entryFree id="n3230" type="main" key="a_^pri_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ā^prīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>aper</etym>, <sense id="n3230.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the wild boar</hi>: viscus, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 63</bibl> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">pulmo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:222" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 16, 62, § 222</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vesica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:215" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 15, 60, § 215</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fel,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:221" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 16, 62, § 221</bibl></cit>.—As a secondary form, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 69" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 69</bibl>, has twice <orth extent="full" lang="la">ā^prīnĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, if the reading is correct.</sense></entryFree>
apronia: <entryFree id="n3231" type="main" key="a_^pro_ni^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ā^prōnĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n3231.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the plant usually called</hi> bryonia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 1, 17, § 27</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
apronius: <entryFree id="n3232" type="main" key="A_^pro_ni^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ā^prōnĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n3232.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman</hi> nomen. </sense><sense id="n3232.1" n="I" level="1"> Q. Apronius, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:9:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 3, 9, 22</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3232.2" n="II" level="1"> L. Apronius, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 29</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ā^prōnĭā-nus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">originating from Q. Apronius</hi>, <hi rend="ital">named after him</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">convivium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cerasa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 25, 30, § 102</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
aproxis: <entryFree id="n3233" type="main" key="a_^proxis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ā^proxis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n3233.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant whose root</hi>, acc. to Pythagoras, <hi rend="ital">takes fire at a distance</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:158" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 17, 101, § 158</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
apruco: <entryFree id="n3234" type="main" key="a_^pru_co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ā^prūco</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n3234.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the plant commonly called</hi> saxifraga, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 97</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
aprugineus: <entryFree id="n3235" type="main" key="a_^pru_gi^ne^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ā^prūgĭnĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. aprugnus.</entryFree>
aprugnus: <entryFree id="n3236" type="main" key="a_^pru_gnus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ā^prūgnus</orth> (also <orth extent="full" lang="la">ā^prūnus</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>aper</etym>, <sense id="n3236.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the wild boar</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aprugnum callum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 2, 5, 4</bibl></cit> Ritschl; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 3, 2, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aprunus adeps,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:167" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 11, 47, § 167</bibl></cit> Jan: <cit><quote lang="la">lumbus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:210" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 51, 78, § 210</bibl></cit>. —Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">ā^prūgna</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ā^prūna</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (sc. caro), <hi rend="ital">the flesh of a wild boar</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Max. Jun. 2</bibl>.—A secondary form, <orth extent="full" lang="la">ā^prūgĭnĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 32</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
aprusa: <entryFree id="n3237" type="main" key="A_^pru_sa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ā^prūsa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n3237.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river in Umbria near Ariminum</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 15, 50, § 115</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
apsinthium: <entryFree id="n3238" type="main" key="apsinthi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">apsinthĭum</orth>, v. absinthium.</entryFree>
apsis: <entryFree id="n3239" type="main" key="apsis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">apsis</orth>, v. absis.</entryFree>
apsoros: <entryFree id="n3240" type="main" key="Apso^ro^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Apsŏrŏs</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-us</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n3240.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an island in the Adriatic Sea</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7:13" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 7, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
apsus: <entryFree id="n3241" type="main" key="Apsus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Apsus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)/ayos</foreign>, <sense id="n3241.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river of Illyria</hi>, <hi rend="ital">falling into the Ionian Sea</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Crevata</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 27</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
apsyctos: <entryFree id="n3242" type="greek" key="apsycto^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">apsyctŏs</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)/yuktos</foreign> (uncolled), <sense id="n3242.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a precious stone unknown to us</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 54, § 148</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
apsyrtis: <entryFree id="n3243" type="main" key="Apsyrtis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Apsyrtis</orth>, etc., v. 2. Absyrtus.</entryFree>
aptatus: <entryFree id="n3244" type="main" key="apta_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">aptātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. <itype>apto</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos></entryFree>
apte: <entryFree id="n3245" type="main" key="apte_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">aptē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. apo, <sense id="n3245.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
apto: <entryFree id="n3246" type="main" key="apto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">apto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <sense id="n3246.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. freq.</hi> [apo], <hi rend="ital">to fit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">adapt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accommodate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">apply</hi>, <hi rend="ital">put on</hi>, <hi rend="ital">adjust</hi>, etc. (cf. accommodo); <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, with <case>dat.</case> or less freq. with <hi rend="ital">ad</hi> (in Cic. only once, as <pos>P. a.</pos>). </sense><sense id="n3246.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n3246.2" n="a" level="4"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">aptat cristas telaque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arma aptare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:49:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 49, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">remos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:9:12" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 9, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tabulam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:56:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 56, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jubas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:5:166" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 5, 166</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">armamenta, vela,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:7:23" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 7, 23</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3246.3" n="b" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid umeris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:364" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 364</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arma corpori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:34:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 34, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vincula collo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:381" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 381</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">claves foribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:47" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sagittas nervo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 131</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dexteris enses,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:7:2" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 7, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tela flagello,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:731" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 731</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">os cucurbitulae corpori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anulum sibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 3:25:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 3, 25, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">digito (anulum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:73" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 73</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3246.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n3246.5" n="a" level="4"> With the access. idea of fitting: <cit><quote lang="la">bella citharae modis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:12:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 12, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 3, 13</bibl>.—And with <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed usum nec ad commoditatem ferendi nec ad ipsius munitionis firmamentum aptaverunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 5, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad transeundum omnia aptaverant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:8:8" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 8, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad militares remus aptatur manus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>is taken in hand by the soldiers</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Agam. 425" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Agam. 425</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3246.6" n="b" level="4"> Without the access. idea of fitting, <hi rend="ital">to prepare</hi>, <hi rend="ital">get ready</hi>, <hi rend="ital">furnish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">put in order;</hi> constr. <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, with <case>dat.</case> or <hi rend="ital">ad.</hi> </sense><sense id="n3246.7" n="(a)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: aptate convivium, Pomp. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 234, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">idonea bello,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 2, 111</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n3246.8" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">arma pugnae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aptat se pugnae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:588" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 588</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and, animos aptent armis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 259</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3246.9" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aptat et armiferas miles ad arma manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:13:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 13, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad pugnam classem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 5</bibl></cit>: ad primum se velut aspectum <cb n="APUD" /> orationis aptare, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:2:16" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 2, 16</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n3246.10" n="c" level="4"> With <case>abl.</case> of that with which something is fitted, furnished, provided: <cit><quote lang="la">oppidi partes testudinibus et musculis, Auct. B. Alex. 1: biremes remigio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">classem velis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 472</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">pinum armamentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:456" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 456</bibl></cit>: ut quisque se aptaverat armis, <hi rend="ital">had fitted himself with arms</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">for battle</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 31</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">aptātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, pr., <hi rend="ital">fitted</hi> for something; thus, <hi rend="ital">suitable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">appropriate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accommodated</hi> to (syn.: aptus, accommodatus): hoc verbum est ad id aptatum, quod ante dixerat, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:40:162" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 40, 162</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad popularem delectationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:10:11" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 10, 11</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 6 al" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 6 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia rei aptata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 59" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 59</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
aptota: <entryFree id="n3247" type="greek" key="apto_ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">aptōta</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">nomina</orth>), <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)/ptwta</foreign> (without case); in gram., <sense id="n3247.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">substantives that are not declined</hi>, <hi rend="ital">aptotes</hi> (e. g. dicis, fas, frit, git, etc.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 287</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> 5, p. 669</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
aptus: <entryFree id="n3248" type="main" key="aptus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">aptus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. <itype>apo</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos></entryFree>
apua: <entryFree id="n3249" type="main" key="apua"><orth extent="full" lang="la">apua</orth>, v. aphya.</entryFree>
apud: <entryFree id="n3250" type="main" key="a^pu^d"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăpŭd</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">apud</orth> down to the time of Cæsar, Corp. Inscr. I. 30; I. 196; and after 45 B. C. both <orth extent="full" lang="la">apud</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 206</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">818</bibl>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">aput</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 206</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">34</bibl>; another form of apud was <orth extent="full" lang="la">apor</orth>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=26" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 26</bibl> Müll. <orth extent="full" lang="la">apud</orth>, <itype>Ritschl</itype>, Rib. in Trag. et Com. Rel., Müll. in Lucil., and Dietsch in Sall.; <orth extent="full" lang="la">aput</orth>, Lachm., Fleck. in Plaut.; both <orth extent="full" lang="la">apud</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">aput</orth>, Müll. in Cat. and Rib. in Verg.) [Corssen once regarded apud as connected with apisci, as juxta with jungo, Ausspr. I. p. 335, 1st ed., but afterwards, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:2d" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 2d</bibl> ed. I. p. 197, he adopted Pott's view, that it was comp. of Sanscr. api, = to, toward, near (Gr. <foreign lang="greek">e)pi/</foreign>), and ad, old form ar, which view the form apor favors, and thus its strict meaning would be <sense id="n3250.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">on to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unto;</hi> <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>, IV.]; <pos>prep.</pos> gov. <case>acc.</case>, <hi rend="ital">with</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at</hi>, <hi rend="ital">by</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near</hi> (regularly with words denoting rest, and primarily of persons, while <hi rend="ital">ad</hi> properly designates only direction, motion, extension, etc., and is chiefly used of places; the diff. between apud and penes is given in Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=22" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 22</bibl> Müll.: apud et penes in hoc differunt, quod alterum personam cum loco significat, alterum personam et dominium ac potestatem; v. penes, and cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Them. 7, 2</bibl>: ad ephoros Lacedaemoniorum accessit, penes quos summum imperium erat, atque apud eos (v. infra, I. B. 2. a.) contendit, etc.; and for the difference between ad and apud, cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0043,001:9:58 sq" default="NO"><author>Lucil.</author> 9, 58 sq.</bibl> Müll.: apud se longe alid est, neque idem valet ad se: Intro nos vocat ad sese, tenet intus apud se; syn.: ad, prope, coram, inter, in with <case>abl.</case>; rare in early Lat.; very freq. in Plaut., less freq. in Ter., seven times in Verg., five times in Juv., three times in Catull., twice in Ov, and once in Hor. and Prop.; never in Tib. or Pers.; very freq. in Cic., the historians, and the Vulg.). </sense><sense id="n3250.1" n="I. A." level="1"> In designating nearness in respect of persons, <hi rend="ital">with</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near</hi>: apud ipsum adstas, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 522, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">adsum apud te, genitor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit> p. 522, 32: <cit><quote lang="la">alteram (partem) apud me adponito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:3:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 3, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc hic apud te servio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:2:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 2, 2, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scriptorum non magnast copia apud me,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:68:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 68, 33</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">mane apud me,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:29:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 29, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Advocatum habemus apud Patrem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,023:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> 1 Joan. 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum in lecto Crassus esset et apud eum Sulpicius sederet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 3, 12</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:chapter=26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 26</bibl>, and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 3, 28</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3250.2" n="B" level="2"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n3250.3" n="1. a." level="1"> With a <hi rend="ital">pron.</hi> or <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>, apud me, te, se, aliquem, etc., <hi rend="ital">with me</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in my house</hi>, etc., <hi rend="ital">in one's house</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at the house of a person;</hi> Fr. <hi rend="ital">chez moi</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chez vous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chez soi</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">Quis heri apud te? Naev., Com. Rel. p. 9 Rib.: dico eum esse apud me,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 2, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 2, 73</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic apud me hortum confodere jussi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:2:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 2, 2, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si commodumst, apud me, sis, volo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:1:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 1, 1, 110</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">condixerant cenam apud me, Turp., Com. Rel. p. 108 Rib.: quid nunc virgo? Nempe apud test?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:159" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 159</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Quid sibi volunt homines isti apud te?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,004:22:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Num. 22, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:26:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Matt. 26, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cenabis bene apud me,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 13, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apud me habitavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:chapter=33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 4, 111</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 77</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">apud te cenavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:chapter=58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 58</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 4, 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:chapter=26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:chapter=32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Deiot. 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in curiā posita potius quam rure apud te, Titin., Com. Rel. p. 142 Rib.: mane apud me etiam hodie,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,026:19:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Jud. 19, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenet intus apud se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0043,001:9:59" default="NO"><author>Lucil.</author> 9, 59</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">Pompeius petiit, ut secum et apud se essem cotidie,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apud se fecit manere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,026:19:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Jud. 19, 7</bibl></cit>; ib. Luc. <cb n="APUD" /> 11, 37: <cit><quote lang="la">de gladiis, quae apud ipsum erant deprehensa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cum postridie apud eundem ventum exspectans manerem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mansit apud eum quattuor mensibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,026:19:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Jud. 19, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:28:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Act. 28, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">apud quem deversatus es,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 4, 37</bibl></cit>: apud nympham Calypsonem, Liv. And. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 685</bibl> (cf. Hom. Od. 4, 557: <foreign lang="greek">*nu/mfhs e)n mega/roisi *kaluyou=s</foreign>): <cit><quote lang="la">habitāsti apud Heium Messanae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 4, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:chapter=51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 51</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Fuisti apud Laecam illā nocte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 4, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:22:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 22, 104</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">apud Ostorium Scapulam epulatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apud Cornelium Primum juxta Velabrum delituit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 3, 74</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Factum est, ut moraretur apud Simonem quendam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:9:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 9, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">invenient hominem apud sororem tuam occultantem se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:chapter=83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Dom. 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui apud te esset eductus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,001:chapter=69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Quinct. 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apud quem erat educatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:20:75" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 20, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum alter ejus filius apud matrem educaretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:chapter=27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">disciplinā C. Cassii, apud quem educatus erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se apud Q. Mucium jus civile didicisse,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apud eosdem magistratus institutus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:24" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">servorum manus tamquam apud senem festinantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in convivio apud regem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 2, 57</bibl></cit>: Bene vale; <cit><quote lang="la">apud Orcum te videbo,</quote> <trans><tr>in the abode of Orcus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:3:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 3, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacrificāsse apud deos, i. e. in templis deorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frater apud Othonem militans,</quote> <trans><tr>in the army of Otho</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 26</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">nec solum apud Caecinam (cognoscebatur id damnum composuisse),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quorum sint legati apud se,</quote> <trans><tr>in his camp</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 8</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Quos cum apud se in castris Ariovistus conspexisset,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dici hoc potest, Apud portitores eas (litteras) resignatas sibi,</quote> <trans><tr>at the custom-house</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:3:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 3, 64</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 3, 80</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Quantillum argenti mihi apud trapezitam siet,</quote> <trans><tr>at the banker's</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:1:2:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 1, 2, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">duo genera materiarum apud rhetoras tractantur, i. e. in scholis rhetorum, as he says just before,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 35</bibl></cit>.—Apud me etc. is sometimes added to domi or in aedibus, or interchanges with domi: <hi rend="ital">Me.</hi> Ubi namst, quaeso? <hi rend="ital">Ch.</hi> Apud me domi, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 1, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">a me insidias apud me domi positas esse dixerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:chapter=41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domi esse apud sese archipiratas dixit duos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 5, 73</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:27:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 27, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (signa) cognovi apud istum in aedibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:chapter=50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">esse illa signa domi suae, non esse apud Verrem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil apud hanc lautum, pistor domi nullus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:chapter=67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 67</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:chapter=165" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 165</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n3250.4" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: apud se esse, <hi rend="ital">to be at home</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to be in one's senses</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be one's self</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be sane</hi> (only in conversational lang.; most freq. in Ter.; cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">e)n e(autw=| ei)=nai</foreign>, Ar. Vesp. 642; opp. vecors, amens esse, <hi rend="ital">to be out of one's wits</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beside one's self;</hi> so Gr. <foreign lang="greek">frenw=n e)cesta/nai</foreign>, Eur. Or. 1021): <cit><quote lang="la">Sumne ego apud me?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:8:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 8, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Non sum apud me,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:4:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 1, 4, 26</bibl></cit>, and Afran., Com. Rel, p. 170 Rib.: <cit><quote lang="la">Prae iracundiā, Menedeme, non sum apud me,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:1:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 1, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Vix sum apud me: ita animus commotust metu, spe, gaudio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:4:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. 5, 4, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Num tibi videtur esse apud sese?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:4:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 4, 4, 85</bibl></cit> (quasi ob amorem meretricis insanus, Don.): <cit><quote lang="la">proin tu fac, apud te ut sies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. 2, 4, 5</bibl></cit> (= ut praeparatus sis, Don.); <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 129</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3250.5" n="2" level="3"> In respect of persons, in whose presence or before whom any thing is done or takes place, esp. of discussions or debates in which the persons have the right of decision (Web. Uebungsch. p. 33), <hi rend="ital">before</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the presence of</hi>, = coram, ad. </sense><sense id="n3250.6" n="a" level="4"> Of civil or military affairs, <hi rend="ital">before</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum res agatur apud praetorem populi Romani et apud severissimos judices,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:chapter=3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Arch. 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apud eosdem judices reus est factus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:22:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 22, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vis de his judicari apud me?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:25:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 25, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">accusavit fratres suos apud patrem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:37:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Gen. 37, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,023:7:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> 1 Macc. 7, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,004:5:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Joan. 5, 45</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc, quod nunc apud pontifices agis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:chapter=51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Dom. 51</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">117</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">istud ne apud eum quidem dictatorem quisquam egit isto modo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,033:chapter=12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Lig. 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui hanc causam aliquotiens apud te egit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,001:chapter=30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Quinct. 30</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:chapter=100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 100</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 114</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:chapter=69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 69</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:chapter=120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 120</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(populus Romanus) mihi potestatem apud se agendi dedit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:173" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 5, 173</bibl></cit>: Repulsior secundā collatione dixit Cato in eā, quae est contra Cornelium apud populum, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=286" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 286</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">tutoresne defendent apud istius modi praetorem?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:chapter=153" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 153</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:chapter=126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 126</bibl>: apud te cum sim defensurus me, Vulg. Act. <pb n="146" /> <cb n="APUD" /> 26, 2: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia apud praetores gererentur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causam nescio quam apud judicem defendebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:chapter=74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 74</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">apud te defendit alium in eā voluntate non fuisse, in quā te,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,033:chapter=6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Lig. 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apud judicem causam dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,001:chapter=43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Quinct. 43</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:chapter=26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 1, 26</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sex. Rosc. 85</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">apud aliquem dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,033:chapter=6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Lig. 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:chapter=4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Deiot. 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba apud senatum fecit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">habitā apud senatum oratione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">6, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec apud patres disseruit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 43</bibl></cit>; 4, 2; <cit><quote lang="la">4, 6: modeste apud vos socius populi Romani questus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 4, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Quae est ergo apud Caesarem querella?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,033:chapter=25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Lig. 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">isne apud vos obtinebit causam, qui etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:chapter=38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">petita multa est apud eum praetorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:chapter=155" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 1, 155</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causam contra aliquem apud centumviros dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:23:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 23, 98</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 38</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">numerus oratorum quot annis apud magistratus publice subscribitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 3, 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apud eorum quem qui manumitteretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 9</bibl></cit>: apud proconsules aliquem manumittere, Marcian. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:162" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 162</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3250.7" n="b" level="4"> In extra judicial cases, <hi rend="ital">before</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">apud hunc confessus es et genus etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:3:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 3, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullam causam dico, quin mihi Et parentum et libertatis apud te deliquio siet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 4, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apud erum qui (servos) vera loquitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:1:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 2, 1, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apud novercam querere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego apud parentem loquor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,033:chapter=30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Lig. 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plura fateri apud amicos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid apud aliquem laudare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 46</bibl>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:12:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 12, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem apud aliquos vituperare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apud quem tu etiam nos criminari soles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:chapter=29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Vatin. 29</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3250.8" n="c" level="4"> Of one's feelings, views, judgment, <hi rend="ital">with</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the view</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sight of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">before.</hi> </sense><sense id="n3250.9" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">verbs</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">apud Tenedios sanctissimus deus habetur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 61</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:chapter=49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 1, 49</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod apud illos amplissimum sacerdotium putatur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 126</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">1, 69: si tutoris auctoritas apud te ponderis nihil habebat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 55</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:chapter=4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">apud judicem grave et sanctum esse ducetur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Q. Rosc. 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Quae omnia apud nos partim infamia ... ponuntur, Nep. praef. 5: justificatur apud Deum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,009:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gal. 3, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec apud illos barbatos ridicula videbantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:chapter=26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:chapter=101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dom. 101</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">unus dies apud Dominum (est) sicut mille anni, et mille anni sicut dies unus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> 2</bibl></cit> Pet. 3, 8.—</sense><sense id="n3250.10" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">adjj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fuisti apud pontifices superior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:chapter=4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Dom. 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui honos est apud Syracusanos amplissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 4, 137</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:chapter=36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Font. 36</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam clara (expugnatio) apud omnes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:chapter=50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 1, 50</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 50</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Satis clarus est apud timentem quisquis timetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 76</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc est apud Graecos prope gloriosius quam Romae triumphāsse,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 5, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod aeque apud bonos miserum est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae justa sunt apud nos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,023:11:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Macc. 11, 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,006:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Rom. 2, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tunc eritis inculpabiles apud Dominum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,004:32:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Num. 32, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si is pretio apud istum idoneus esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:chapter=121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 121</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3250.11" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">substt.</hi>:
