<cit><quote lang="la">est tanta apud eos ejus fani religio atque antiquitas, ut etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:chapter=46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tanta nominis Romani dignitas est apud omnes nationes, ut etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 150</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quā (hic) apud omnes Siculos dignitate atque existimatione sit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 111</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Dymnus modicae apud regem auctoritatis et gratiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:72" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">abominatio est uterque apud Deum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,029:17:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Prov. 17, 15</bibl></cit>.—Apud animum, apud animum meum, etc. sometimes stand for mihi, mecum, etc., or simply animo: Ea tute tibi subice et apud animum propone, <hi rend="ital">before your mind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">before you</hi>, Sulp. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsi primum statuerint apud animos, quid vellent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:39:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 39, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sic apud animum meum statuo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:de Ord. Rep. 2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> de Ord. Rep. 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic statuere apud animum meum possum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 2, 4</bibl></cit>.—So with <hi rend="ital">pers. pron.</hi> in Vulg. after the Greek: haec apud se (<foreign lang="greek">pro\s e(auto/n</foreign>) oravit, <hi rend="ital">within himself</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to himself</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:18:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 18, 11</bibl>: Sciens apud semet ipsum (<foreign lang="greek">e)n e(autw=|</foreign>), <hi rend="ital">in himself</hi>, Joan. 6, 62: statui hoc ipsum apud me (<foreign lang="greek">e)mautw=|</foreign>), ne etc., <hi rend="ital">with myself</hi>, 2 Cor. 2, 1; so, hoc cogitet apud se (<foreign lang="greek">e)f) e(autou=</foreign>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:10:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> 10, 7</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n3250.12" n="d" level="4"> And simply <hi rend="ital">before</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the presence of</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">id apud vos proloquar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:prol. 6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. prol. 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nemo est meorum amicorum, apud quem expromere omnia mea occulta audeam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 3, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se jactant apud eos, quos inviti vident,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">licet mihi, Marce fili, apud te gloriari, ad quem etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:22:78" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 22, 78</bibl></cit>: de vobis glorior apud <cb n="APUD" /> Macedones, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,008:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Cor. 9, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">plus quam apud vos commemorari velitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:chapter=77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non apud indoctos loquor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:chapter=68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ostendit, quae quisque de eo apud se dixerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid apud magnum loquerentur Achillem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 163</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque raro neque apud paucos talia jaciebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loqui de se apud aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mentiri apud aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:1:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 1, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apud aliquem profiteri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:7:24" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 7, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Non est nobis haec oratio habenda apud imperitam multitudinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:chapter=61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caesar apud milites contionatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gratias agere alicui apud aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:chapter=4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 4</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quid (in me) auctoritatis est, apud eos utar, qui etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:chapter=2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 2</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,033:chapter=16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Lig. 16</bibl>, and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,019:chapter=24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Red. in Sen. 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Quae fundebat apud Samson lacrimas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,026:14:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Jud. 14, 16</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3250.13" n="3" level="3"> Of a person <hi rend="ital">with whom</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in whose case</hi> something is, exists, is done, <hi rend="ital">with</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the case of</hi>, often = <hi rend="ital">in with abl.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quom apud te parum stet fides,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:5:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 5, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Et bene apud memores veteris stat gratia facti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:539" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 539</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">At fides mihi apud hunc est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <hi rend="ital">De.</hi> Quid est? <hi rend="ital">Ch.</hi> Itan parvam mihi fidem esse apud te? <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:3:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 5, 3, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut apud me praemium esse positum pietati scias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 4, 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alioqui mercedem non habebitis apud Patrem vestrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illa res quantam declarat ejusdem hominis apud hostes populi Romani auctoritatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:chapter=46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(eum) Aeduorum auctoritatem apud omnes Belgas amplificaturum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si M. Petrei non summa auctoritas apud milites exstitisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:chapter=12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pompei auctoritas apud omnes tanta est. quanta etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 13, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ecquid auctoritatis apud vos socii populi Romani habere debeant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:chapter=17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 17</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:chapter=14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 14</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Mur 38</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(servi) apud eum sunt in honore et pretio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sex. Rosc. 77</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:157" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 5, 157</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 3, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">videmus quantā sit in invidiā quantoque in odio apud quosdam virtus et industria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:181" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 5, 181</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo majore apud vos odio esse debet quam etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domi splendor, apud exteras nationes nomen et gratia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:chapter=154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 154</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:chapter=38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 38</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Dumnorigem, magnā apud plebem gratiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tanti ejus apud se gratiam esse ostendit, uti etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">certe apud te et hos, qui tibi adsunt, veritas valebit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,001:chapter=5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Quinct. 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:chapter=17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,033:chapter=30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Lig. 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,032:chapter=14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Marcell. 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:chapter=34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 34</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">utrum apud eos pudor atque officium aut timor valeret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apud quem ut multum gratiā valeret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,009:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Con. 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">video apud te causas valere plus quam preces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,033:chapter=31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Lig. 31</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:4:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 4, 13</bibl>, and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 36</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod apud vos plurimum debebit valere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:chapter=11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Div. in Caecil. 11</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 17</bibl>, and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 73</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui tantum auctoritate apud suos cives potuit, ut etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:chapter=113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 113</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">speravit sese apud tales viros aliquid posse ad etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sex. Rosc. 141</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(eum) apud finitimas civitates largiter posse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (pecunia) apud me contra fidem meam nihil potuisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:chapter=19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (memoria) plus apud eum possit quam salus civitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 5, 51</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 3, 131</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui apud eum plurimum poterat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 130</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui apud me et amicitiā et beneficiis et dignitate plurimum possunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sex. Rosc. 4</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 9</bibl>.—So very rarely with <hi rend="ital">adjj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">faciles sunt preces apud eos, qui etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,021:chapter=63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Har. Resp. 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil me turpius apud homines fuisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apud quos miserum auxilium tolerabile miserius malum fecit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 23</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3250.14" n="4" level="3"> Of persons, of inhabitants of cities or countries, among whom one is, or something is, is done or happens, <hi rend="ital">among</hi> = inter: <cit><quote lang="la">CONSOL. QVEI. FVIT. APVD. VOS., Epit. Scip. ap. Grotef. Gr. II. p. 296: homines apud nos noti, inter suos nobiles,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ut vos hic, itidem ille apud vos meus servatur filius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 2, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 2, 62</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui (colonus) perigrinatur apud vos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:12:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 12, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui regnabat apud vos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,023:12:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> 1 Macc. 12, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:13:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Matt. 13, 56</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:9:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Luc. 9, 41</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si iste apud eos quaestor non fuisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:chapter=4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Div. in Caecil. 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">65</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Apud eos fuisse regem Divitiacum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui (praetores) apud illos a populo creantur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apud quos consul fuerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:chapter=66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 66</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:chapter=5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 108</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">apud inferos illi antiqui supplicia impiis constituta esse voluerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 4, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:5:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 5, 10</bibl>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,034:14:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Eccli. 14, 17</bibl>: Sunt apud infernos tot milia <cb n="APUD" /> formosarum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:2:63" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 2, 63</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fateri quae quis apud superos distulit in seram commissa piacula mortem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:568" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 568</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">Vel. 2, 48, 2: studiis militaribus apud juventutem obsoletis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:chapter=42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Font. 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui apud socios nominis Latini censi essent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui apud gentes solus praestat, Naev., Com. Rel. p. 25 Rib.: quae sacra apud omnes gentes nationesque fiunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 4, 109</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id (simulacrum) apud Segestanos positum fuisse,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si apud Athenienses non deerant qui rem publicam defenderent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:chapter=141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 141</bibl></cit>, and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Milt. 6, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille est magistratus apud Siculos, qui etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:chapter=131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 131</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si tu apud Persas deprehensus etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 166</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Apud Helvetios longe nobilissimus fuit Orgetorix,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apud omnes Graecos hic mos est, ut etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:chapter=158" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 158</bibl></cit>, and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,062:B. 7:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fragm. B. 7, 18</bibl> B. and K.: <cit><quote lang="la">quod apud Germanos ea consuetudo esset, ut etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliis Germanorum populis usurpatum raro apud Chattos in consensum vertit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cui (mihi) neque apud Danaos usquam locus (est),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apud Nahanarvalos antiquae religionis lucus ostenditur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 43</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">32</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">38</bibl>; 44; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 56</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 61</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 2, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 45</bibl>: apud Graecos magis quam in ceteris nationibus exculta est medicina, Cels. praef. 3, 9.—So of an army, <hi rend="ital">in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with</hi>, where <hi rend="ital">in with abl.</hi> is commonly used: <cit><quote lang="la">qui apud exercitum cum Lucio Lucullo est,</quote> <trans><tr>in the army under L. Lucullus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 4, 49</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:chapter=11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Arch. 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">apud exercitum mihi fueris tot annos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:chapter=45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod Hannibalem etiam nunc cum imperio apud exercitum haberent,</quote> <trans><tr>in the army with a command</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Hann. 7, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">simul manere apud exercitus Titum utile videbatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 5, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod XII. pondo argenti habuisset apud exercitum,</quote> <trans><tr>with his troops</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 4, 50, § 143</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3250.15" n="5" level="3"> In designating the author of a work or of an assertion, apud aliquem, <hi rend="ital">in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">by</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the writings of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">any one</hi> (the work itself being designated by <hi rend="ital">in with abl.;</hi> as, de quā in Catone majore satis multa diximus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:42:151" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 42, 151</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Socraiem illum, qui est in Phaedro Platonis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:7:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 7, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo in libro,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 11, 47</bibl></cit>): <cit><quote lang="la">ut scriptum apud eundem Caelium est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:26:55" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 26, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apud Xenophontem autem moriens Cyrus major haec dicit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:22:79" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 22, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod apud Platonem est in philosophos dictum, quod etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:9:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 9, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apud Agathoclem scriptum in historiā est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:24:50" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 24, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut est apud poëtam nescio quem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Quod enim est apud Ennium, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:8:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 8, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de quā (ambitione) praeclare apud eundem est Platonem, simile etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 25, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Apud Varronem ita est, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:348" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 35, 79, § 348</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut video scriptum apud Graecos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,029:chapter=4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Scaur. 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">invenio apud quosdam auctores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 37</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 1, 81</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">reperio apud scriptores,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apud Solonem,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>in his laws</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:26:64" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 26, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui bono est, si apud te Agamemnon diserte loquitur, i. e. in tragoediis tuis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 9</bibl></cit>. —Also of speakers: <cit><quote lang="la">apud quosdam acerbior in conviciis narrabatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 22</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n3250.16" n="6. a." level="1"> Est aliquid apud aliquem = est alicui aliquid, apud aliquem being equivalent to <hi rend="ital">dat. of possessor</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (scientia auguralis) mihi videtur apud majores fuisse dupliciter, ut etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:13:33" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 13, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juris civilis magnum usum apud multos fuisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:41:152" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 41, 152</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum apud eum summum esset imperium populi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,019:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Phoc. 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnis gratia, potentia, honos, divitiae apud illos sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 20:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 20, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">par gloria apud Hannibalem hostesque Poenos erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:30:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 30, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apud quos nulla loricarum galearumve tegmina (erant),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecuniam ac dona majora apud Romanos (esse),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">minorem esse apud victos animum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 1</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">2, 75: quando quidem est apud te virtuti honos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 1, 15</bibl></cit>: Phoebo sua semper apud me Munera sunt, <hi rend="ital">Phœbus has his gifts with me</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">I have his gifts for Phœbus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:3:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 3, 62</bibl>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:29:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 29, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">apud te est fons vitae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:35:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 35, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apud Dominum (est) misericordia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> ib. 129, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3250.17" n="b" level="4"> Est aliquid apud aliquem also simply denotes that <hi rend="ital">something is in one's hands</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in his power</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at his disposal</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">erat ei apud me pauxillulum Nummorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 1, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">negāsse habere se (phaleras): apud alium quoque eas habuisse depositas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 4, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa (signa) deposita apud amicos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apud quem inventus est scyphus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:44:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 44, 16</bibl></cit>; ib. <pb n="147" /> <cb n="APUD" /> Exod. 22, 4; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,005:24:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Deut. 24, 12</bibl>.—So also of persons: <cit><quote lang="la">te pix atra agitet apud carnuficem,</quote> <trans><tr>in the hands of</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:4:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 4, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui (obsides) apud eum sint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 33</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3250.18" n="c" level="4"> Apud aliquem = alicui, <hi rend="ital">the dat. of indir. obj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">remanet gloria apud me, Att., Trag. Rel. p. 194 Rib.: nihil apud Siculum, nihil apud civem Romanum totā in Siciliā reliquisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si (cura rei publicae) apud Othonem relinqueretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui judicia manere apud ordinem Senatorium volunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:chapter=8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Div. in Caecil. 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque praemia caedis apud interfectorem mansura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 70</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 15, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fidens apud aliquem obligare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:16:1:27" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 16, 1, 27</bibl></cit>.—So rarely with <hi rend="ital">adjj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Essetne apud te is servos acceptissimus?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:5:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 5, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non dicam amicum tuum, quod apud homines carissimum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:chapter=110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 110</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apud publicanos gratiosus fuisti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 169</bibl></cit>; 4, 38; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 76</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,033:chapter=31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Lig. 31</bibl>: Apud homines hoc impossibile est; <cit><quote lang="la">apud Deum autem omnia possibilia sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:19:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 19, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,002:10:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Marc. 10, 27</bibl>.</sense><sense id="n3250.19" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> In designations of place, </sense><sense id="n3250.20" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">At</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near</hi>, <hi rend="ital">about</hi>, <hi rend="ital">around</hi>, <hi rend="ital">before</hi> (esp. freq. in the post-Aug. histt.) = ad, prope, circum, ante: tibi servi multi apud mensam adstant, Naev. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 893</bibl> P. (Com. Rel. p. 10 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">verecundari neminem apud mensam decet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Quid apud hasce aedīs negotii est tibi?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:194" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 1, 194</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Quid illisce homines quaerunt apud aedīs meas?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:4:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 4, 2, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 4, 2, 25</bibl>: apud ignem adsidere, Turp. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 522, 26</bibl> (Com. Rel. p. 100 Rib.); Sisenn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 86, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">navem is fregit apud Andrum insulam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:3:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 3, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apud Tenedum pugna illa navalis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:chapter=21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Arch. 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut apud Salamina classem suam constituerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Them. 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apud oppidum morati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agri in Hispaniā apud Karthaginem Novam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellatum apud Actium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 72</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 76</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pugnabant alii tardis apud Ilion armis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 163</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">morabatur in castris apud Galgalam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,006:10:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Jos. 10, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quidquid apud durae cessatum est moenia Trojae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:288" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 288</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apud vetustam turrem, Att., Trag. Rel. p. 189 Rib.: apud castellum consedisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Vitellianos, sua quemque apud signa, componunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 3, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apud vexillum tendentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 1, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">trepidatur apud naves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostis est non apud Anienem, sed in urbe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:chapter=84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 84</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:10:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 10, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam detraxerat apud rapidum Simoenta sub Ilio alto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:261" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 261</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apud abunaantem amnem et rapidas undas Inachi, Att., Trag. Rel. p. 175 Rib.: apud gelidi flumina Hebri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:331" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 331</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">octo apud Rhenum legiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apud ripam Rheni,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">probavi te apud Aquam Contradictionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:80:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 80, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">repertus apud fretum Siciliae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">propitiata Juno apud proximum mare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apud promunturium Miseni consedit in villā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ut aput nivem et ferarum gelida stabula forem, for in nive etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:63:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 63, 53</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">apud altaria deūm pepigere,</quote> <trans><tr>before</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">decernuntur supplicationes apud omnia pulvinaria,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 12</bibl></cit> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">unum diem circa omnia pulvinaria supplicatio fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 9</bibl></cit>): <cit><quote lang="la">apud Caesaris effigiem procubuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">13, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quartum apud lapidem substiterat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laudavit ipse apud rostra (for pro rostris),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:16:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 16, 6</bibl></cit>; so, apud forum (cf.: ad forum under ad, I. A. 3., and in Gr. Sophocl. Trach. 371, <foreign lang="greek">pro\s me/sh| a)gora=|</foreign>; <cit><quote lang="la">on the other hand,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 423</bibl></cit>, <foreign lang="greek">e)n me/sh| a)gora=|</foreign>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 524</bibl>, <foreign lang="greek">thlaugei= par) o)/xqw|</foreign>): Quidam apud forum mihi vendidit, Pomp., Com. Rel. p. 250 Rib.: <hi rend="ital">Ch.</hi> Quī scis? <hi rend="ital">By.</hi> Apud forum modo e Davo audivi, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 5, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Capuae multa apud forum aedificia de caelo tacta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 9</bibl></cit> (Weissenb., <hi rend="ital">in foro</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">quod (templum) apud forum holitorium C. Duilius struxerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 49</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3250.21" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">At</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in</hi> = <hi rend="ital">in with abl.</hi> or <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> or <hi rend="ital">abl. of place</hi>: CONSVLES SENATVM CONSOLVERVNT N. OCTOB. APVD AEDEM DVELONAI, S. C. de Bacch. I.; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ejus statuam majores apud aedem matris deūm consecravisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apud villam est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:22:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 4, 22, 48</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Eum argentum sumpsisse apud Thebas ab danistā fenore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:2:2:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deponere apud Solos in delubro pecuniam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:16:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 16, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut rationes apud duas civitates possim relinquere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 6, 7, 2</bibl></cit>: qui mense<cb n="AQUA" />  Aprili apud Baias essent, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,062:B. 13:4:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fragm. B. 13, 4, 1</bibl> B. and K.; <cit><quote lang="la">13, 4, 4 iid.: seditio militum coepta apud Sucronem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">donum apud Antium statuitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellis civilibus Maecenatem equestris ordinis cunctis apud Romam atque Italiam praeposuit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Titus in consecrando apud Memphim bove Apide diadema gestavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tit.:5" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tit. 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod Judaeam praeterveniens apud Hierosolymam non supplicāsset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:93" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apud Mediolanum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> Mort. Persec. 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eum pugionem apud Capitolium consecravit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Equitum Romanorum locos sedilibus plebis anteposuit apud Circum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (effigies) apud theatrum Pompei locaretur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui (rei) apud aerarium pependissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:9" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 9</bibl></cit> Roth: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus (scientiae) apiscendae otium apud Rhodum magistrum Thrasullum habuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 14</bibl>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:92" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 92</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 7, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut civitati Cibyraticae apud Asiam subveniretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 18</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">16, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">apud Pharsaliam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:Epit. 111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> Epit. 111</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apud Palaestinam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 7, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui erant apud Helladam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,023:8:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Macc. 8, 9</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n3250.22" n="III" level="1"> Of time. </sense><sense id="n3250.23" n="A" level="2"> With words denoting time or occasion, <hi rend="ital">in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">apud saeclum prius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 2, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem apud judicium persequi,</quote> <trans><tr>at the trial</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 4, 104</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3250.24" n="B" level="2"> With words designating persons, <hi rend="ital">with</hi>, <hi rend="ital">among</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the time of</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostis apud majores nostros is dicebatur, quem nunc etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:12:36" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 12, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fecerunt hoc multi apud majores nostros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:chapter=118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 118</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 148</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Fuit eodem ex studio vir eruditus apud patres nostros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:chapter=36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 36</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:24:85" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 24, 85</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:2:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 2, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Apud antiquos fuit Petron quidam, Cels. praef. 3, 9: aliam apud Fabricios, aliam apud Scipiones pecuniam (fuisse),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 33</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3250.25" n="IV" level="1"> For <hi rend="ital">ad</hi> with words implying motion (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">APVT EVM PERVENIRE,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 786, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">atque apud hunc eo vicinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:5:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 5, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Bito apud aurificem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0043,001:30:66" default="NO"><author>Lucil.</author> 30, 66</bibl></cit> Müll.: apud legiones venit, Sall. Fragm. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1321,001:Commod. Don. p. 395" default="NO"><author>Pomp.</author> Commod. Don. p. 395</bibl> Lind.: <cit><quote lang="la">(naves) apud insulas longius sitas ejectae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui apud Romanos de societate functus est legatione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,024:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Macc. 4, 11</bibl></cit>.!*? Apud has some peculiarities of position, chiefly in Tac. (cf. ad, I. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> b.) </sense><sense id="n3250.26" n="a" level="4"> It is sometimes placed after its <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae fiunt apud fabros, fictores, item alios apud,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:78, p. 104" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, 78, p. 104</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">Is locus est Cumas aput,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:747" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 747</bibl></cit> Lachm.: <cit><quote lang="la">montem apud Erycum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ripam apud Euphratis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Misenum apud et Ravennam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 5</bibl></cit> (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:9" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 9</bibl> the editt. vary between aerarium apud and apud aerarium; the latter seems preferable, and is adopted by Oudend., Bremi, Baumg.-Crus., and Roth).—</sense><sense id="n3250.27" n="b" level="4"> It is sometimes placed between the <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi> and <pos>adj.</pos>: <cit><quote lang="la">barbaras apud gentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:88:3:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 88, 3, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">15, 60</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non modo Graecis in urbibus, sed Romana apud templa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 14</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3250.28" n="c" level="4"> Twice in Verg. it stands before the secondary adjunct of its <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">apud durae moenia Trojae, A. 11, 288: apud gelidi flumina Hebri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 12, 331</bibl></cit>. Apud is never found in compound words. V. more on this word in Hand, Turs. I. pp. 405-416.</sense></entryFree>
apuleius: <entryFree id="n3251" type="main" key="A_pu^le_ius"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Āpŭlēius</orth>, v. Appuleius.</entryFree>
apulia: <entryFree id="n3252" type="main" key="A_pu_lia"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Āpūlia</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Āpūlĭcus</orth>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Āpŭlus</orth>, v. Appul-.</entryFree>
apus: <entryFree id="n3253" type="greek" key="a^pu_s1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăpūs</orth>, <itype>pŏdis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)/pous</foreign> (footless), <sense id="n3253.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of swallow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">said to have no feet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the black martin</hi>: Hirundo apus, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 39, 55, § 144</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n3254" type="main" key="Apus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Apus</orth>, <sense id="n3254.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">name of a town and river in Dacia</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Salavicza</hi>, Tab. Peut.</sense></entryFree>
aput: <entryFree id="n3255" type="main" key="a^pu^t"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăpŭt</orth>, v. apud <sense id="n3255.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
apyretus: <entryFree id="n3256" type="main" key="a^py_re^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăpȳrĕtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)pu/retos</foreign>, <sense id="n3256.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">without fever</hi>, Theod. Prisc.</sense></entryFree>
apyrinus: <entryFree id="n3257" type="greek" key="a^py_ri^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăpȳrĭnus</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">ăpȳrēnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)pu/rhnos</foreign> (without kernel), <sense id="n3257.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">with soft kernels</hi> or <hi rend="ital">seeds</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fructus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:10:15" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 10, 15</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ăpȳrēnum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a kind of pomegranate with soft kernels.</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 19, 34, § 112</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 6, 57, § 106</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 85" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 85</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:43" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 13, 43</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
apyros: <entryFree id="n3258" type="greek" key="a^py^ros"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăpyros</orth>, <itype>on</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)/puros, on</foreign> (without fire): apyron sulpur, <sense id="n3258.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">virgin-sulphur</hi>, prepared without fire, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:174" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 15, 50, § 174</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurum,</quote> <trans><tr>obtained without smelting</tr>, <tr>pure</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 11, 38, § 66</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
aqua: <entryFree id="n3259" type="main" key="a^qua"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăqua</orth>, <itype>ae</itype> (ACVA, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 593, 5</bibl>; <sense id="n3259.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> aquāï, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:6:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 6, 71</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:284" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 284</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1" default="NO" valid="yes">1</bibl>. <cb n="AQUA" /> 285; 1, 307; 1, 454 et saep.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:464" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 464</bibl>; poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:9:15" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 9, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,060:chapter=179" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Arat. 179</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Apoth. 702</bibl>; the <case>dat.</case> aquaï also was used acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 538</bibl>; v. Neue, Formenl. I. pp. 9, 11, 12; pp. 14 sq.; <cit><quote lang="la">aquae, as trisyl.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:552" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 552</bibl></cit> Lachm.), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>cf. Sanscr. ap = water; Wallach. apa, and Goth. ahva = river; old Germ. Aha; Celt. achi; and the Gr. proper names <foreign lang="greek">*mess-a/pi-oi</foreign> and <foreign lang="greek">gh= *)api/-a</foreign>, and the Lat. Apuli, Apiola; prob. ultimately con. with Sanscr. ācus = swift, ācer, and <foreign lang="greek">w)ku/s</foreign>, from the notion of quickly, easily moving. Curtius.</etym>. </sense><sense id="n3259.1" n="I. A." level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Water</hi>, in its most gen. signif. (as an element, rainwater, river-water, sea-water, etc.; in class. Lat. often <number>plur.</number> to denote several streams, springs, in one place or region, and com. <number>plur.</number> in Vulg. O. T. after the Hebrew): <cit><quote lang="la">aër, aqua, terra, vapores, Quo pacto fiant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:567" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 567</bibl></cit>: SI. AQVA. PLVVIA. NOCET, Fragm. of the XII. Tab. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:40:7:21" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 40, 7, 21</bibl>; cf. Dirks. Transl. p. 486; so also of titles in the Digg. 39, 3; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:20" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 43, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pluvialis,</quote> <trans><tr>rain-water</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:335" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 335</bibl></cit>, and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 3:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 3, 1</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">aquae pluviae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:9:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 9, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:233" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 103, 106, § 233</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:109" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 109</bibl> (and pluviae <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 15, 16</bibl>, B; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:519" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 519</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 92</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:71" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 71</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:227" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 106, 110, § 227</bibl>); so, <cit><quote lang="la">caelestes aquae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 135</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:30:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 30, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 12, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 2, 2, § 14</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">aquae de nubibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,012:22:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Reg. 22, 12</bibl></cit>: aquae nivis, <hi rend="ital">snow-water</hi>, ib. Job, 9, 30: <cit><quote lang="la">fluvialis,</quote> <trans><tr>river-water</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:22" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 22</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">aqua fluminis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,049:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Jer. 2, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquaï fons,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:602" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 602</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fons aquae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:24:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 24, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fontes aquarum, ib. Joel, 1, 20: flumen aquae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:495" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 495</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fluvius aquae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,027:22:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Apoc. 22, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rivus aquae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:8:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 8, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rivi aquarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:32:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 32, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">torrens aquae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> Macc. 5, 40</bibl></cit>; and <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,049:31:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Jer. 31, 9</bibl>: dulcis, <hi rend="ital">fresh-water</hi>, Fr. <hi rend="ital">eau douce</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:890" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 890</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fons aquae dulcis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 4, 118</bibl></cit>; and <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquae dulces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 61</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:167" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 1, 167</bibl>: marina, <hi rend="ital">sea-water</hi> (v. also salsus, amarus), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 16</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">aquae maris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:1:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 1, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:15:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Exod. 15, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dulcis et amara aqua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,020:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Jac. 3, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perennis,</quote> <trans><tr>never-failing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 21</bibl></cit>; and <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo in summo (loco) est aequata agri planities et aquae perennes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 4, 107</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aqua profluens,</quote> <trans><tr>running-water</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:16:52" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 16, 52</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">currentes aquae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:30:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 30, 25</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">aqua viva,</quote> <trans><tr>living-water</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:26:35" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, 26, 35</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:26:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 26, 19</bibl>; and <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquae vivae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,004:19:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Num. 19, 17</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and in a spiritual sense: aqua viva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,004:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Joan. 4, 10</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">vitae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,027:22:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Apoc. 22, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquae viventes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,003:14:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Lev. 14, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stagna aquae,</quote> <trans><tr>standing-water</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4:17:2" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4, 17, 2</bibl></cit>; and <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:106:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 106, 35</bibl>; so, stativae aquae, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 217, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquae de puteis,</quote> <trans><tr>well-water</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,004:20:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Num. 20, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aqua de cisternā,</quote> <trans><tr>cisternwater</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,012:23:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> 2 Reg. 23, 16</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">aqua cisternae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:36:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Isa. 36, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquae pessimae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,014:2:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> 4 Reg. 2, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aqua recens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:636" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 636</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turbida,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,049:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Jer. 2, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crassa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,024:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> 2 Macc. 1, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">munda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,019:10:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Heb. 10, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">purissima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,053:34:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Ezech. 34, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquae calidae,</quote> <trans><tr>warm-water</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:36:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Gen. 36, 24</bibl></cit>; and <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">calida,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 156, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 7, 38, § 77</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 22</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and contr.: calda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:13" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 4, 41, § 83</bibl>: aqua fervens, <hi rend="ital">boiling-water</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem aquā ferventi perfundere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:chapter=67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aqua frigida,</quote> <trans><tr>cold-water</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:1:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 1, 1, 37</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,029:25:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Prov. 25, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:10:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Matt. 10, 42</bibl>; and <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">frigida,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 1, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 5, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:11:31" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 11, 31</bibl>: aqua decocta, <hi rend="ital">water boiled</hi> and then cooled with ice or snow, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:116" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 116</bibl>; and <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">decocta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:50" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 50</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:48 al" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 48 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n3259.2" n="B" level="2"> Particular phrases. </sense><sense id="n3259.3" n="1" level="3"> Praebere aquam, <hi rend="ital">to invite to a feast</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to entertain</hi> (with ref. to the use of water at table for washing and drinking), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 4, 88</bibl> (cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 69</bibl>).—</sense><sense id="n3259.4" n="2" level="3"> Aquam aspergere alicui, <hi rend="ital">to give new life</hi> or <hi rend="ital">courage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to animate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">refresh</hi>, <hi rend="ital">revive</hi> (the fig. taken from sprinkling one who is in a swoon): <cit><quote lang="la">ah, adspersisti aquam! Jam rediit animus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:4:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 4, 15</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3259.5" n="3" level="3"> Aqua et ignis, to express the most common necessaries of life: <cit><quote lang="la">non aquā, non igni, ut aiunt, locis pluribus utimur quam amicitiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:6:22" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 6, 22</bibl></cit>.—Hence aquā et igni interdicere alicui, <hi rend="ital">to deny intercourse</hi> or <hi rend="ital">familiarity with one</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to exclude from civil society</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to banish</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 1, 9</bibl>; so the bride, on the day of marriage, received from the bridegroom aqua et ignis, as a symbol of their union: aquā et igni tam interdici solet damnatis quam accipiunt nuptae, videlicet quia hae duae res humanam vitam maxime continent, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=3" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 3</bibl> Müll. (this custom is differently explained in <pb n="148" /> <cb n="AQUA" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:9:18" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, 9, 18</bibl>): aquam et terram petere, of an enemy (like <foreign lang="greek">gh=n kai\ u(/dwr ai)tei=n</foreign>), <hi rend="ital">to demand submission</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquam ipsos (hostes) terramque poscentium, ut neque fontium haustum nec solitos cibos relinquerent deditis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:10:8" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 10, 8</bibl></cit>.— Provv. </sense><sense id="n3259.6" n="a" level="4"> Ex uno puteo similior numquam potis Aqua aquaï <cit><quote lang="la">sumi quam haec est atque ista hospita,</quote> <trans><tr>you can't find two peas more like</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:1:6:70 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 1, 6, 70 sq.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n3259.7" n="b" level="4"> In aquā scribere = <foreign lang="greek">kaq) u(/datos gra/fein</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">to write in water</hi>, of something transient, useless: <cit><quote lang="la">cupido quod dicit amanti, In vento et rapidā scribere oportet aquā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:70:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 70, 4</bibl></cit> (cf. Keats' epitaph on himself: here lies one whose name was writ in water; and the Germ., etwas hinter die Feueresse schreiben).—</sense><sense id="n3259.8" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Water</hi>, in a more restricted sense. </sense><sense id="n3259.9" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The sea</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">coge, ut ad aquam tibi frumentum Ennenses metiantur,</quote> <trans><tr>on the sea-coast</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laborum quos ego sum terrā, quos ego passus aquā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:7:30" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 7, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">findite remigio aquas!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:586" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 3, 586</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: Venimus in portum ... Naviget hinc aliā jam mihi linter aquā, <hi rend="ital">in other waters let my bark now sail</hi> (cf. Milton in the Lycidas: <cit><quote lang="la">To-morrow to fresh woods and pastures new),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:864" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 864</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3259.10" n="B" level="2"> = la. cus, <hi rend="ital">a lake</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Albanae aquae deductio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 44 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n3259.11" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A stream</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a river.</hi> in Tuscae gurgite mersus aquae, i. e. Albula, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:48" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 48</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">alii in aquam caeci ruebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sonitus multarum aquarum,</quote> <trans><tr>of many streams</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:17:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 17, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,027:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Apoc. 1, 15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">19, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lignum, quod plantatum est secus decursus aquarum,</quote> <trans><tr>along the watercourses</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Psa. 1, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3259.12" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Rain</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cornix augur aquae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:17:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 17, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deūm genitor effusis aethera siccat aquis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:286" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 286</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multā terra madescit aquā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:6:198" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 198</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquae magnae bis eo anno fuerunt,</quote> <trans><tr>heavy rains</tr>, <tr>a flood</tr>, <tr>inundation</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:28" default="NO" valid="yes">38, 28</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3259.13" n="E" level="2"> In the <number>plur.</number>, <hi rend="ital">medicinal springs</hi>, <hi rend="ital">waters</hi>, <hi rend="ital">baths.</hi> </sense><sense id="n3259.14" n="1" level="3"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">ad aquas venire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:27:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 27, 65</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:24:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 16, 24, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquae caldae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 9:69, p. 219" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 9, 69, p. 219</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">aquae calidae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:227" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 103, 106, § 227</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquae medicatae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 3:25" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 3, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquae Salutiferae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 1</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n3259.15" n="2" level="3"> As <hi rend="ital">prop. noun</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Waters.</hi> Some of the most important were. </sense><sense id="n3259.16" n="a" level="4"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ăquae Ăpollĭnāres</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in Etruria</hi>, prob. the Phoebi vada of <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:42:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 6, 42, 7</bibl>, now <hi rend="ital">Bagni di Stigliano</hi>, Tab. Peut.—</sense><sense id="n3259.17" n="b" level="4"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ăquae Aurēlĭae</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in the Black Forest in Germany</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Baden-Baden</hi>, Inscr.—</sense><sense id="n3259.18" n="c" level="4"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ăquae Baiae</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in Campania</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:11:30" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 11, 30</bibl>; earlier called <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ăquae Cūmānae</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 16</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3259.19" n="d" level="4"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ăquae Călĭdae</orth>, </sense><sense id="n3259.20" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">In Britain</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Bath;</hi> also called <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ăquae Sōlis</orth>, Itin Anton.—</sense><sense id="n3259.21" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">In Zeugitana on the Gulf of Carthage</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Hammam Gurbos</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:24:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 24, 9</bibl>; Tab. Peut.—</sense><sense id="n3259.22" n="(g)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">In Gallia</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Vichy</hi> on the Allier, Tab. Theod.—</sense><sense id="n3259.23" n="e" level="4"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ăquae Cĭcĕrōnĭānae</orth>, <hi rend="ital">at Cicero's villa at Puteoli</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 2, 3, § 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3259.24" n="f" level="4"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ăquae Mattĭăcae</orth>, <hi rend="ital">among the Mattiaci in Germany</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Wiesbaden</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 29, 4</bibl>, also called <orth extent="full" lang="la">Fontes Mattĭăci</orth> in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 2, 17, § 20</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3259.25" n="g" level="4"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ăquae Sextĭae</orth>, <hi rend="ital">near Massilia</hi>, once a famous watering-place, now <hi rend="ital">Aix</hi>, Liv Epit 61; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:15" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 4, 5, § 36</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3259.26" n="h" level="4"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ăquae Tauri</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tau-ri Thermae</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in Etruria</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Bagni di Ferrata</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 8, § 52</bibl>. V. Smith, Dict. Geog., s. v. Aquae.—</sense><sense id="n3259.27" n="F" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The water in the water-clock.</hi> From the use of this clock in regulating the length of speeches, etc. (cf. clepsydra), arose the tropical phrases, </sense><sense id="n3259.28" n="(a)" level="5"> Aquam dare, <hi rend="ital">to give the advocate time for speaking</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 2, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3259.29" n="(b)" level="5"> Aquam perdere, <hi rend="ital">to spend time unprofitably</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to waste it</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:52" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 52</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3259.30" n="(g)" level="5"> Aqua haeret, <hi rend="ital">the water stops</hi>, i.e. <hi rend="ital">I am at a loss</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:33:117" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 33, 117</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in hac causā mihi aqua haeret,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ad Q. Fr. 2, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3259.31" n="G" level="1"> Aqua intercus, <hi rend="ital">the water under the skin</hi> of a dropsical person; <cit><quote lang="la">hence, as med. t.,</quote> <trans><tr>the dropsy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">medicamentum ad aquam intercutem dare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:24:92" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 24, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">decessit morbo aquae intercutis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner 5</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 8</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: aquam in animo habere intercutem, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 37, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3259.32" n="III" level="1"> Aqua, <hi rend="ital">the name of a constellation</hi>, Gr. <foreign lang="greek">*(/udwr</foreign>: <cit><quote lang="la">hae tenues stellae perhibentur nomine Aquāī,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,060:chapter=179" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Arat. 179</bibl></cit> (as translation of <foreign lang="greek">tou\s pa/ntas kale/ousin *(/udwr</foreign>); v. Orell. ad h. l.</sense></entryFree>
aquaeductio: <entryFree id="n3260" type="main" key="a^quaeducti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăquaeductĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ăquae ductĭo</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <cb n="AQUA" /> <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n3260.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a conveyance of water</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8:6" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:39:3:13" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 39, 3, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
aquaeductus: <entryFree id="n3261" type="main" key="a^quaeductus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăquaeductus</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">ăquae ductus</orth>; also <orth extent="full" lang="la">ductus ăquae</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 8, 6</bibl>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ăquārum ductus</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:224" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 42, 81, § 224</bibl>;
