<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 8, 6, 3</bibl>; and <orth extent="full" lang="la">ductus ăquārum</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:20" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 20</bibl>), <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n3261.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a conveyance of water</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an aqueduct</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a conduit</hi> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">(Appius) aquam in urbem duxit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 29</bibl></cit>): <cit><quote lang="la">De aquae ductu probe fecisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">usque ad Collem aquae ductūs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,012:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Reg. 2, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fecitque aquae ductum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,013:18:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> 3 Reg. 18, 32</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:7:3 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Isa. 7, 3 al.</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">also,</quote> <trans><tr>the right of conducting water to some place</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:chapter=26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 26</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:8:3:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 8, 3, 1</bibl>. On the aqueducts of Rome, v. Smith, Dict. Antiq., s. v. aquaeductus.</sense></entryFree>
aquaelicium: <entryFree id="n3262" type="main" key="a^quaeli_ci^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăquaelīcĭum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ăquīlīcĭum</orth>), <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>aqua-elicio</etym>, <sense id="n3262.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a means</hi> (<hi rend="ital">sacrifice</hi>, etc.) <hi rend="ital">to produce rain</hi>: aquaelicium dicitur, cum aqua pluvialis remediis quibusdam elicitur, ut quondam, si creditur, manali lapide in urbem ducto, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=2" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 2</bibl> Müll.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 40</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
aquaemanalis: <entryFree id="n3263" type="hapax" key="a^quaema^na_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăquaemănālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>aqua - manus</etym>, <sense id="n3263.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pertaining to water for the hand</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to water for washing;</hi> hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">ăquaemă-nālis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, sc urceus (cf. aqualis), <hi rend="ital">a basin for washing the hands</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a wash-basin</hi>, Varr. ap. Non. p 547, 9.—For which in <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 3, 6</bibl>, <orth extent="full" lang="la">ăquĭmĭnāle</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v aquiminarium</sense></entryFree>
aquagium: <entryFree id="n3264" type="main" key="a^qua^gi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăquăgĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>aqua-ago</etym>, <sense id="n3264.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a conveyance of water</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an aqueduct</hi>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=2" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 2</bibl> Müll.; Dig 43, 20, 3; 8, 3, 15.</sense></entryFree>
aqualiculus: <entryFree id="n3265" type="main" key="a^qua_li^cu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăquālĭcŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>aqualis</etym>; lit., <sense id="n3265.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small vessel for water;</hi> hence, </sense><sense id="n3265.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The stomach</hi>, <hi rend="ital">maw</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 90" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 90</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 1, 40</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n3265.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The belly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">paunch</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pinguis aqualiculus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:1:57" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 1, 57</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
aqualis: <entryFree id="n3266" type="main" key="a^qua_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăquālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>aqua</etym> <sense id="n3266.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to water;</hi> nubes aquales, Varr. ap. Non p. 46, 2.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n3266.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst</hi> <orth extent="full" lang="la">ăquā-lis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <hi rend="ital">comm</hi> (sc. urceus or hama), <hi rend="ital">a vessel for washing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a basin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wash-basin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ewer</hi> ab aquā aqualis dictus, Varr L L. 5, § <cit><quote lang="la">119 Müll pertusi, Cat. ap. Fest p 169 Müll.: dare aqualem cum aquā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:3:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 2, 3, 33</bibl></cit>. bilibris aqualis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:2:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 3, 2, 39</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
aquariolus: <entryFree id="n3267" type="main" key="a^qua_ri^o^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăquārĭŏlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>aquarius</etym>, <sense id="n3267.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an attendant of lewd women</hi>, Paul ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=22" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 22</bibl> Müll.; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. 323, 35</bibl>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol 43</bibl></sense></entryFree>
aquarius: <entryFree id="n3268" type="main" key="a^qua_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăquārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>aqua</etym> <sense id="n3268.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">relating to water</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rota,</quote> <trans><tr>for drawing water</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 11, 3</bibl></cit>: vas, Varr L. L. 5, § 119 Müll.: provincia, i.e. Ostiensis, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:5 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Vatin. 5 al.</bibl>—Hence, </sense><sense id="n3268.1" n="II" level="1"> <pos>Subst.</pos> </sense><sense id="n3268.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">ăquārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> </sense><sense id="n3268.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A water-carrier</hi>: venit et conduc tus aquarius, Juv 6, 332.—</sense><sense id="n3268.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A conduitmaster</hi> (in aqueducts, etc.), <hi rend="ital">an inspector of the conduits</hi> or <hi rend="ital">water-pipes</hi>: cum tabernariis et aquariis pugnare, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 6</bibl>, so, AQVARIVS AQVAE ANIONIS, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3203</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3268.5" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The Water-bearer</hi>, one of the signs of the zodiac, Gr <foreign lang="greek">*(udroxo/os:</foreign> cervix Aquarī, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,060:chapter=56" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Arat. 56</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">172</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">176</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">inversum contristat Aquarius annum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 36</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3268.6" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">ăquārĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a wateringplace for cattle</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 1, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
aquate: <entryFree id="n3269" type="main" key="a^qua_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăquātē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. aquatus <sense id="n3269.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
aquaticus: <entryFree id="n3270" type="main" key="a^qua_ti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăquātĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n3270.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj</hi> [aqua]. </sense><sense id="n3270.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Living</hi>, <hi rend="ital">growing</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">found in</hi> or <hi rend="ital">by the water</hi>, <hi rend="ital">aquatic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 27, 41, § 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:173" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 16, 37, 67, § 173</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frutices,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:156" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 16, 36, 64, § 156</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3270.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Full of water</hi>, <hi rend="ital">watery</hi>, <hi rend="ital">moist</hi>, <hi rend="ital">humid</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Auster, Ov M. 2, 853: in aquaticis natus calamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:165" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 36, 66, § 165</bibl></cit>: Agrestia in aquatica convertebantur, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,033:19:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Sap. 19, 18</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3270.3" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Resembling water</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">color,</quote> <trans><tr>of the color of water</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 30 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
aquatilis: <entryFree id="n3271" type="main" key="a^qua_ti^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăquātĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n3271.0" n="I. A." level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Living</hi>, <hi rend="ital">growing</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">found</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in</hi> or <hi rend="ital">near water</hi>, <hi rend="ital">aquatic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vescimur bestiis et terrenis et aquatilibus et volantibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:60:151" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 60, 151</bibl></cit> B. and K.—</sense><sense id="n3271.1" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ăquātĭlĭa</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">aquatic animals</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquatilium in medicinā beneficia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 1, 1, § 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3271.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Having a watery taste</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">u(darh/s</foreign>: <cit><quote lang="la">sunt amari absinthi, aquatiles cucumeris, cucurbitae, lactucae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:186" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 12, 61, § 186</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3271.3" n="III" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">ăquātĭlĭa</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a disease of cattle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">watery vesicles</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hydatides,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 2, 49</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
aquatio: <entryFree id="n3272" type="main" key="a^qua_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăquātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>aquor</etym>. <sense id="n3272.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A getting</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fetching of water</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquationis causā procedere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 11</bibl></cit>; so, Auct. B. Afr. 51; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> B. Hisp. 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 23, 26, § 102</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3272.1" n="II" level="1"> Concr. </sense><sense id="n3272.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Watering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">water</hi>: mutare pabula<cb n="AQUI" />  et aquationes, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 5</bibl>.—Of plants <hi rend="ital">a watering</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">salices aquationibus adjuvan dae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 4, 17 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 19</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n3272.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Water. rains</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ranae multae variaeque per aquationes autumni nascentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 7, 24, § 76</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n3272.4" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A place whence water is brought</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a watering-place</hi>: hic aquatio, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:14:59" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 14, 59</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
aquator: <entryFree id="n3273" type="main" key="a^qua_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăquātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>aquor</etym>, <sense id="n3273.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one that fetches water</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a water-carrier</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 73</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
aquatus: <entryFree id="n3274" type="main" key="a^qua_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăquātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> <etym>as if from aquo, āre</etym>, <sense id="n3274.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">mixed with water;</hi> hence, <hi rend="ital">watery</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thin</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lac vernum aquatius aestivo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 9, 33, § 124</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 1:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 1, 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 4, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum aquatissimum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Conf. 6:2" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Conf. 6, 2</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ăquātē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">with water</hi>, <hi rend="ital">by the use of water; comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">temperare aliquid aquatius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Plin. Val.</author> 1, 10</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquatissime vinum temperare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 1:4" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 1, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
aquensis: <entryFree id="n3275" type="main" key="A^quensis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ăquensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>Aquae</etym>, <sense id="n3275.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Aquœ.</hi> </sense><sense id="n3275.1" n="I" level="1"> To Aquae Taurīnae: <cit><quote lang="la">Aquenses cognomine Taurini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 8, § 52</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3275.2" n="II" level="1"> To Aquae Aureliae: <cit><quote lang="la">CIVITAS,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 928</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">949</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3275.3" n="III" level="1"> To Aquae in Aquitania, now <hi rend="ital">Bagnères</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">VICANI,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 204</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n3275.4" n="IV" level="1"> To Aquae Helveticae, now <hi rend="ital">Wettingen</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 457</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
aquicaldenses: <entryFree id="n3276" type="main" key="A^qui^caldenses"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ăquĭcaldenses</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n3276.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people in Spain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whose chief city was Aquœ Calidœ</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Caldes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 3, 4, § 23</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
aquicelus: <entryFree id="n3277" type="foreign" key="aquicelus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">aquicelus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, among the Taurini, <sense id="n3277.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pine-kernels boiled in honey</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 10, 9, § 36</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
aquiducus: <entryFree id="n3278" type="hapax" key="a^qui^du_cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăquĭdūcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>aqua-duco</etym>, med. t., for the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">u(dragwgo/s</foreign>, <sense id="n3278.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">drawing off water</hi> medicamina, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 3:8" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 3, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
aquifolius: <entryFree id="n3279" type="main" key="a^qui^fo^li^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăquĭfŏlĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. acus-folium, like antiquus from anticus, aquipenser from acipenser</etym>, <sense id="n3279.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having pointed leaves;</hi> hence, aquifolia ilex, or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ăquĭfŏ-lĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">ăquĭfŏlĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the holly-tree</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">the scarlet holm</hi>: llex aquifolium, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 8, 12, § 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:73:16:43:84:section=230" default="NO" valid="yes">16, 18, 30, § 73, 16, 43, 84, § 230</bibl>.—And <pos>adj.</pos>: <cit><quote lang="la">vectes aquifolii,</quote> <trans><tr>made of holly-wood</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 31</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
aquifuga: <entryFree id="n3280" type="hapax" key="a^qui^fu^ga"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăquĭfŭga</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>comm.</gen> <etym>aqua-fugio</etym>, <sense id="n3280.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one fearful of water</hi>, med. t., <hi rend="ital">one having hydrophobia</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">u(drofo/bos</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 3:15" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 3, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
aquigenus: <entryFree id="n3281" type="hapax" key="a^qui^ge^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăquĭgĕnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>aqua-gigno</etym>, <sense id="n3281.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">born in the water</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">animalia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 2, 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
aquila: <entryFree id="n3282" type="main" key="a^qui^la1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăquĭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym><hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> aquilāï, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Arat 372</bibl>) [perh. from aquilus, from its common color, Gr <foreign lang="greek">melana/etos</foreign>; cf. Engl. eagle; Fr. aigle; Germ. Adler</etym>, <sense id="n3282.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an eagle.</hi> </sense><sense id="n3282.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: Falco melanaëtus, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 3, 3, § 6</bibl> sqq.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div 1, 15, 26</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 70, 144</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:16:4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 16, 4</bibl>, Liv 1, 34, 8; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:751" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 751</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:506" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 506</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:4:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 4, 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquilis velociores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,012:1:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Reg. 1, 23</bibl></cit> si exaltatus fueris ut aquila, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,040:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Abd. 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dilata calvitium tuum ut aquila,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,038:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Mich. 1, 16</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the lightningbearer of Jupiter.</hi> Jovis satelles, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:10:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 10, 24</bibl>: armigera Jovis, Plin. l. l.; cf. Serv ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:398" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 398</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3282.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n3282.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The eagle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as the principal standard of a Roman legion</hi> (while signa are the standards of the single cohorts; cf. Schwarz ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:82" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 82</bibl>; Web. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:164" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 7, 164</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">Smith, Dict. Antiq.): aquila argentea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:9:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 9, 24</bibl></cit>; aquilae duae, signa sexaginta sunt relata Antonii, Galba ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 3, 4, § 23</bibl> et saep.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut locupletem aquilam tibi sexagesimus annus Adferat,</quote> <trans><tr>the office of a standard-bearer</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:197" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 197</bibl></cit>.—Hence, meton., <hi rend="ital">a legion</hi>: erat acies tredecim aquilis constituta, Auct. B. Hisp. 30; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:238" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 5, 238</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n3282.4" n="B" level="2"> In arch.: aquilae, as in Gr. <foreign lang="greek">a)etoi/</foreign> and <foreign lang="greek">a)etw/mata</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">the highest parts of a building</hi>, <hi rend="ital">which supported the front of a gable.</hi> sustinentes fastigium aquilae, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 71</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n3282.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The Eagle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a constellation</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,060:chapter=372" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Arat. 372</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3282.6" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A species of fish of the ray genus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the sea-eagle</hi>: Raja aquila, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 24, 40, § 78</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3282.7" n="E" level="2"> Aquilae senectus, prov., acc. to Donatus, of an old man fond of drinking (since it was believed that the eagle, in old age, drank more than it ate; but more prob., <hi rend="ital">a vigorous old age</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 2, 10</bibl>, ubi v. Don.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n3283" type="main" key="A^qui^la2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ăquĭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n3283.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman proper name.</hi> </sense><sense id="n3283.1" n="I" level="1"> L. Pontius Aquna, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 11, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3283.2" n="II" level="1"> Julius Aquila, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 15</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3283.3" n="III" level="1"> Vedius Aquila. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 15</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3283.4" n="IV" level="1"> Aquila <pb n="149" /> <cb n="AQUI" /> Romanus, author of a work <hi rend="ital">De Figuris Sententiarum et Elocutionis;</hi> v. Teuffel, Rom. <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> § 384.—</sense><sense id="n3283.5" n="V" level="1"> Julius Aquila, <hi rend="ital">a Roman jurist</hi>, author of <hi rend="ital">Liber Responsorum</hi>, of which there are extracts in Dig.; v. Bach, Hist. Jurisp. Rom. III. 3.—</sense><sense id="n3283.6" n="VI" level="1"> Aquila, <hi rend="ital">the name of a Christian Jew</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:18:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 18, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,006:16:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Rom. 16, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
aquilaria: <entryFree id="n3284" type="main" key="Aquilari^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Aquilarĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n3284.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of Zeugitana</hi>, now prob. <hi rend="ital">Alhowareah</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 23</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
aquilegus: <entryFree id="n3285" type="main" key="a^qui^le^gus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăquĭlĕgus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>aqua-lego</etym>. <sense id="n3285.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Water-drawing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rota,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 33</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3285.1" n="II" level="1"> <pos>Subst.</pos> = aquilex, <hi rend="ital">a conduit-master</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 3, 53</bibl> dub.</sense></entryFree>
aquileia: <entryFree id="n3286" type="main" key="A^qui^le_ia"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ăquĭlēia</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)akulhi(a</foreign>, <sense id="n3286.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in Upper Italy</hi>, still called <hi rend="ital">Aquileia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not far from Tergeste</hi>, built by the Romans after the second Punic war, as a protection against the neighboring tribes, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:25" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 18, 22, § 127</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:4:3" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 4, 3</bibl>; cf. Mann. Ital. I. 74 sq.— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ăquĭlēiensis</orth>, <pos>adj.</pos>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 45</bibl></cit>; and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ăquĭlēienses</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Aquileia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 43, 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
aquilentus: <entryFree id="n3287" type="hapax" key="a^qui^lentus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăquĭlentus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>aqua</etym>, <sense id="n3287.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of water</hi>, <hi rend="ital">humid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wet</hi>: luna, <hi rend="ital">bringing rain</hi>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 4, 318</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
aquilex: <entryFree id="n3288" type="main" key="a^qui^lex"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăquĭlex</orth>, <itype>ĕgis</itype> (ĭcis post-class., <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 3, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. G. 1, 109</bibl>), <gen>m.</gen> <etym>aqua-lego</etym>, <sense id="n3288.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a conduit-master</hi>, <hi rend="ital">water-inspector</hi> (= indagator aquarum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:2:20" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 2, 20</bibl>), Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 69, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 6, 16, § 30</bibl>: <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 3:15" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 3, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
aquilianus: <entryFree id="n3289" type="main" key="A^quili^a_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ăquilĭānus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Ăquill-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n3289.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Aquilian</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proceeding from the jurist Aquilius</hi> (<hi rend="ital">a friend of Cicero</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">quod si Aquiliana definitio vera est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:15:61" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 15, 61</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
aquilicium: <entryFree id="n3290" type="main" key="a^qui_li_ci^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăquīlīcĭum</orth>, v. aquaelicium.</entryFree>
aquilifer: <entryFree id="n3291" type="main" key="a^qui^li^fer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăquĭlĭfer</orth>, <itype>fēri</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>aquila-fero</etym>, <sense id="n3291.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an eaglebearer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">standard-bearer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an officer who carried the chief standard of the Roman legion</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 64</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:10" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3389</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3477</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4729</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
aquilinus: <entryFree id="n3292" type="main" key="a^qui^li_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăquĭlīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>aquila</etym>, <sense id="n3292.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to the eagle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">aquiline</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ungulae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:3:2:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 3, 2, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aspectus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>sharp</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 115</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
aquilius: <entryFree id="n3293" type="main" key="A^quili^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ăquilĭus</orth> (on coins and in inscrr. <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ăquill-</orth>; in MSS. <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ăquil-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n3293.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">name of a Roman</hi> gens; hence, </sense><sense id="n3293.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ăquilĭus</orth>, <gen>m.</gen> </sense><sense id="n3293.2" n="1. A." level="1"> M. Aquilius Gallus, <hi rend="ital">consul</hi> A.U.C. 653, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 3, 54, 125</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:28:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 28, 124</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3293.3" n="B" level="2"> C. Aquilius Gallus, <hi rend="ital">a Roman jurist and orator</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:42:154" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 42, 154</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:14:50" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 14, 50</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3293.4" n="C" level="2"> Aquilius Niger, <hi rend="ital">a Roman historian</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:11" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 11</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3293.5" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ăqui-lĭa</orth>, <gen>f.</gen>—</sense><sense id="n3293.6" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aquilia lex de damno injuriā dato, perh. introduced by the tribune Aquilius Gallus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:34:131" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 34, 131</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
aquilo: <entryFree id="n3294" type="main" key="a^qui^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăquĭlo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>perh. from aqua, as bringing wet weather, or aquilus, dark, as bringing lowering and stormy weather</etym>. <sense id="n3294.0" n="I. A." level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the north wind;</hi> Gr. <foreign lang="greek">*boreas</foreign>; <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:10:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 10, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 132</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 285</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 77 al.</bibl>; acc. to accurate nautical designation, <hi rend="ital">north-one-third-east wind</hi>, between the septentrio and vulturnus, opp. to Auster Africanus or Libonotus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 5:16" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 5, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:119 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 47, 46, § 119 sq.</bibl>: horrifer Aquilonis stridor gelidas molitur nives, Att. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:28:68" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 28, 68</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ille vento Aquilone venisset Lemnum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Milt. 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aquilo frigidus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:404" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 404</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">densus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 196</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stridens Aquilone procella,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 1, 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hiems aquilonibus asperat undas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 285</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">impotens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:30:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 30, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clarus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:460" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 460</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Threïcius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:13:3" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 13, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad aquilonem et ad austrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,015:9:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Par. 9, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:13:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Luc. 13, 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad aquilonem et meridiem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:13:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Gen. 13, 14</bibl></cit> et persaepe (in the Vulg. only in <number>sing.</number>).—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Africum Decertantem aquilonibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 3, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Neptunus classes aquilonibus arcet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:64 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 64 al.</bibl></cit> persaepe.—</sense><sense id="n3294.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> for <hi rend="ital">the north</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">spelunca conversa ad aquilonem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 48</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3294.2" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ăquĭlo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>; in mythology, <hi rend="ital">the husband of Orithyia and father of Calais and Zetes</hi>, who dwelt in a cave of Hæmus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:1:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:5:1" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 3, 5, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:432" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 432</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 14" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
aquilonaris: <entryFree id="n3295" type="main" key="a^qui^lo_na_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăquĭlōnāris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>aquilo.</etym>. <sense id="n3295.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Northerly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">northern</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">regio tum aquilonaris, tum australis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:19:50" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 19, 50</bibl></cit> (but v. aquilonius).—</sense><sense id="n3295.1" n="II" level="1"> Piscis aquilonaris, <hi rend="ital">a constellation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Northern Fish</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:9:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 9, 6</bibl>; cf. Cic. Fragm. ix. 2, p. 580 Orell.</sense></entryFree>
aquilonia: <entryFree id="n3296" type="main" key="A^qui^lo_ni^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ăquĭlōnĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n3296.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of the Hirpini</hi>,<cb n="AQUU" />  <hi rend="ital">upon the river Aufidus</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Lacedogna</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:41" default="NO" valid="yes">39, 41</bibl> sq.; cf. Mann. Ital. I. 797.—<orth extent="full" lang="la">Ăquĭlōni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">its inhabitants</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 11, 16, § 105</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
aquilonigena: <entryFree id="n3297" type="hapax" key="A^qui^lo_ni^ge^na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ăquĭlōnĭgĕna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>comm.</gen> <etym>aquilogigno</etym>, <sense id="n3297.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">born in the north</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of northern extraction;</hi> a <usg type="style">poet.</usg> epithet of northern nations: <cit><quote lang="la">Britanni,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Mos. 407</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
aquilonius: <entryFree id="n3298" type="main" key="a^qui^lo_ni^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăquĭlōnĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>aquilo</etym>. <sense id="n3298.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Northern</hi>, <hi rend="ital">northerly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of the north</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (regio) tum est aquilonia tum australis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:19:50" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 19, 50</bibl></cit> B. and K.: <cit><quote lang="la">hiems,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 2, 2, § 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">luna,</quote> <trans><tr>toward the north</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:215" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 97, 99, § 215</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loca,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 13, 119, § 144</bibl></cit>: Aquilonius piscis, <hi rend="ital">a constellation</hi> (cf. aquilonaris), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:24" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 24</bibl> and 63; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:237" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 26, 65, § 237</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3298.1" n="II" level="1"> (Acc. to aquilo, II.) <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to Aquilo</hi> (as a person): <cit><quote lang="la">proles,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>Calais and Zetes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:20:25" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 20, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:462" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 462</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pignora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:5:432" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 5, 432</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
aquilus: <entryFree id="n3299" type="main" key="a^qui^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăquĭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>etym. uncertain; cf. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=22" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 22</bibl> Müll.</etym>, <sense id="n3299.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dark-colored</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dun</hi>, <hi rend="ital">swarthy</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">Aquilus color est fuscus et subniger, Paul. ex Fest. l. l.: Staturā haud magnā, corpore aquilo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:2:152" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 2, 152</bibl></cit>: color inter aquilum candidumque, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:79" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 79</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 3, p. 108</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
aquiminale: <entryFree id="n3300" type="main" key="a^qui^mi^na_le"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăquĭmĭnāle</orth>, v. aquaemanalis and aquiminarium.</entryFree>
aquiminarium: <entryFree id="n3301" type="main" key="a^qui^mi^na_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăquĭmĭnārĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>aqua-manus</etym> (post-class. for <orth extent="full" lang="la">ăquaemănālis</orth>), <sense id="n3301.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a waterbasin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wash-basin</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:34:2:19:section=12" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 34, 2, 19, § 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:34:2:21" default="NO">34, 2, 21</bibl> (<bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 3, 6</bibl>, has <orth extent="full" lang="la">ăquĭmĭnāle</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>).</sense></entryFree>
aquinius: <entryFree id="n3302" type="main" key="A^qui_ni^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ăquīnĭus</orth> (or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ăquīnus</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n3302.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an inferior poet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">friend of Cicero</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Mihi fuit cum Aquinio amicitia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:22:63" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 22, 63</bibl></cit>.—As an appell.: <cit><quote lang="la">Caesios, Aquinos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:14:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 14, 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
aquinum: <entryFree id="n3303" type="main" key="A^qui_num"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ăquīnum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n3303.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in Latium</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not far from Casinum</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Aquino</hi>, the birthplace of the poet Juvenal, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 16, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 9, § 63</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:319" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 319</bibl>; cf. Mann. Ital. I. 674.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ăquī-nas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">belonging to Aquinum</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">colonia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nescit Aquinatem potantia vellera fucum,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>the purple color manufactured at Aquinum</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 10, 27</bibl></cit>.—<orth extent="full" lang="la">Ăquīnātes</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> </sense><sense id="n3303.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The inhabitants of Aquinum</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:chapter=68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 68</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 133</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3851</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3303.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A community in the Saltus Gallianus in</hi> Gallia Cispadana, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 15, 20, § 116</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
aquitania: <entryFree id="n3304" type="main" key="A^qui_ta_ni^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ăquītānĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <sense id="n3304.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A province in Southern Gaul</hi>, <hi rend="ital">between the Loire and the Pyrenees</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:108 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 19, 33, § 108 sq.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n3304.1" n="II" level="1"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n3304.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ăquītānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Aquitanian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:7:3" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 7, 3</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n3304.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ăquītāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Aquitania</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 6, 31, § 97</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3304.4" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ăquītānĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Aquitanian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 19, 33, § 108</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">provincia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 26, 1, 3, § 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3304.5" n="D" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ăquītā-nensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Aquitanian</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 440, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
aquivergium: <entryFree id="n3305" type="main" key="a^qui^vergi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăquĭ-vergĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype> <etym>vergo</etym>, <sense id="n3305.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a place in which water is collected</hi>, Agrim. Goes. pp. 225, 234.</sense></entryFree>
aquor: <entryFree id="n3306" type="main" key="a^quor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăquor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos> <etym>aqua</etym>, <sense id="n3306.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to bring</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fetch water for drinking.</hi> </sense><sense id="n3306.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (a milit. t. t.): <cit><quote lang="la">aquabantur aegre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 78</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">Auct. B. G. 8, 40: miles gregarius castris aquatum egressus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 93:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 93, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3306.2" n="II" level="1"> Metaph., of bees, <hi rend="ital">to get water</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:193" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 193</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 18, 19, § 61</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Apr. 8, 1</bibl>.—Of the earth, <hi rend="ital">to get water</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be watered</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam diutissime aquari gaudet (solum), ut praepinguis et densa ubertas diluatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:162" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 17, 45, § 162</bibl></cit> (where some, but unnecessarily, regard aquari as a real passive).</sense></entryFree>
aquosus: <entryFree id="n3307" type="main" key="a^quo_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăquōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n3307.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">abounding in water</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rainy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">moist</hi>, <hi rend="ital">humid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">full of water</hi> (not used in Cic.): <cit><quote lang="la">aquosissimus locus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 34</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:6:6" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 6, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:10" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquosior ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 17, 46, § 163</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hiems,</quote> <trans><tr>rainy winter</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:10:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 10, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nubes,</quote> <trans><tr>rain-clouds</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:622" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 622</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 570</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:429" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 429</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">Orion,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 52</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:16:51" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 16, 51</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Eurus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:16:54" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 16, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ida,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:20:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 3, 20, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crystallus,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>bright</tr>, <tr>clear</tr>, <tr>pellucid</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4:3:52" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4, 3, 52</bibl></cit>: languor, i.e. <hi rend="ital">the dropsy</hi> (cf. aqua, II. G.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 2, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Mater,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>Thetis</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:3:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 3, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aquosus Piscis,</quote> <trans><tr>a constellation</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:165" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 10, 165</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
aquula: <entryFree id="n3308" type="main" key="a^quu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăquŭla</orth> (archaic, <orth extent="full" lang="la">ăquŏla; ăcŭla</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n3308.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little water</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a small stream of water</hi> (perh. only in the foll. exs.): suffundam<cb n="ARA" />  aquolam, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 3, 3</bibl> Fleck.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:3:2:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cist. 3, 2, 38</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (umbra) mihi videtur non tam ipsā aquulā, quae describitur, quam Platonis oratione crevisse,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the Ilissus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:7:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 7, 28</bibl></cit>, where Ellendt and Sorof write <hi rend="ital">acula;</hi> v. aqua <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>— <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">non seclusa aliqua aquula, sed universum flumen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:2:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 2, 39</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ar: <entryFree id="n3309" type="main" key="a^r"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăr</orth>, an old form for ad; v. ad <sense id="n3309.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
ara: <entryFree id="n3310" type="main" key="a_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">āra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (Osc. form aasa; Umbr. asa: PELLEX. ASAM. IVNONIS. NE. TAGITO., Lex Numae ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:3:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 3, 3</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 4, 219</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 3, 2</bibl>) [perh. Sanscr. ās, Gr. <foreign lang="greek">h(=mai</foreign>, Dor. <foreign lang="greek">h(=smai</foreign> = to sit, as the seat or resting-place of the victim or offering; v. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:page=381 sq" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> p. 381 sq.</bibl>], <sense id="n3310.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an altar.</hi> </sense><sense id="n3310.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: Jovis aram sanguine turpari, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:35:85" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 35, 85</bibl> (Trag. v. 125 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">Inde ignem in aram, ut Ephesiae Dianae laeta laudes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnīs accedere ad aras ... aras sanguine multo Spargere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1199 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1199 sq.</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 84</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">turicremas aras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:353" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 353</bibl></cit> (adopted by <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:453" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 453</bibl>); <cit><quote lang="la">2, 417: multo sanguine maesti Conspergunt aras adolentque altaria donis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 1237 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ara Aio Loquenti consecrata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:45:101" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 45, 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ara condita atque dicata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 7</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:2" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ara sacrata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 22</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:14" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">exstruere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 15</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,014:21:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 4 Reg. 21, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">construere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,016:33:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> 2 Par. 33, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> ib. 33, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">erigere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,004:23:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Num. 23, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aedificare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,013:14:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> 3 Reg. 14, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ponere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> ib. 16, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">destruere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:34:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Exod. 34, 13</bibl></cit>, and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,026:6:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Jud. 6, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">subvertere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,005:7:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Deut. 7, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dissipare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> ib. 12, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suffodere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,026:31:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Jud. 31, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">demolire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,053:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Ezech. 6, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">depopulari, ib. Osee, 10, 2: interibunt arae vestrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,053:6:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Ezech. 6, 6</bibl></cit> et saep.—Altars were erected not only in the temples, but also in the streets and highways, in the open air, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 4, 1, 20</bibl>.—Esp. were altars erected in the courts of houses (impluvia), for the family gods (Penates), while the household gods (Lares) received offerings upon a small hearth (focus) in the family hall (atrium); hence, arae et foci, meton. for <hi rend="ital">home</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">hearth and home</hi>, and pro aris et focis pugnare, <hi rend="ital">to fight for altars and fires</hi>, <hi rend="ital">for one's dearest possessions</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbem, agrum, aras, focos seque dedere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">te amicum Deiotari regis arae focique viderunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:chapter=3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Deiot. 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de vestris conjugibus ac liberis, de aris ac focis, decernite,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:11:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 4, 11, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:chapter=42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 42</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nos domicilia, sedesque populi Romani, Penates, aras, focos, sepulcra majorum defendimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 8, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patriae, parentibus, aris atque focis bellum parare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 52:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 52, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro patriā, pro liberis, pro aris atque focis suis cernere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 59:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 59, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sibi pro aris focisque et deūm templis ac solo, in quo nati essent, dimicandum fore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 30</bibl></cit> et saep.—Criminals fled to the altars for protection, Don. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 2, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">interim hanc aram occupabo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:5:1:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 5, 1, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Priamum cum in aram confugisset, hostilis manus interemit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:35:85" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 35, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eo ille confugit in arāque consedit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,004:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Paus. 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Veneris sanctae considam vinctus ad aras: haec supplicibus favet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:4:13:23" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 4, 13, 23</bibl></cit>.—Hence, trop., <hi rend="ital">protection</hi>, <hi rend="ital">refuge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shelter</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tamquam in aram confugitis ad deum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:10:25" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 10, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad aram legum confugere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic portus, haec ara sociorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 5, 48</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:5:2" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 5, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 6, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:1:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 1, 110</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:8:68" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 2, 8, 68</bibl>.—One who took an oath was accustomed to lay hold of the altar, in confirmation of it, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:5:2:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 5, 2, 46</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui si aram tenens juraret, crederet nemo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 36, 90</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Hann. 2, 4</bibl> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 1</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">tango aras, medios ignes et numina testor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:201" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 201</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 219</bibl>: ara sepulcri, <hi rend="ital">a funeral pile</hi>, regarded as an altar, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:177" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 177</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:15:388" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 15, 388</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3310.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> </sense><sense id="n3310.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The Altar</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a constellation in the southern sky</hi>, Gr. <foreign lang="greek">*quth/rion</foreign> (Arat. 403 al.): Aram, quam flatu permulcet spiritus austri, poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:44:114" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 44, 114</bibl>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,060:chapter=202" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Arat. 202</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">213</bibl> Orell.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Astr. 2:39" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Astr. 2, 39</bibl>, and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:ib. 3:38" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 38</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pressa,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>low in the south</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 139</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n3310.4" n="B" level="2"> Arae, <hi rend="ital">The Altars.</hi> </sense><sense id="n3310.5" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Rocky cliffs in the Mediterranean Sea</hi>, <hi rend="ital">between Sicily Sardinia and Africa</hi>, so called from their shape, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 1, 108</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">Quadrig. Ann. ib.: saxa vocant Itali, mediis quae in fluctibus, Aras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 109</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3310.6" n="b" level="4"> Arae Philaenorum, v. Philaeni.—</sense><sense id="n3310.7" n="III" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">a monument of stone</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ara virtutis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:14:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 14, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lunensis ara,</quote> <trans><tr>of Lunensian marble</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:50" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 50 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—Also <pb n="150" /> <cb n="ARAC" /> <hi rend="ital">a tombstone</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ARAM D. S. P. R. (de suā pecuniā restituit),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4521</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 4522</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4826</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
arabarches: <entryFree id="n3311" type="main" key="a^ra^barches"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ărăbarches</orth> (this is the proper form, not <orth extent="full" lang="la">ălăbarches</orth>; cf. Haeckermann in Jahn's Neue Jahrbb. 1849, 15, supplem., pp. 450-566; very likely some said <sense id="n3311.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">alabarches</hi> and <hi rend="ital">alabarchia</hi>, because of the foll. <hi rend="ital">r</hi>, to avoid two <hi rend="ital">r</hi>s), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)raba/rxhs</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">an officer of customs in Egypt</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:130" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 130</bibl> Jahn, Hermann.—Sarcastically of Pompey, because he boasted that he had augmented the taxes so much: <cit><quote lang="la">velim ex Theophane expiscere, quonam in me animo sit Arabarches,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:17:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 17, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
arabarchia: <entryFree id="n3312" type="main" key="a^ra^barchi_a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ărăbarchīa</orth> (not <orth extent="full" lang="la">ălăb-</orth>; v. arabarches), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n3312.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of customs in Egypt</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 4, 61, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
arabia: <entryFree id="n3313" type="main" key="A_^ra^bi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ā^răbĭa</orth> (on account of the long A in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:10:16" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 10, 16</bibl>, erroneously written by many Arrabia; cf. Jahn ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 4, 9</bibl>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)arabi/a</foreign>. <sense id="n3313.0" n="I" level="1"> In an extended sense, <hi rend="ital">the country Arabia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">divided by the ancients into Petrœa</hi> (from its principal city, Petra), <hi rend="ital">Deserta</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and Felix</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 11, 12, § 65</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:10" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,013:10:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 3 Reg. 10, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,009:4:25 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Gal. 4, 25 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n3313.1" n="II" level="1"> In a more restricted sense, <hi rend="ital">a town in Arabia Felix</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:8:7" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 3, 8, 7</bibl>. —Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ā^răbĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Arabic</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Arabian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">odor (i. e. tus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:168" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 67, 67, § 168</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:8:1" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 3, 8, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">resina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 20, 25, § 122</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adamas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 4, 15, § 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 10, 54, § 146</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">balanus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 12, 21, 46, § 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lapicidinae, i. e. of alabaster,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 12, 17, § 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spina,</quote> <trans><tr>the acacia</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 12, 65, § 107</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vectis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:2" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 2</bibl></cit>. 17. —<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ā^răbĭca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (sc. gemma), <hi rend="ital">a precious stone</hi>, <hi rend="ital">similar to ivory</hi>, perh. a kind of chalcedony or onyx, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 54, § 145</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 16, 14</bibl>.—<orth extent="full" lang="la">Ā^răbĭcē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>: facite olant aedes Arabice, <hi rend="ital">make the apartments redolent with the perfumes of Araby</hi> (<hi rend="ital">frankincense</hi>, which was brought from Arabia), Plaut. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 378</bibl> P. (Arabice olet, id est ex odoribus Arabicis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=23" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 23</bibl>): Arabice sacri vocantur, <hi rend="ital">in Arabic</hi>, Sol. c. 33.</sense></entryFree>
arabilis: <entryFree id="n3314" type="hapax" key="a^ra_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ărābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>aro</etym>, <sense id="n3314.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that can be ploughed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">arable</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">campus nullis arabilis tauris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 5, 3, § 41</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
arabius: <entryFree id="n3315" type="main" key="A_^ra^bi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ā^răbĭus</orth> (incorrectly <orth extent="full" lang="la">Arr-</orth>, v. Arabia), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)ara/bios</foreign>, a secondary form of Arabus and Arabs, <sense id="n3315.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Arabian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">advecti ad Arabiam terram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:2:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 2, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">odor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 5, 4, 6</bibl></cit> (<bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 99</bibl> P. reads Arabus): <cit><quote lang="la">bombyx,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:3:15" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 3, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">limen,</quote> <trans><tr>furnished with Arabian curtains</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:14:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 14, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus capparis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 23, 44, § 127</bibl></cit> Jan.</sense></entryFree>
arabs: <entryFree id="n3316" type="main" key="A_^rabs"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ā^rabs</orth>, <itype>ăbis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> (<case>acc.</case> Gr. Arabas, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:478" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 478</bibl>), = <foreign lang="greek">*)/aray</foreign>, <sense id="n3316.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">proceeding from Arabia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Arabian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pastor Arabs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4:12:8" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4, 12, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">messor Arabs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:65:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 65, 5</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an Arab</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Arabian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Eoi Arabes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:2:24" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 2, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Eoae domus Arabum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 115</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,016:17:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Par. 17, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Act. 2, 11</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, for <hi rend="ital">Arabia</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">palmiferos Arabas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:478" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 478</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
arabus: <entryFree id="n3317" type="main" key="A_^ra^bus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ā^răbus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>a parallel form with Arabs, as Aethiopus with Aethiops; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 7, 605</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 99</bibl> P.</etym>, <sense id="n3317.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Arabian</hi>, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 99</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:15:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 15, 76</bibl></cit> Heins.: <cit><quote lang="la">lapis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:153" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 21, 41, § 153</bibl></cit>.—<orth extent="full" lang="la">Ā^răbi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the Arabs</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Arabians</hi>, C. Cassius ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 99</bibl>: <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:605" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 605</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n3318" type="main" key="A_^ra^bus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ā^răbus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*arabis</foreign>, Ptol.; <foreign lang="greek">*)ara/bios</foreign>, Arrian; <foreign lang="greek">*)/arbis</foreign>, Strab., <sense id="n3318.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river in Gedrosia</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Korkes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:10" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 10</bibl>, ubi v. Zumpt.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n3319" type="main" key="A_^ra^bus3" n="3"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ā^răbus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n3319.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the son of Apollo and Babylon</hi>, represented as the inventor of the medical art, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:196" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 56, 57, § 196</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
arachidna: <entryFree id="n3320" type="greek" key="a^ra^chidna"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ărăchidna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)ra/xidna</foreign>, <sense id="n3320.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a wild leguminous plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a kind of chickling vetch</hi>: Lathyrus amphicarpos, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 15, 52, § 89</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
arachne: <entryFree id="n3321" type="main" key="A^rachne_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ărachnē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)ara/xnh</foreign> (a spider). <sense id="n3321.0" n="I" level="1"> Myth., <hi rend="ital">a Lydian maiden</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who challenged Minerva to a trial of skill in spinning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as a punishment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">was changed by the goddess into a spider</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:5 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 5 sq.</bibl> (another form, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ărachnēa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)ara/xneia</foreign>, like Calliopēa from Calliope, <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 4, 135</bibl>).— </sense><sense id="n3321.1" n="II" level="1"> Arachne, <hi rend="ital">a kind of sundial</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:9:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 9, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
arachosia: <entryFree id="n3322" type="main" key="A^ra^cho_si^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ărăchōsĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)araxwsi/a</foreign>. <sense id="n3322.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A province of the Persian kingdom</hi>, <hi rend="ital">separated from India by the Indus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:23:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 23, 25</bibl>, <cb n="ARAT" /> § 82.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n3322.1" n="II" level="1"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n3322.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ără-chōsĭi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Arachosia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:13:4" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 13, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3322.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ărăchōtae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, the same, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> Perieg. 1003</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
aracia: <entryFree id="n3323" type="main" key="a^ra^ci^a1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ărăcĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n3323.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of white figtree</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 18, 19, § 70</bibl>, where Jan reads <hi rend="ital">aratia.</hi></sense></entryFree>
