<entryFree id="n3324" type="main" key="A^ra^ci^a2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ărăcĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)araki/a</foreign>, <sense id="n3324.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an island in the Persian Gulf</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Karek</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 25, 28, § 111</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
aracynthus: <entryFree id="n3325" type="main" key="A^ra^cynthus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ărăcynthus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)ara/kunqos</foreign>. <sense id="n3325.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A mountain in Ætolia</hi> (acc. to some, in Acarnania), now <hi rend="ital">Zygos</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 2, 3, § 6</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n3325.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A mountain between Bœotia and Attica</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4:14:42" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4, 14, 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:2:239" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 2, 239</bibl>; with the epithet Actaeus (<hi rend="ital">Attic</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 2, 24</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
aradius: <entryFree id="n3326" type="main" key="A_ra^di^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ārădĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n3326.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Aradus</hi> (now <hi rend="ital">Ruad</hi>), <hi rend="ital">a city on an island of the same name on the coast of Phœnicia</hi> (<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 20, 17, § 78</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 7</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Mann. Phoenic. p. 309): quod genus endo marist Aradī fons,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:891" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 891</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ārădĭi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Aradus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 20, 17, § 78</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
araeostylos: <entryFree id="n3327" type="greek" key="a^raeosty^los"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăraeostylos</orth>, <itype>on</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)raio/stulos</foreign>, <sense id="n3327.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">with columns standing for apart</hi>, <hi rend="ital">areostyle</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 3, 2</bibl> and 3.</sense></entryFree>
aranea: <entryFree id="n3328" type="main" key="a^ra_ne^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ărānĕa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym><foreign lang="greek">a)ra/xnh</foreign></etym>. <sense id="n3328.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A spider</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aranearum perdere texturam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:2:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 2, 2, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">antiquas exercet aranea telas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 145</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tela aranearum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Job, 8, 14</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:59:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Isa. 59, 5</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">ib. Osee, 8, 6: araneae textura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 121" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 121</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">invisa Minervae aranea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:247" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 247</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anni nostri sicut aranea meditabuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:89:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 89, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3328.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> </sense><sense id="n3328.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A spider's web</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cobweb</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(aedes) oppletae araneis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:1:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 1, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut aranea bratteaque auri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:727" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 727</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arcula plena aranearum, Afran. ap. Fest. s. v. tanne, p. 154 Müll. (Com. Rel. p. 217 Rib.): Catulli Plenus sacculus est aranearum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:13:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 13, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">summo quae pendet aranea tigno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:179" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 179</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rapt. Pros. 3, 158</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3328.3" n="B" level="2"> Also, for <hi rend="ital">threads similar to spiders' webs</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">salicis fructus ante maturitatem in araneam abit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 9, 37, § 56</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
araneans: <entryFree id="n3329" type="hapax" key="a^ra_ne^ans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ărānĕans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [as if from araneo, āre], <sense id="n3329.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">containing spiders' webs</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fauces,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>through which no food has passed for a long time</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, p. 152, 34</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
araneola: <entryFree id="n3330" type="hapax" key="a^ra_ne^o^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ărānĕŏla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>aranea</etym>, <sense id="n3330.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small spider</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:48:113" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 48, 113</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
araneolus: <entryFree id="n3331" type="hapax" key="a^ra_ne^o^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ărānĕŏlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>araneus</etym>, i. q. araneola, <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Cul. 2</bibl>.</entryFree>
araneosus: <entryFree id="n3332" type="main" key="a^ra_ne^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ărānĕōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>araneum</etym>. <sense id="n3332.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">full of spiders' webs</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">situs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:25:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 25, 3</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n3332.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">similar to cobwebs</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fila,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 19, 21, § 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caulis araneosus in mandendo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 15, 51, § 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lanugo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:108 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 12, 66, § 108 al.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
araneum: <entryFree id="n3333" type="main" key="a^ra_ne^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ărānĕum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. 2. araneus.</entryFree>
araneus: <entryFree id="n3334" type="main" key="a^ra_ne^us1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ărānĕus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym><foreign lang="greek">a)raxno/s</foreign></etym>. <sense id="n3334.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A spider</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:383" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 383</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:23:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 23, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aranei (apibus) hostiles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 19, 21, § 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">araneorum natura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 24, 28, § 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aranei textura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 121:22 al" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 121, 22 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n3334.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A sea-fish</hi>: Draco trachinus, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 11, 53, § 145</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n3335" type="main" key="a^ra_ne^us2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ărānĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. araneus</etym>. <sense id="n3335.0" n="I. A." level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Pertaining to the spider</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spider's-</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:156" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 17, 44, § 156</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">texta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 29, 4, 27, § 86</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n3335.1" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ărā-nĕum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a spider's web</hi>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)ra/xnion</foreign>: <cit><quote lang="la">tollere haec aranea quantum est laboris?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:2:8:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 2, 8, 23</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3335.2" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A disease of the vine and of the olive-tree</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 24, 36, § 7</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n3335.3" n="II" level="1"> Araneus mus, <hi rend="ital">a kind of small mouse</hi>, acc. to some <hi rend="ital">the shrew-mouse</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:17:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 17, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:227" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 58, 83, § 227</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
arapennis: <entryFree id="n3336" type="main" key="arapennis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">arapennis</orth>, v. arepennis.</entryFree>
arar: <entryFree id="n3337" type="main" key="A^rar"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ărar</orth> (also <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ărăris</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Ruf. 2, 111</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 1, 405</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4018</bibl>; <case>acc.</case> Ararim, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:1:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 1, 63</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 4, 5, § 33</bibl>; <sense id="n3337.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">and Ararin,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> B. Get. 298</bibl></cit>: <case>abl.</case> Arari, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 16</bibl> MSS.; <cit><quote lang="la">Arare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 53</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 59</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. E. 1, 63</bibl>; cf. Schneid. Gr. II. pp. 214, 298; Neue, Formenl. I. pp. 639, 184 sq., 228), <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a river in Celtic Gaul</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">the Saone</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:7:11" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 7, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 4, 5, § 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:15:504" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 15, 504</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> M. Theod. 53</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 2, 269</bibl>; cf. Mann. Gall. p. 76 (in <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 11</bibl>, called Saucona, whence comes the name <hi rend="ital">Saōne</hi>).</sense></entryFree>
ararauceles: <entryFree id="n3338" type="main" key="Ararauceles"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ararauceles</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n3338.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people in Cyrenaica in Africa</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 5, 5, § 33</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
arater: <entryFree id="n3339" type="main" key="a^ra_ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ărāter</orth>, <itype>tri</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (a rare form for aratrum), <sense id="n3339.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plough</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Limit. p. 204" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Limit. p. 204</bibl> Goes.</sense></entryFree>
arateus: <entryFree id="n3340" type="main" key="A^ra_te_us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ărātēus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Ărātī-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)ara/teios</foreign>,<cb n="ARAX" />  <sense id="n3340.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Greek poet Aratus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Aratean</hi>: lucernae, Cinna ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 6, 12</bibl>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: nostra quaedam Aratea, i. e. the <foreign lang="greek">*faino/mena</foreign> of Aratus, translated by Cicero into Latin, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:5:14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 5, 14</bibl> B. and K.; of this translation we still possess large portions; <cit><quote lang="la">v. Cic. Orell. IV. pp. 1014, 1033: carminibus Arateis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:41:104" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 41, 104</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
aratio: <entryFree id="n3341" type="main" key="a^ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ărātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>aro</etym>. <sense id="n3341.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A ploughing</hi>, and in gen. <hi rend="ital">the cultivation of the ground</hi>, <hi rend="ital">agriculture</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">iteratio arationis peracta esse debet, si, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:64" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aratione per transversum iterata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:180" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 20, 49, § 180</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut quaestuosa mercatura, fructuosa aratio dicitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:31:86" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 31, 86</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3341.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> (abstr. for concr.), <hi rend="ital">ploughed land</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:2:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 1, 2, 47</bibl> (cf. aratiuncula): <cit><quote lang="la">(calsa) nascitur in arationibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 8, 36, § 58</bibl></cit>.— Esp., in Roman financial lang., <hi rend="ital">the public farms</hi> or <hi rend="ital">plots of land farmed out for a tenth of the produce</hi> (cf. arator, I. B.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 39 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 98</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
aratiuncula: <entryFree id="n3342" type="hapax" key="a^ra_ti^uncu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ărātĭuncŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>aratio</etym>, <sense id="n3342.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small arable field</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">a small estate</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:2:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 1, 2, 46</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
aratius: <entryFree id="n3343" type="main" key="A^ra_ti_us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ărātīus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Arateus.</entryFree>
arator: <entryFree id="n3344" type="main" key="a^ra_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ărātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>aro</etym>. <sense id="n3344.0" n="I. A." level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">one that ploughs</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a ploughman;</hi> freq. <usg type="style">poet.</usg> = agricola, <hi rend="ital">a husbandman</hi>, <hi rend="ital">farmer</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 38</bibl>: caput quassans grandis suspirat arator Crebrius, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:1164" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 1164</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">luce sacrā requiescat arator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:1:5" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Concidere infelix validos miratur arator Inter opus tauros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:538" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 538</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">8, 218</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">15, 553</bibl>: neque jam stabulis gaudet pecus aut aratorigni, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 4, 3</bibl> et saep.—<hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">taurus arator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:698" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 698</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bos arator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:5" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 5</bibl></cit>; v. Zumpt, § 102.—</sense><sense id="n3344.1" n="B" level="2"> In the Rom. lang. of finance, aratores, <hi rend="ital">the cultivators of public lands for a tenth of the produce;</hi> cf. aratio, II. (usu. the Roman knights): <cit><quote lang="la">aratorum penuria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 55</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1, 37</bibl>; 2, 2, 13; 2, 2, 64; 2, 3, 20; 2, 3, 27; 2, 3, 50; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 3, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3308</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:42" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 42</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n3344.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">The Ploughman</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a constellation</hi>, Nigid. and Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. G. 1, 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
aratro: <entryFree id="n3345" type="hapax" key="a^ra_tro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ărātro</orth> and contr. <orth extent="full" lang="la">artro</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>aratrum</etym>, <sense id="n3345.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to plough</hi> after sowing: <cit><quote lang="la">quod nunc vocant artrare, id est aratrare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:182" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 20, 49, § 182</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
aratrum: <entryFree id="n3346" type="main" key="a^ra_trum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ărātrum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym><foreign lang="greek">a)/rotron</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n3346.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plough</hi> (the inventor of which was Byzyges, acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:199" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 56, 57, § 199</bibl>; or Triptolemus, acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 19</bibl>. The parts of it were temo, stiva, manicula, vomer, buris, aures, and dentale. For a description of it, v. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:162" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 162</bibl> sqq.; Pauly's Real-Ency. I. pp. 665 sq.; and Smith, Dict. Antiq.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:313" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 313</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:219" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 219</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">curvi moderator aratri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:933" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 933</bibl></cit>, and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1251" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 1251</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:chapter=18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:63:159" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 63, 159</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 19</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 170</bibl> et saep.: imprimere aratrum muris, <hi rend="ital">to press the plough into the walls</hi> (of a town), i. e. to turn a town into arable land, to destroy completely, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:16:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 16, 20</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Clem. 1:26:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Clem. 1, 26, 4</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">used for marking the boundaries of new towns,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aeneas urbem designat aratro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:755" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 755</bibl></cit>, ubi v. Serv.; Cato ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 15, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3683</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
aratus: <entryFree id="n3347" type="main" key="a^ra_tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ărātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of aro.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n3348" type="main" key="A^ra_tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ărātus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)/aratos</foreign>. <sense id="n3348.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Greek poet of Soli</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in Cilicia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who fl.</hi> B. C. 250; <hi rend="ital">author of an astronomical poem</hi>, <hi rend="ital">entitled</hi> <foreign lang="greek">*faino/mena</foreign>, which Cicero, and afterwards Caesar Germanicus, translated into Latin, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:16:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 16, 69</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:22:56" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 22, 56</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:41" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:15:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 15, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:3:23" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 3, 23</bibl> (Ărătŭs, <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Carm. 19, 125</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 23, 112</bibl>).—</sense><sense id="n3348.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Aratus of Sicyon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a distinguished Greek general</hi>, <hi rend="ital">founder of the Achœan League</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:23:81" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 23, 81</bibl> (v. his life written by Plutarch).</sense></entryFree>
arauris: <entryFree id="n3349" type="main" key="A^rauris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ărauris</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n3349.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river in</hi> Gallia Narbonensis now <hi rend="ital">Herault</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 4, 5, § 32</bibl>, where Jan reads <hi rend="ital">Araris;</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:5:6" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 5, 6</bibl>; cf. Mann. Gall. 66.</sense></entryFree>
arausio: <entryFree id="n3350" type="main" key="A^rausi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ărausĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n3350.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in</hi> Gallia Narbonensis, now <hi rend="ital">Orange</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 4, 5, § 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:5:2" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 5, 2</bibl>; cf. Mann. Gall. 93.</sense></entryFree>
araxes: <entryFree id="n3351" type="main" key="A^raxes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ăraxes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)ara/chs</foreign>. <sense id="n3351.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A river in Armenia Major</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Aras</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:728" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 728</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4:11:8" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4, 11, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Hippol. 47" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Hippol. 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 9, 9, § 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:5:5" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 3, 5, 5</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a dweller on the Araxes</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pharetratus Araxes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:2:32" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 2, 32</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3351.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A river in Persia</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Bendemir</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:5:21" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 5, 21</bibl>. <pb n="151" /> <cb n="ARBI" /></sense></entryFree>
arbaces: <entryFree id="n3352" type="main" key="Arba^ces"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Arbăces</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)arba/khs</foreign>, <sense id="n3352.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the first king of Media</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:6" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 6</bibl>; called by <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 1, 3</bibl>, Arbactus.</sense></entryFree>
arbela: <entryFree id="n3353" type="main" key="Arbe_la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Arbēla</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)/arbhla</foreign>. <sense id="n3353.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A town in Adiabene</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a province of Assyria</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Arbil. Between this town and Gaugamela</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Alexander the Great defeated Darius</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:9" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:1" default="NO">5, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 23, 6</bibl>. In <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 55, § 149</bibl>, it designates the region of Arbela.—</sense><sense id="n3353.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A town in Sicily</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:272" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 14, 272</bibl>, where MSS. also give <hi rend="ital">Arabela.</hi></sense></entryFree>
arbilla: <entryFree id="n3354" type="gloss" key="arbilla"><orth extent="full" lang="la">arbilla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = arvina, id est pinguedo corporis, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=20" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 20</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
arbis: <entryFree id="n3355" type="main" key="Arbis1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Arbis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n3355.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in Gedrosia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the river Arbis</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 23, 26, § 97</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n3356" type="main" key="Arbis2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Arbis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n3356.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river rising in Carmania</hi>, <hi rend="ital">running through Gedrosia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and emptying into the Persian Gulf</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 24, 28, § 109</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
arbiter: <entryFree id="n3357" type="main" key="arbi^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">arbĭter</orth>, <itype>tri</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>ar = ad (v. ad <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>) and bito = eo</etym>, orig., <sense id="n3357.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one that goes to</hi> something in order to see or hear it; hence, <hi rend="ital">a spectator</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beholder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hearer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an eye-witness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a witness</hi> (class. through all periods; used several times by Plaut., but only twice by Ter.; syn.: testis, speculator, conscius). </sense><sense id="n3357.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">aequi et justi hic eritis omnes arbitri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:prol. 16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. prol. 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mi quidem jam arbitri vicini sunt, meae quid fiat domi, Ita per impluvium introspectant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 2, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne arbitri dicta nostra arbitrari (i. e. speculari, v. arbitror) queant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:1:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 2, 1, 28</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:1:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 1, 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 1, 55</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 4, 4, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:5:4:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 5, 4, 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:1:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 1, 1, 50</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 3, 50</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 109</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aut desine aut cedo quemvis arbitrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:1:2:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 1, 2, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis est decisionis arbiter?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab arbitris remoto loco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">remotis arbitris,</quote> <trans><tr>after the removal of</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:31:112" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 31, 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnibus arbitris procul amotis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 20:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 20, 1</bibl></cit> Corte: <cit><quote lang="la">arbitros eicit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">remotis arbitris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sine arbitro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">absque arbitris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:39:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 39, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loca abdita et ab arbitris libera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 15, 16</bibl></cit> B; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:21:4" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 21, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">secretorum omnium arbiter, i. e. conscius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:12:9" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 12, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">procul est, ait, arbiter omnis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:458" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 458</bibl></cit> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:63" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 63</bibl>: conscius omnis abest).— </sense><sense id="n3357.2" n="II" level="1"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n3357.3" n="A" level="2"> In judic. lang., t. t., prop., <hi rend="ital">he that is appointed to inquire into a cause</hi> (cf. adire hiberna, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 52</bibl>, and intervenio) <hi rend="ital">and settle it;</hi> hence, <hi rend="ital">an umpire</hi>, <hi rend="ital">arbiter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a judge</hi>, in an actio bonae fidei (i. e. who decides acc. to equity, while the <hi rend="ital">judex</hi> decides acc. to laws), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 3:7" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 3, 7</bibl> (cf. Zimmern, Rechtsgesch. 3 B, § 8; 3 B, § 42; 3 B, § 60 sq., and the jurists there cited).— So in the fragments of the Twelve Tables: JVDICI. ARBITROVE. REOVE. DIES. DIFFISVS. ESTO., ap. Paul. ex Fest. s. v. reus, p. 227 Müll.: <hi rend="ital">Prae</hi>TOR. ARBITROS. TRES. DATO. ap. Fest. s. v. vindiciae, p. 376 Müll., and the ancient judicial formula: <cit><quote lang="la">P. J. A. V. P. V. D., i. e. PRAETOREM JVDICEM ARBITRVMVE POSTVLO VTI DET,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0996,001:page=1539" default="NO"><author>Val. Prob.</author> p. 1539</bibl></cit> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">ibo ad arbitrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:3:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 3, 101</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 3, 104</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Vicini nostri hic ambigunt de finibus: Me cepere arbitrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:1:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 1, 90</bibl></cit> (arbiter dabatur his, qui de finibus regendis ambigerent, Don.); so, <cit><quote lang="la">arbiter Nolanis de finibus a senatu datus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:10:33" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 10, 33</bibl></cit>.—Of the Hebrew judges: <cit><quote lang="la">subjacebit damno, quantum arbitri judicaverint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:21:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 21, 22</bibl></cit>.—Hence, trop.: <cit><quote lang="la">Taurus immensus ipse et innumerarum gentium arbiter,</quote> <trans><tr>that sets boundaries to numerous tribes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 27, 27, § 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbitrum familiae herciscundae postulavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:chapter=7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 7</bibl></cit>: arbitrum illum adegit (i. e. ad arbitrum illum egit; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">adigo),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:16:66" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 16, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis in hanc rem fuit arbiter?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 4, 12</bibl></cit>.—In the time of Cicero, when, acc. to the Lex Aebutia, the decisions were given in definite formulae of the praetor, the formal distinction between judex and arbiter disappeared, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:chapter=12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 12 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n3357.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> from the sphere of judicial proceedings, <hi rend="ital">a judge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an arbitrator</hi>, <hi rend="ital">umpire</hi>, in gen.: arbiter inter antiquam Academiam et Zenonem. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:20:53" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 20, 53</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Judicet Dominus, arbiter hujus diei, inter etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,026:11:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Jud. 11, 27</bibl></cit>.—So of Paris: <cit><quote lang="la">arbiter formae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:16:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 16, 69</bibl></cit>: pugnae, <hi rend="ital">the judge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">umpire of the contest</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">o( brabeuth/s</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:20:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 20, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">favor arbiter coronae,</quote> <trans><tr>which adjudged the prize of victory</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:72:10" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 72, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3357.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">He that rules over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">governs</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">manages</hi> something, <hi rend="ital">a lord</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ruler</hi>, <hi rend="ital">master</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> or in post-Aug. prose; syn.: rex, dominus): <cb n="ARBI" /> arbiter imperii (Augustus), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:2:47" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 2, 47</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">armorum (Mars),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:73" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 3, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bibendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:7:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 7, 25</bibl></cit> (cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 4, 18</bibl>: nec regna vini sortiere talis, and in Gr. <foreign lang="greek">basileu\s tou= sumposi/ou</foreign>): <cit><quote lang="la">quo (sc. Noto) non arbiter Hadriae Major,</quote> <trans><tr>who rules over the sea</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 3, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbiter Eurystheus irae Junonis iniquae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the executor</tr>, <tr>fulfiller of her wrath</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:9:45 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 9, 45 al.</bibl></cit>—In prose, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">regni,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 14</bibl></cit>, where Halm reads <hi rend="ital">arbitrium</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">di potentium populorum arbitri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(JOVI) RERVM RECTORI FATORVMQVE ARBITRO,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 1269</bibl></cit> et saep.</sense></entryFree>
arbiterium: <entryFree id="n3358" type="main" key="arbi^te_rium"><orth extent="full" lang="la">arbĭtērium</orth>, v. arbitrium.</entryFree>
arbitra: <entryFree id="n3359" type="hapax" key="arbi_^tra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">arbī^tra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>arbiter</etym>, <sense id="n3359.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a female witness</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbitrae Nox et Diana,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:5:50" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 5, 50</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
arbitralis: <entryFree id="n3360" type="hapax" key="arbi_^tra_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">arbī^trālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n3360.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of an arbiter</hi> or <hi rend="ital">umpire</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">judicatio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 7, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
arbitrario: <entryFree id="n3361" type="main" key="arbi_^tra_ri^o_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">arbī^trārĭō</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. arbitrarius.</entryFree>
arbitrarius: <entryFree id="n3362" type="main" key="arbi_^tra_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">arbī^trārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>arbiter</etym>. <sense id="n3362.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of arbitration</hi>, <hi rend="ital">arbitrating</hi>, <hi rend="ital">done by way of arbitration</hi>: formula, Gai <bibl default="NO"><author>Inst.</author> 4, 163</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">actio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:13:4:2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 13, 4, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. Zimmern, Rechtsgesch. 3 B, §§ 67 and 68.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n3362.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n3362.2" n="A" level="2"> In Plaut. (with ref. to the distinction in law lang. between certus and arbitrarius: <cit><quote lang="la">judicium est pecuniae certae, arbitrium incertae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:chapter=4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 4</bibl></cit>; cf. Zimmern, Rechtsgesch. 3 B, § 57) = incertus, <hi rend="ital">uncertain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not sure</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc certum est, non arbitrarium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:216" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 216</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">arbī^trārĭō</orth>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc pol ego perii certo, non arbitrario,</quote> <trans><tr>there's no mistake about it</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:5:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 3, 5, 42</bibl></cit> (the only <pos>adv.</pos> of this word in use).—</sense><sense id="n3362.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Depending on the will</hi>, <hi rend="ital">arbitrary</hi> (cf. precarius): <cit><quote lang="la">motus in arteriā naturalis, non arbitrarius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 18, 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
arbitratio: <entryFree id="n3363" type="main" key="arbi_^tra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">arbī^trātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>arbitror</etym>, <sense id="n3363.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the judgment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">will</hi>, = arbitratus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:20:19" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 20, 19</bibl>; Imp. Valent. ap. Scriptt. R. Agr. p. 342 Goes.</sense></entryFree>
arbitrator: <entryFree id="n3364" type="main" key="arbi_^tra_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">arbī^trātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, in late Lat. = arbiter, II. B., <sense id="n3364.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a master</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ruler</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lord</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">JVPPITER ARBITRATOR,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Gud.</author> 7, 5</bibl></cit>.—Hence a place in the tenth district at Rome is called Pentapylon Jovis arbitratoris, Publ. Victor. Reg. 10.</sense></entryFree>
arbitratrix: <entryFree id="n3365" type="hapax" key="arbi_^tra_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">arbī^trātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>arbitrator</etym>, <sense id="n3365.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mistress</hi>, <hi rend="ital">female ruler</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 2, 12 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
arbitratus: <entryFree id="n3366" type="main" key="arbi_^tra_tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">arbī^trātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of arbitror.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n3367" type="main" key="arbi_^tra_tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">arbī^trātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>arbitror</etym>. <sense id="n3367.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The judgment</hi> (as will, not as opinion; accordingly = voluntas, not = sententia), <hi rend="ital">freewill</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inclination</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pleasure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">choice</hi>, <hi rend="ital">decision</hi> (class.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:20:19" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 20, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic allegatus et hic arbitratus pro allegatione proque arbitratione dicuntur. Quā ratione servatā arbitratu et allegatu meo dicimus, which latter expression is most freq. used): viri boni arbitratu resolvetur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 149, 2</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 145, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbitratu domini,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 144, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc quidem meo arbitratu loquar libere, quae volam et quae lubebit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Vapulabis meo arbitratu et novorum aedilium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:2:148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 4, 2, 148</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:1:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 3, 1, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:5:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 5, 2, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:5:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 5, 5, 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:6:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 4, 6, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 5, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tuus arbitratus sit: comburas, si velis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:4:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 4, 1, 21</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:5:2:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 5, 2, 68</bibl>: <hi rend="ital">Er.</hi> Agedum, excutedum pallium. <hi rend="ital">St.</hi> Tuo arbitratu, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:4:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 4, 4, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:3:2:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 3, 2, 50</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 3, 2, 106</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:2:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 4, 2, 87</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:2:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 2, 2, 66</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:5:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 5, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quas (sententias) exposui arbitratu meo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:1:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut id meo arbitratu facerem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:21:72" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 21, 72</bibl></cit>, and <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 1, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tuo vero id quidem arbitratu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:8:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 8, 28</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:11:42" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 11, 42</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 42 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">suo arbitratu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 1, 1, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ejus arbitratu fieri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:3:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 4, 3, 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbitratu suo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:68" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 68</bibl></cit>: <hi rend="ital">Tr.</hi> Quoius arbitratu nos vis facere? <hi rend="ital">Gr.</hi> Viduli arbitratu, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:3:63 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 3, 63 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 3, 66</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">senatūs arbitratu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:34" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 34</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 35</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3367.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Direction</hi>, <hi rend="ital">guidance</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">considerare oportet, cujus arbitratu sit educatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:25" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 25</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 185, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
arbitrium: <entryFree id="n3368" type="main" key="arbi_^tri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">arbī^trĭum</orth> (in good MSS. and inscrr. sometimes <orth extent="full" lang="la">arbī^tērĭum</orth>), <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>from arbiter, as adulterium from adulter</etym>. <sense id="n3368.0" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a coming near</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a being present</hi>, <hi rend="ital">presence;</hi> hence meton. for <hi rend="ital">persons present</hi> (only in post-Aug. poets): locus ab omni liber arbitrio. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Hippol. 602" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Hippol. 602</bibl>, and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 485" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Herc. Oet. 485</bibl>: divina rerum cura sine arbitrio est, <cb n="ARBI" /> Auct. Aetnae, 195.—</sense><sense id="n3368.1" n="II" level="1"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n3368.2" n="A. 1." level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The judgment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">decision of an arbitrator</hi> (cf. arbiter, II.: arbitrium dicitur sententia, quae ab arbitro statuitur, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=13" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 13</bibl> Müll.): <cit><quote lang="la">aliud est judicium, aliud arbitrium. Judicium est pecuniae certae: arbitrium incertae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:chapter=4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Q. Scaevola summam vim dicebat esse in omnibus iis arbitriis, in quibus adderetur ex fide bonā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:17:70" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 17, 70</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">arbitrium rei uxoriae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:17:66" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Top. 17, 66</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:24:3:66" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 24, 3, 66 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:46:3:82" default="NO">46, 3, 82</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:chapter=9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbitrium pro socio condemnari solerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,001:4:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Quinct. 4, 13</bibl></cit> B. and K. (here some consider arbitrium as a gloss, others read <hi rend="ital">arbitrio</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ad arbitrium</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ad arbitrum</hi>, and the like; v. Orell. ad h. l.).—</sense><sense id="n3368.3" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> from the sphere of judic. proceedings, <hi rend="ital">judgment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">opinion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">decision</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbitrium vestrum, vestra existimatio Valebit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:prol. 25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. prol. 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum de te splendida Minos Fecerit arbitria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:7:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 7, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de aliquo arbitria agere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbitria belli pacisque agere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 44, 15</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 60</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">agere arbitria victoriae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:1" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. Gron. Observ. 4, c. 11, p. 427, and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:37" default="NO" valid="yes">32, 37</bibl>.— <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">res ab opinionis arbitrio sejunctae,</quote> <trans><tr>matters</tr>, <tr>in which nothing is decided according to mere opinion</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:23:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 23, 108</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si volet usus, Quem penes arbitrium est et jus et norma loquendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 72</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Clem. 2:7" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Clem. 2, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbitrio consilioque uti auris,</quote> <trans><tr>to determine by the ear</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:20:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 20, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3368.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Mastery</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dominion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">authority</hi>, <hi rend="ital">power</hi>, <hi rend="ital">will</hi>, <hi rend="ital">free-will</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dedunt se In ditionem atque in arbitrium cuncti Thebano poplo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 103</bibl></cit> (Fleck., <hi rend="ital">arbitratum</hi>): esse in pectore nostro quiddam, Cujus ad arbitrium quoque copia materiaiï Cogitur interdum flecti per membra, per artus, <hi rend="ital">and at whose bidding the accumulated materials must yield obedience in every joint and limb</hi>, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:281" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 281</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus (Jovis) nutu et arbitrio caelum, terra mariaque reguntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:45:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 45, 131</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad alicujus arbitrium et nutum totum se fingere et adcommodare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:8:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 8, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:10:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 1, 10, 30</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 5, 63</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,003:13:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Lev. 13, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">13, 44</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid facere arbitrio suo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Mentes ad suum arbitrium movere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:16:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 16, 70</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:5:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Par. 5, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam (pecuniam) sponte et arbitrio cordis sui inferunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,014:12:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 4 Reg. 12, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vixit ad aliorum arbitrium, non ad suum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:chapter=9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 9</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:6:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 6, 40</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 2, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:9" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tit.:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tit. 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Galb. 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in arbitrium vestrum diem constituistis ei,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Judith, 8, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orationem tibi misi: ejus custodiendae et proferendae arbitrium tuum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 15, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">munificentiam eorum in se ipsorum arbitrii debere esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in arbitrio viri erit, ut faciat sive non faciat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,004:30:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Num. 30, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tamquam congruere operationem eam serpentium humani sit arbitrī,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 3, 12, § 53</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:18" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 2</bibl>: mox rei Romanae arbitrium (i. e. imperium, <hi rend="ital">dominion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">power</hi>) tribus ferme et viginti (annis) obtinuit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 51</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">arbitrium orbis terrarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:7" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,009:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Con. 4, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">huic deus optandi gratum, sed inutile fecit Muneris arbitrium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">liberum mortis arbitrium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:8" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">11</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 60</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3368.5" n="C" level="2"> Arbitria funeris, <hi rend="ital">the expenses of a funeral</hi> (fixed by an arbiter), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:chapter=37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Dom. 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:chapter=9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,019:chapter=7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Red. in Sen. 7</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:7:12:section=6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 11, 7, 12, § 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
arbitro: <entryFree id="n3369" type="main" key="arbi^tro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">arbĭtro</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, v. arbitror <sense id="n3369.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
arbitror: <entryFree id="n3370" type="main" key="arbi^tror"><orth extent="full" lang="la">arbĭtror</orth> (<sense id="n3370.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">act.</hi> arbitro, <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>; arch. <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> arbitrarier, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 4, 1, 21</bibl>), <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos> <etym>arbiter</etym>. </sense><sense id="n3370.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to be a hearer</hi> or <hi rend="ital">beholder</hi> of something (v. arbiter, I.), <hi rend="ital">to observe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perceive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hear</hi>, etc. (in this sense only ante- and post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">dicta alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:1:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 1, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 4, 1, 21</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 10, p. 246, 16</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3</bibl>, p. 138, 23; 7 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">domus attiguae fortunas arbitraturus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4</bibl></cit>, p. 148, 8.—Hence of the mind, <hi rend="ital">to examine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consider</hi>, <hi rend="ital">weigh</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">diligentius carmina Empedoclis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:11:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 11, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3370.2" n="II" level="1"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n3370.3" n="A" level="2"> T. t. of judic. lang. (cf. arbiter, II.), <hi rend="ital">to make a decision</hi>, <hi rend="ital">give judgment</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sentence</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si in eo, quod utroque praesente arbitratus est, arbitrio paritum non esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:8:44" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 4, 8, 44</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:6:1:35" default="NO">6, 1, 35</bibl>.—Hence, fidem alicui arbitrari, <hi rend="ital">to adjudge</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to give</hi>, <hi rend="ital">credit to one</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to put faith in</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:6:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 3, 6, 41</bibl>.—Of witnesses, as t. t., <hi rend="ital">to testify</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to declare</hi> or <hi rend="ital">announce</hi>, <hi rend="ital">give evidence</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui testimonium diceret, ut arbitrari se diceret, etiam quod ipse vidisset,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 47, 146</bibl></cit>: qui primum<pb n="152" /> <cb n="ARBO" />  illud verbum consideratissimum nostrae consuetudinis arbitror, quo nos etiam tunc utimur, cum ea dicimus jurati, quae comperta habemus, quae ipsi vidimus, ex toto testimonio suo sustulit, atque omnia se scire dixit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:chapter=9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Font. 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mortuum inde arbitrari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:13:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 13, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:40" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 40</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3370.4" n="B. 1." level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to be of the opinion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to believe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consider as</hi>, = <foreign lang="greek">nomi/zw</foreign> (most freq. in prose; a favorite word with Cic.): Bene facta male locata male facta arbitror, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:18:62" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 18, 62</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">gratum arbitratur esse id a vobis sibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:prol. 48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. prol. 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nefas esse arbitrari Gracchos laudare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Falsum arbitror radices arborum vetustate minui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 31, 56, § 130</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Justum autem arbitror suscitarc vos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> 2</bibl></cit> Pet. 1, 13: <cit><quote lang="la">scelestissimum te arbitror,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbitraris me inimicum tuum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Job, 13, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> Philipp. 3, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si hoc minus ad officium tuum pertinere arbitrabere, suscipiam partes, quas alienas esse arbitrabar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut in ceteris artibus ... similiter arbitror in hac ratione dicendi etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:16:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 16, 70</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,001:chapter=34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Quinct. 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:chapter=169" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 169</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:chapter=17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:chapter=30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Arch. 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:chapter=24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Deiot. 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:chapter=21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tamen, ut arbitror, auctoritate advocatorum adducti in veritate manserunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:chapter=63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 63</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sex. Rosc. 82</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:chapter=58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 58</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:chapter=176" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 176</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ego arbitror,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:chapter=16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:chapter=68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 68</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sicut arbitror,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:chapter=50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego quod ad me attinet (itemque arbitror ceteros) idcirco taceo, quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ad Q. Fr. 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbitratus id bellum celeriter confici posse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Jugurtham esse arbitrati cum magno gaudio obvii procedunt,</quote> <trans><tr>thinking it to be Jugurtha</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 69:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 69, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non satis tuta eadem loca sibi arbitratus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alcib. 9, 1</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,013:3:3 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Timoth. 3, 3 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n3370.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To think</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suppose</hi>, as opp. to knowing: <cit><quote lang="la">Arbitror: Certum non scimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 1, 2, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si hunc noris satis, Non ita arbitrere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. 5, 4, 12</bibl></cit>: <hi rend="ital">De.</hi> Sanumne credis te esse? <hi rend="ital">Mi.</hi> Equidem arbitror, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:7:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 4, 7, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Quid consilii ceperis, quem nostrūm ignorare arbitraris?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:chapter=31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbitrantur se posse fugere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,019:16:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Esth. 16, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:10:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Matt. 10, 34</bibl>.!*? </sense><sense id="n3370.6" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> form <orth extent="full" lang="la">arbĭtro</orth>, āre: <cit><quote lang="la">te si arbitrarem dignum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:2:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 2, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Probiores credo arbitrabunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:2:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 1, 2, 87</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n3370.7" n="b" level="4"> Arbitror in <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi> signif.: <cit><quote lang="la">continuo arbitretur (i. e. eligatur, quaeratur) uxor filio tuo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:2:2:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ipse praedonum socius arbitraretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 41</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:chapter=16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 16 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 11</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Zumpt ad Cic. Verr. l. l.: quaestio in utramque partem a prudentibus viris arbitrata, i. e. judicata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:13" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sumptus funeris arbitrantur pro facultatibus defuncti,</quote> <trans><tr>are estimated</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:7:12" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 11, 7, 12</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:8:27" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 4, 8, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:15:8" default="NO">2, 15, 8</bibl>: ex scriptis eorum, qui veri arbitrantur, <foreign lang="greek">u(polamba/nontai</foreign>, Cael. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 792</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
arbocala: <entryFree id="n3371" type="main" key="Arbo^ca^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Arbŏcăla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n3371.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in</hi> Hispania Tarraconensis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 5, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
arbor: <entryFree id="n3372" type="main" key="arbor1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">arbor</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">arbŏs</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:774" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 774</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:786" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 786</bibl> Lachm.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:212" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 212</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:153" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 1, 153</bibl> (but Merk. <sense id="n3372.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">arbor</hi>, in both places); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:3:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 3, 56</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 2, 57</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 81</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 3, 27</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 206</bibl> Rib. al.: <case>acc.</case> arbosem, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=15" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 15</bibl> Müll.), <itype>ŏris</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (<gen>m.</gen>, INTER DVOS ARBORES, Inscr. Lyon, I. 27) [v. arduus]. </sense><sense id="n3372.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A tree.</hi> </sense><sense id="n3372.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: arbores serere, <hi rend="ital">to plant</hi>, Caecil. Stat. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:14:31" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 14, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:17:59" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 17, 59</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">poni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:278" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 278</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbos se sustulit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbores putare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 32, 1</bibl></cit>: arbores frondescere, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:28:69" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 28, 69</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">arboribus frondes redeunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:237" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 237</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbos silvestris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:3:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 3, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ramosa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5</bibl></cit> [1096]: <cit><quote lang="la">umbrosa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 66</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:5:41" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 5, 41</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:404" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 404</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">summa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:557" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 557</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">patula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:1:106" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 106</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fertilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 142</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quibus (arboribus) non truncus, non rami, non folia sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:46:178" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 46, 178</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub ramis arboris altae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 30</bibl></cit>, and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 108</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">arborum rami,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,033:17:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Sap. 17, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbor nuda sine frondibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:690" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 690</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,002:11:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Marc. 11, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">arborum cortices,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Job, 30, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbores ab radicibus subruere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 31, 56, § 130</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 3, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quarum (arborum) baca,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:14:31" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 14, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jacent sua quāque sub arbore poma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:7:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 7, 54</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,003:26:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Lev. 26, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fructus arborum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:5:26" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 5, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,033:10:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Sap. 10, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3372.3" n="B" level="2"> Spec. with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> of species: alni, <hi rend="ital">the alder-tree</hi>, Varr. <cb n="ARBU" /> R.
