R. 1, 7, 7: <cit><quote lang="la">fici,</quote> <trans><tr>the fig-tree</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 17, 41</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:21:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 21, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbores ficorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:59" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 59</bibl></cit>: arbor ficus (<case>nom.</case>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,026:9:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Jud. 9, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">abietis arbores,</quote> <trans><tr>fir trees</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbor palmae,</quote> <trans><tr>the palm-tree</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:94" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cupressūs,</quote> <trans><tr>the cypress</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vesp. 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbor sycomorus,</quote> <trans><tr>a sycamore</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:19:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Luc. 19, 4</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">arbor morus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> ib. 17, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbores olivarum,</quote> <trans><tr>olive trees</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:27:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Exod. 27, 20</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Jovis,</quote> <trans><tr>the oak-tree</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 106</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Phoebi,</quote> <trans><tr>the laurel-tree</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:139" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 3, 139</bibl></cit> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:6:91" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 91</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Apollinea laurus): Palladis,</quote> <trans><tr>the olive-tree</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:518" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 2, 518</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbor Herculea,</quote> <trans><tr>the poplar</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 66</bibl></cit> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Arborum genera numinibus suis dicata perpetuo servantur, ut Jovi aesculus, Apollini laurus, Minervae olea, Veneri myrtus, Herculi populus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 1, 2, § 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:3:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 3, 17</bibl>) al.—</sense><sense id="n3372.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> </sense><sense id="n3372.5" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Things made of wood</hi> (cf.: Mille sunt usus earum (arborum), sine quīs vita degi non possit. Arbore sulcamus, maria terrasque admovemus; arbore exaedificamus tecta; <cit><quote lang="la">arborea et simulacra numinum fuere etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 1, 2, § 5</bibl></cit>). </sense><sense id="n3372.6" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A mast.</hi> </sense><sense id="n3372.7" n="(a)" level="5"> With mali: <cit><quote lang="la">adversique infigitur arbore mali,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:504" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 504</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3372.8" n="(b)" level="5"> Without mali, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:332" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 332</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:129" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 129</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 1</bibl>. 2, t. 3.—</sense><sense id="n3372.9" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The lever</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bar of a press</hi>, <hi rend="ital">press-beam</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 18, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">18, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:317" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 31, 74, § 317</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3372.10" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">An oar</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">centenāque arbore fluctum Verberat adsurgens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:207" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 207</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3372.11" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A ship</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Phrixeam petiit Pelias arbor ovem,</quote> <trans><tr>the ship Argo</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:12:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 12, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3372.12" n="5" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The shaft of a javelin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a javelin</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:12:769" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 12, 769</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3372.13" n="6" level="3"> Euphemist.: arbor infelix, <hi rend="ital">a gallows</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gibbet</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">caput obnubito, arbori infelici suspendito,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:26:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 26, 7</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 26, 45, § 108</bibl> (Niebuhr, Röm. Gesch. I. § 365, compares the words of the Fries. law: am argen vordern Baum henken; cf. in Engl. <hi rend="ital">to hang on the accursed tree</hi>).—</sense><sense id="n3372.14" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The fabulous polypus</hi>, which was fancied to have arms like the branches of a tree: <cit><quote lang="la">In Gaditano Oceano arbor in tantum vastis dispansa armis, ut fretum numquam intrāsse credatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 4, 3, § 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n3373" type="main" key="Arbor2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Arbor</orth> <itype>infelix</itype>, <sense id="n3373.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town and castle in Rhœtia</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Arbon</hi>, Tab. Peut.</sense></entryFree>
arborarius: <entryFree id="n3374" type="main" key="arbo^ra_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">arbŏrārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>arbor</etym> (a technical form of arboreus), <sense id="n3374.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to trees</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tree-</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">falx,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>for pruning trees</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 10, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">31, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:22:5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 22, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">picus,</quote> <trans><tr>a woodpecker</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 16, 53, § 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proventus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 11</bibl></cit> and 23.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">arbŏrārĭa</orth> (sc. herba), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the blackivy</hi>, as growing on trees, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 98</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
arborator: <entryFree id="n3375" type="main" key="arbo^ra_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">arbŏrātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n3375.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a pruner of trees</hi> (syn. frondator), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:1:12" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 1, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:330" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 33, 76, § 330</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
arboresco: <entryFree id="n3376" type="hapax" key="arbo^resco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">arbŏresco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n3376.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch.</hi> [id.], <hi rend="ital">to become a tree</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to grow to be a tree</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 4, 22, § 62</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
arboretum: <entryFree id="n3377" type="hapax" key="arbo^re_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">arbŏrētum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, i. q. arbustum, but an inferior word, <sense id="n3377.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a place grown with trees</hi>: arboreta ignobilius verbum est, arbusta celebratius, Quadrig. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:2:25" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 2, 25</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
arboreus: <entryFree id="n3378" type="main" key="arbo^re^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">arbŏrĕus</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">arbŏrĭus</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=137" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 137</bibl> Müll.), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n3378.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to a tree</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">frondes arboreae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:632" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 632</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 637</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">radix,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:8:379" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 379</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">umbra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:10:129" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 129</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fetus = poma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:125" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 125</bibl></cit>; 10, 665; 13, 820; 14, 625; <cit><quote lang="la">15, 97: fetus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 55</bibl></cit>; Col. poët. 10, 401: fruges, Cornif. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. G. 1, 55</bibl>: coma, <hi rend="ital">tresses</hi>, <hi rend="ital">locks</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">leaves</hi>, = frondes, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:14:28" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 14, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">comae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:16:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 16, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frondes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:3:5:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 5, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">folia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 15, 51, § 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cornua cervorum,</quote> <trans><tr>branching</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:190" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 190</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">telum coruscat, Ingens, arboreum,</quote> <trans><tr>huge</tr>, <tr>like a tree</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 888</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Harundini Indicae (est) arborea amplitudo,</quote> <trans><tr>attains the size of a tree</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:162" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 36, 65, § 162</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
arbos: <entryFree id="n3379" type="main" key="arbo^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">arbŏs</orth>, v. arbor <sense id="n3379.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
arbuscula: <entryFree id="n3380" type="main" key="arbuscu^la1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">arbuscŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>from arbor, as majusculus, minusculus, from major, minor</etym>. <sense id="n3380.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A small tree</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shrub.</hi> </sense><sense id="n3380.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:15" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:10:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 10, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:11:13" default="NO">5, 11, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:79" default="NO">11, 2, 79</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3380.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of a tuft of feathers: <cit><quote lang="la">arbuscula crinita,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the crown on the head of the peacock</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 44, § 121</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3380.3" n="II" level="1"> In mechanics, <hi rend="ital">a movable machine for propelling military engines</hi>, Gr. <foreign lang="greek">a(maco/podes</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n3381" type="main" key="Arbuscu^la2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Arbuscŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n3381.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a mimic actress in the time of Cicero</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:10:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 10, 77</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
arbustivus: <entryFree id="n3382" type="main" key="arbusti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">arbustīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>arbustum</etym> <cb n="ARCA" /> (only in Col.). <sense id="n3382.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Planted with trees</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">locus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:13:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 13, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3382.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Bound</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fastened to a tree</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:1:8" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 1, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:Arb. 4:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Arb. 4, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:16:4" default="NO">16, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">positio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:1:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbusti Aminei urna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:41:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 41, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus musti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:41:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 41, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
arbusto: <entryFree id="n3383" type="hapax" key="arbusto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">arbusto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n3383.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to plant with trees</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Transpadana Italia, cornu, populo, quercu arbustat agros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:201" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 23, 35, § 201</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
arbustum: <entryFree id="n3384" type="main" key="arbustum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">arbustum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>qs. for arbosetum from arbos, as virgultum for virguletum, salictum for salicetum, etc.; an inferior form is arboretum, q. v.</etym>, <sense id="n3384.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a place where trees are planted</hi> (esp. trees, about which the vine was trained), <hi rend="ital">an orchard</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plantation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vineyard planted with trees</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">dendrw/n</foreign> (while <hi rend="ital">vinea</hi> was one in which the vine lay upon the earth, or was supported by poles): <cit><quote lang="la">Jam vinctae vites, jam falcem arbusta reponunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:416" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 416</bibl></cit>. </sense><sense id="n3384.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinea est prima ... septimo silva caedua, octavo arbustum, nono glandaria silva,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">In fundo suum quicquid conseri oportet arbustoque vitem copulari,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:15:54" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 15, 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:6:37" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 6, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:7:1" default="NO">5, 7, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:Arb. 1:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Arb. 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:16:2" default="NO">16, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:207" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 23, 35, § 207</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Feb. 10, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 1, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:7:29 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 7, 29 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n3384.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, for the most part in the <number>plur.</number> collect. for arbores, in the poets, on account of its quantity, ārbŏrēs: locos, Ingenio arbusta ubi nata sunt, non obsita, Naev. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 323, 2</bibl> (Trag. Rel. p. 10 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">e terrāque exorta repente arbusta salirent,</quote> <trans><tr>trees springing up suddenly from the earth</tr>, <tr>shot forth</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:187" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 187</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">florescunt tempore certo arbusta,</quote> <trans><tr>trees blossom at the appointed time</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:671" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 671</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:351" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 351</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:806" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 806</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:808" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 808</bibl>; 2, 188; 2, 1016; 5, 912; 5, 1378; 6, 141; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:1:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 1, 40</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 2</bibl>; 5, 64; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:328" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 3, 328</bibl>; id. Copa, 27; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:363" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 10, 363</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:286" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 286</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 710 al.</bibl>—So also perh. in the <number>sing.</number> for a single tree: <cit><quote lang="la">cum me arbustum videre Miconis incidere falce,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 3, 10</bibl></cit>.—In the Vulg. only in <number>plur.</number>, and there for rami, <hi rend="ital">boughs</hi>, <hi rend="ital">branches</hi>: arbusta ejus (vitis) cedros Dei, Psa. 79, 11: Multiplicata sunt arbusta ejus, Ezech. 31, 5; 31, 7; 31, 12.</sense></entryFree>
arbustus: <entryFree id="n3385" type="main" key="arbustus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">arbustus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>arbos, arbor</etym>. <sense id="n3385.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Set</hi> or <hi rend="ital">planted with trees</hi>: ager, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:5:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 5, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">locus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:13:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 13, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 29, 41, § 77</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n3385.1" n="II" level="1"> Arbusta vitis for arbustiva, <hi rend="ital">fastened to</hi> or <hi rend="ital">trained upon a tree</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:207" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 23, 35, § 207</bibl>.—* <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: arbustiores res, trop., <hi rend="ital">firmer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">surer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">more settled circumstances</hi> (the figure drawn from vines, which are supported on trees more firmly than upon frames), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 2, 29</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
arbuteus: <entryFree id="n3386" type="main" key="arbu^te^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">arbŭtĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>arbutus</etym>, <sense id="n3386.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of the arbute</hi> or <hi rend="ital">strawberry-tree</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fetus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:166" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 166</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">liber,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:584" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 584</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virgae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 65</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
arbutum: <entryFree id="n3387" type="main" key="arbu^tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">arbŭtum</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">arbĭtum</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:941" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 941</bibl>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n3387.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the fruit of the arbute</hi> or <hi rend="ital">strawberrytree</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the wild strawberry.</hi> </sense><sense id="n3387.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae nunc hiberno tempore cernis Arbita puniceo fieri matura colore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:941" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 941</bibl></cit>: glandes atque arbuta vel pira lecta (as the food of man in the state of nature; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:1:4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 1, 4</bibl>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:5:963" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 963</bibl>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 148</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 520</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3387.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> </sense><sense id="n3387.3" n="A" level="2"> = arbutus, <hi rend="ital">the arbute</hi> or <hi rend="ital">strawberry-tree</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jubeo frondentia capris Arbuta sufficere, i. e. frondes arbuti,</quote> <trans><tr>that you give the goats a supply of arbuteshoots</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:300" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 300</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:3:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> E. 3, 82</bibl>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:181" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 4, 181</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3387.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A tree</hi>, in gen., <bibl default="NO"><author>Rutil.</author> Itin. 1, 31</bibl>. (The gram. Phocas considers arbuta in the signif. A. and B. as heterogen. from arbutus; v. Phoc. Ars, p. 1706 P., p. 338 Lind.)</sense></entryFree>
arbutus: <entryFree id="n3388" type="main" key="arbu^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">arbŭtus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>kindr. with arbor, since the arbutus was abundant in Italy</etym>, <sense id="n3388.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the wild strawberry-tree</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the arbute</hi>, <hi rend="ital">arbutus</hi>: Arbutus unedo, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 102</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 69</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:9:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 9, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:10:4" default="NO">8, 10, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 24, 28, § 99</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:151 al" default="NO" valid="yes">23, 8, 79, § 151 al.</bibl>; its fruit, like that of the oak, was anciently the food of men; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">arbutum. Under it the goats were fond of grazing: dulce satis umor, depulsis arbutus haedis, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:3:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 3, 82</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:17:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 17, 5</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and idle men of reposing: nunc viridi membra sub arbuto Stratus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 1, 21</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
arca: <entryFree id="n3389" type="main" key="arca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">arca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>arceo: <cit><quote lang="la">arca et arx quasi res secretae, a quibus omnes arceantur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 1, 262</bibl></cit>; v. arceo</etym>, <sense id="n3389.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a place for keeping any thing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a chest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">box.</hi> </sense><sense id="n3389.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n3389.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">arca vestiaria,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 11, 3</bibl></cit>: ex illā oleā arcam esse factam eoque <pb n="153" /> <cb n="ARCA" /> conditas sortes, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:41:86" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 41, 86</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:63" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 63</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">arca ingens variorum venenorum plena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:59 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 59 al.</bibl></cit>—Very freq., </sense><sense id="n3389.3" n="B" level="2"> Esp., </sense><sense id="n3389.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A box for money</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a safe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a coffer</hi>, and particularly of the rich, and loculi was their <hi rend="ital">purse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">porte-monnaie</hi>, while sacculus was the <hi rend="ital">pouch</hi> of the poor, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:89 sq" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 89 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:26" default="NO">11, 26</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:259" default="NO">14, 259</bibl> Ruperti, and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:13:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 13, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=182" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 182</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">populus me sibilat: at mihi plaudo Ipse domi, simul ac nummos contemplor in arcā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 67</bibl></cit>.—Hence, meton., like our purse, for <hi rend="ital">the money in it</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">arcae nostrae confidito,</quote> <trans><tr>rely upon my purse</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ad Q. Fr. 2, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:6:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Par. 6, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:23:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 23, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:3:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 3, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:8:9" default="NO">8, 8, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:19:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 19, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 26" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 26 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>— Hence, ex arcā absolvere aliquem, <hi rend="ital">to pay in cash upon the spot</hi> (opp. de mensae scripturā absolvere), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:4:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 2, 4, 13</bibl> Don.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:7:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 5, 7, 29</bibl> Don., and arcarius.—And of <hi rend="ital">public money</hi>, <hi rend="ital">state treasure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">revenues</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">frumentaria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:4:1:section=2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 4, 1, § 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinaria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 10:42 al" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 10, 42 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n3389.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A coffin</hi> (cf. Smith, Dict. Antiq.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 29</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 13, 27, § 85</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:1:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 1, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cadavera Conservus vili portanda locabat in arcā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:8:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 8, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:8:736" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 8, 736</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:7" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 11, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3560</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4429</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3389.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> Of any thing in the form of a box or chest. </sense><sense id="n3389.7" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Noah's ark</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 6, 14</bibl> sqq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:24:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Matt. 24, 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,019:11:7 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Heb. 11, 7 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n3389.8" n="B" level="2"> In Jewish antiq., <hi rend="ital">the Ark of the Covenant</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">arca foederis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,005:10:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Deut. 10, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arca foederis Domini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,004:10:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Num. 10, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arca testimonii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:26:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Exod. 26, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arca testamenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,019:9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Heb. 9, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arca testamenti Dei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,049:3:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Jer. 3, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arca Domini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,006:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Jos. 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arca Dei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,011:11:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> 1 Reg. 11, 17</bibl></cit>; and <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">arca,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:30:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Exod. 30, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,005:10:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Deut. 10, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3389.9" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A small</hi>, <hi rend="ital">close prison</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a cell</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Servi) in arcas coniciuntur, ne quis cum iis colloqui possit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:chapter=22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 22 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=264" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 264</bibl> Müll. —</sense><sense id="n3389.10" n="D" level="2"> In mechanics, <hi rend="ital">the water-box of a hydraulic machine</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 13</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3389.11" n="E" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A watercistern</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a reservoir</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 6, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3389.12" n="F" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A quadrangular landmark;</hi> cf. Scriptt. Agrim. pp. 119, 222, 223, 271 Goes.</sense></entryFree>
arcades: <entryFree id="n3390" type="main" key="Arca^de^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Arcădĕs</orth>, v. Arcas, II.</entryFree>
arcadia: <entryFree id="n3391" type="main" key="Arca^di^a1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Arcădĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)arkadi/a</foreign>, <sense id="n3391.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mountainous province in the centre of the Peloponnesus</hi>, the Greek Switzerland, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 6, 10, § 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:4:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 4, 58</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:405" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 405</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">9, 192 al.</bibl>—Hence, derivv. </sense><sense id="n3391.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Arcădĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)arkadiko/s</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">Arcadian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">asinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:2:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 2, 67</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:1:14" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 1, 14</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:167" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 43, 68, § 167</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:3:9" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 3, 9</bibl>.—Arcadicus juvenis for <hi rend="ital">a simpleton</hi> (since the Arcadians, as mostly mountaineers, were considered as a simple, uncultivated people), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:160" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 160</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3391.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Arcădĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)arka/dios</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">Arcadian</hi>: Arcadius sus, <hi rend="ital">the Arcadian boar</hi>, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dea,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Carmenta</tr>, <tr>who came from Arcadia to Italy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:462" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 462</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virgo,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the nymph Arethusa</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:6:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 3, 6, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Pan</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:18:20" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 18, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rupes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:1:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 1, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:24:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 24, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sidus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the Great Bear</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Oedip. 476" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Oedip. 476</bibl></cit>: virga, <hi rend="ital">the wand of Mercury</hi> (who was born upon the Arcadian mountain Cyllene, and worshipped there), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:2:70" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 2, 70</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">galerus,</quote> <trans><tr>the helmet of Mercury</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 39</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n3392" type="main" key="Arca^di^a2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Arcădĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n3392.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in Crete</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 3:11:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 3, 11, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 4, 30, § 53</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
arcae: <entryFree id="n3393" type="gloss" key="Arcae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Arcae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n3393.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Volscian town between Arpinum and Fabrateria</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Arce</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 149</bibl>; cf. Mann. Ital. I. 676.</sense></entryFree>
arcano: <entryFree id="n3394" type="main" key="arca_no_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">arcānō</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. arcanus <sense id="n3394.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
arcanum: <entryFree id="n3395" type="main" key="Arca_num"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Arcānum</orth>, v. 2. Arcanus, B.</entryFree>
arcanus: <entryFree id="n3396" type="main" key="arca_nus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">arcānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>v. arceo</etym>, orig., <sense id="n3396.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">shut up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">closed;</hi> hence, trop., </sense><sense id="n3396.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">That keeps a secret</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trusty</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dixisti arcano satis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:155" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 155</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">petiit, ut aliquem ex arcanis mitteret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:178" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 52, 53, § 178</bibl></cit>.— Hence, <usg type="style">poet.</usg>, of the night: omina arcanā nocte petita, <hi rend="ital">in silent night</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">night that keeps secrets</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:9:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 9, 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:3:71" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 3, 71</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n3396.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Hidden</hi>, <hi rend="ital">concealed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">secret</hi>, <hi rend="ital">private</hi> (class., although very rare in Cic.): <cit><quote lang="la">at quīcum joca, seria, ut dicitur, quīcum arcana, quīcum occulta omnia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:26:85" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 26, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 18</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:21:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 21, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">secretae et arcanae opes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:34:3" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 34, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fontis arcani aqua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libidines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:43 al" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 43 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">littera celatos arcana fatebitur ignes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:516" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 516</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sensus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:422 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 422 al.</bibl></cit>— <cit><quote lang="la">Esp., in the lang. of religion, of things sacred and incommunicable: ARCANA VRBIS PRAESIDIA,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2494</bibl></cit>: audivit arcana verba, quae non licet homini loqui, <cb n="ARCE" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,008:12:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Cor. 12, 4</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and of secret, mysterious usages: sacra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:436" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 436</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arcana cum fiunt sacra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:5:52" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 5, 52</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:4:92" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 4, 92</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:2:427" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 2, 427</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rapt. Pros. 3, 402</bibl>; and by <usg type="style">poet.</usg> license transf. to the deity presiding over such mysteries: <cit><quote lang="la">qui Cereris sacrum Volgavit arcanae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 2, 27</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">arcānum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a secret.</hi> </sense><sense id="n3396.3" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">nox arcanis fidissima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:192" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 192</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arcani Fides prodiga,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:18:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 18, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quid umquam arcani sanctive ad silendum in curiā fuerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:22:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 22, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arcana regum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:6:5" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 6, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">revelare arcana,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,029:11:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Prov. 11, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">denudare arcana amici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,034:27:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Eccli. 27, 17</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3396.4" n="B" level="2"> Spec., <hi rend="ital">a sacred secret</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a mystery</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fatorum arcana,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:639" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 639</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 123</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pythagorae arcana,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:15:21" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 15, 21</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Jovis arcana,</quote> <trans><tr>the secret decrees of</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:28:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 1, 28, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deorum arcanum proferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:23:5" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 23, 5</bibl></cit>: arcana quaedam, <hi rend="ital">secret rites</hi> (of the diviners), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:7:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 7, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">violabunt arcanum meum,</quote> <trans><tr>my secret place</tr>, <tr>sanctuary</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,053:7:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Ezech. 7, 22</bibl></cit> et saep.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">arcā-nō</orth> (cf. Charis. pp. 173 and 179 P.), <hi rend="ital">in secret</hi>, <hi rend="ital">privately</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">arcano tibi ego hoc dico,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc (librum) lege arcano convivis tuis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 3</bibl></cit> (cf. Charis. l. c.): <cit><quote lang="la">arcano cum paucis familiaribus suis colloquitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 19</bibl></cit>.— * <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">arcanius judicare aliquid de aliquā re,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 2</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.—Sup.</hi> not used.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n3397" type="main" key="Arca_nus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Arcānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>Arcae</etym>, <sense id="n3397.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to Arcœ</hi> hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi> </sense><sense id="n3397.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Arcāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Arcœ</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4007</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3397.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Arcānum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a villa of Q. Cicero</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the neighborhood of Arcœ</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ad Q. Fr. 3, 1 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
arcarius: <entryFree id="n3398" type="main" key="arca_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">arcārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>arca, I. B.</etym>, <sense id="n3398.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to a money-box</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ready money</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 1" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 1</bibl></cit>. 3, § 131 Goes.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">arcārĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a treasurer</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">arcarii gazae tuae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,019:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Esth. 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arcarius civitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,006:16:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Rom. 16, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:40:5:41" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 40, 5, 41</bibl>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Also,</quote> <trans><tr>a controller of public revenues</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Alex. Sev. 43</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
arcas: <entryFree id="n3399" type="main" key="Arca^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Arcăs</orth>, <itype>ădis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)arka/s</foreign>. <sense id="n3399.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Son of Jupiter and Callisto</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the progenitor of the Arcadians</hi>, after his death placed as a constellation (Arctophylax) in heaven, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:470" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 470</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 190</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:468" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 2, 468</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 497</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 176" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 176</bibl>, and Astr. 2, 4 (cf. Apollod. 3, 8, 2).— </sense><sense id="n3399.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An Arcadian; plur.</hi> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Arcădĕs</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (<case>acc.</case> Gr. Arcadăs, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:397" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 397</bibl>), = <foreign lang="greek">*)arka/des</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">the Arcadians.</hi> </sense><sense id="n3399.2" n="A" level="2"> As the most ancient men, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 48, 49, § 154</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:289 al" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 289 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n3399.3" n="B" level="2"> As skilled in pastoral music: Tamen cantabitis, Arcades, inquit, Montibus haec vestris; <cit><quote lang="la">soli cantare periti, Arcades,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:10:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 10, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Arcades ambo, Et cantare pares et respondere parati,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 4</bibl></cit> (cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 58</bibl> sq.; Theocr. 22, 157; Polyb. 4, 20).—Hence, Arcas, </sense><sense id="n3399.4" n="C" level="2"> <foreign lang="greek">*kat) e)coxh/n</foreign>. </sense><sense id="n3399.5" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Mercury</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who was said to have been born on the Arcadian mountain Cyllene</hi> (cf. 1. Arcadia, B.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:35:6" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 35, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:661" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 661</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:1:107" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 1, 107</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3399.6" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Parthenopœus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the son of Atalanta from Arcadia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:8:745" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 8, 745</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 805</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3399.7" n="3" level="3"> Tyrannus, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Lycaon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grandfather of Arcas</hi> (a <usg type="style">poet.</usg> prolepsis), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:218" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 218</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3399.8" n="4" level="3"> Bipennifer, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Ancœus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:391" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 391</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3399.9" n="III" level="1"> <pos>Adj.</pos>, = Arcadius, <hi rend="ital">Arcadian</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:518" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 518</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:65:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 65, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:2:123" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 2, 123</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:7:94" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Th. 7, 94</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:6:636" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 6, 636</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
arcatura: <entryFree id="n3400" type="hapax" key="arca_tu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">arcātūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>arca</etym>, = arca, II. F., <sense id="n3400.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a square landmark of surveyors</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 3, 52</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
arcebion: <entryFree id="n3401" type="main" key="arcebi^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">arcebĭon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n3401.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, usu. called onochiles or anchusa, <hi rend="ital">a kind of ox-tongue;</hi> cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 21, 25, § 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
arcella: <entryFree id="n3402" type="main" key="arcella"><orth extent="full" lang="la">arcella</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>arca; cf. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=21" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 21</bibl> Müll.</etym>; among surveyors, <sense id="n3402.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a square landmark</hi> (cf. arca, II. F., and arcatura), Front. Colon. pp. 119, 260, 308 Goes.</sense></entryFree>
arcellacaevites: <entryFree id="n3403" type="hapax" key="arcellacae vi_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">arcellacae vītes</orth>, <sense id="n3403.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a species of the vine</hi>, now unknown, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:21:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 21, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
arcellula: <entryFree id="n3404" type="gloss" key="arcellu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">arcellŭla</orth>, ae. <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n3404.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">doub. dim.</hi> [arcella, from arca], <hi rend="ital">a very little box</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 313</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
arceo: <entryFree id="n3405" type="main" key="arce^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">arcĕo</orth>, <itype>cui, ctum</itype> (arcitum, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 1265</bibl> P.) [cf. <foreign lang="greek">a)rke/w</foreign> = to keep off, to suffice; <foreign lang="greek">a)/rkios</foreign> = sufficient, safe; arx = a stronghold; arca = a strong-box, chest; <foreign lang="greek">a)lalkei=n</foreign> = to keep off; <foreign lang="greek">a)lkh/</foreign> = defence, strength. Curt.]. <sense id="n3405.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To shut up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to enclose.</hi> </sense><sense id="n3405.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: arcere est continere, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=15" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 15</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">alvus arcet et continet quod recipit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:54:136" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 54, 136</bibl></cit>: orbis caelestis arcens <cb n="ARCE" /> et continens ceteros, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 6, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nos flumina arcemus, dirigimus, avertimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:60:152" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 60, 152</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hos quidem ut famulos vinclis prope ac custodiā arceamus,</quote> <trans><tr>shut in</tr>, <tr>confine</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:21:48" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 21, 48</bibl></cit> (cf. Doed. Syn. II. p. 426).—</sense><sense id="n3405.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">videbam audaciam tam immanem non posse arceri otii finibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,021:chapter=3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Har. Resp. 3</bibl></cit>.—Also, <hi rend="ital">to keep in order</hi>: arcendae familiae gratiā, Paul. ex Fest. s. v. noverca, p. 175 Müll.—</sense><sense id="n3405.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To keep</hi> or <hi rend="ital">hold off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to prevent from approaching</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to keep at a distance</hi>: arcere prohibere est, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=15" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 15</bibl> Müll.; constr. <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> aliquem, with <hi rend="ital">ab</hi>, the simple <case>abl.</case>, <usg type="style">poet.</usg> also with <case>dat.</case> </sense><sense id="n3405.4" n="(a)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg> aliquem: <cit><quote lang="la">ille tenet et scit ut hostium copiae, tu ut aquae pluviae arceantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:9:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 9, 22</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">aquam pluviam, aquas pluvias arcere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:10:43" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Top. 10, 43</bibl></cit>, and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:39:3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 39, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">platanus solem arcet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 1, 5, § 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">somnos ducere et arcere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:735" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 735</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Odi profanum vulgus et arceo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 1, 1</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">With an abstr. object: transitum hostis,</quote> <trans><tr>to arrest</tr>, <tr>hinder</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 41</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg> and in postAug. prose, with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> as object, <hi rend="ital">to hinder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prevent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (dicta) clamor ad aures Arcuit ire meas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:427" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 427</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plagamque sedere Cedendo arcebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:3:89" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 89</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:3:56" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 3, 3, 56</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:2:1:34" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 2, 1, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:455" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Th. 1, 455</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Hippol. 805" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Hippol. 805</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:341 al" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 13, 341 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 72</bibl>.— <cit><quote lang="la">And without object: arcuit Omnipotens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:505" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 505</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3405.5" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ab</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu, Juppiter, hunc a tuis aris ceterisque templis arcebis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines ab injuriā, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec aetas a libidinibus arcenda est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:34:122" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 34, 122</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines ab improbitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:3:2:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Par. 3, 2, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">famulas a limine templi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:482" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 482</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem ab amplexu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:751" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 9, 751</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignavum, fucos, pecus a praesepibus arcent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:168" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 168</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3405.6" n="(g)" level="5"> With the simple <case>abl.</case> (not with persons): <cit><quote lang="la">primordia genitali concilio arceri tempore iniquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:183" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 183</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illum ut hostem arcuit Galliā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 5, 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">te dominus illis sedibus arcebit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 40</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:37:89" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 37, 89</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Virginiam matronae sacris arcuerant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem aditu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 42, 6</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:46" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:10:499" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 10, 499</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquā atque igni arcebatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 23</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 50</bibl> (cf. aqua, I. B. 3.) al.: <cit><quote lang="la">arceor aris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:209" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 209</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patriis penatibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:9:446" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 446</bibl></cit> al.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem funesto veterno,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to protect</tr>, <tr>guard</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 8, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">classes aquilonibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 64</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n3405.7" n="(d)" level="5"> With <case>dat.</case>, <hi rend="ital">to keep off something from</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oestrum pecori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:155" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 155</bibl></cit> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Solstitium pecori defendite,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:7:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> E. 7, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mortem fratri depulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:14:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 14, 130</bibl></cit>; and the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">a)mu/nein nhusi\ qoh=|si pu=r</foreign>, Hom. Il. 9, 435; 9, 347; v. also Rudd. II. p. 150).</sense></entryFree>
arcera: <entryFree id="n3406" type="main" key="arce^ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">arcĕra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>arca, Curt.</etym>, <sense id="n3406.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a covered carriage for sick persons</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod ex tabulis vehiculum erat factum ut arca, arcera dictum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=140" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 140</bibl></cit> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:20:1:29" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 20, 1, 29</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 55, 26</bibl>. So in the laws of the XII. Tables, Fragm. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:20:1:25" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 20, 1, 25</bibl>; Varr. ap. Non. l. l. Acc. to Nonius ib. this word was found also in Cicero. At a later period the litter (lectica, sella) came into use, and hence arcera disappeared from the language.</sense></entryFree>
arcesilas: <entryFree id="n3407" type="main" key="Arce^si^las"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Arcĕsĭlas</orth>, <itype>ae</itype> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">Arcĕsĭlāus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 5</bibl>), <gen>m.</gen> (<case>acc.</case> Arcesilam, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 24, 76</bibl>: <sense id="n3407.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">Arcesilan,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:18:1" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 18, 1</bibl></cit>), = <foreign lang="greek">*)arkesi/las</foreign> (-<foreign lang="greek">aos</foreign>). </sense><sense id="n3407.1" n="I" level="1"> Arcesilas (mostly in this form), <hi rend="ital">a Greek philosopher of Pitane</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a pupil of Polemon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and founder of the Middle Academy</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:18:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 18, 67</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 1, 12, 45</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 24, 76</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:31:94" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 31, 94</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 2:10" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 2, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:3:79" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 3, 79</bibl> (cf. Diog. Laert. 4, 28).—</sense><sense id="n3407.2" n="II" level="1"> Arcesilaus, <hi rend="ital">a sculptor of the first century</hi> B. C., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:155" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 12, 45, § 155</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3407.3" n="III" level="1"> Arcesilaus, <hi rend="ital">an encaustic painter of Paros</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 11, 38, § 122</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3407.4" n="IV" level="1"> Arcesilas, <hi rend="ital">a painter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">son of Tisicrates</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 11, 40, § 146</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
arcesius: <entryFree id="n3408" type="main" key="Arce_si^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Arcēsĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)arkei/sios</foreign>, <sense id="n3408.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">son of Jupiter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">father of Laertes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and grandfather of Ulysses</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 144</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
arcessitio: <entryFree id="n3409" type="main" key="arcessi_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">arcessītĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>arcesso</etym>, <sense id="n3409.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a calling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">summons</hi>: dies propriae arcessitionis, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the day of death</hi>, Cypr. de Mortal. <hi rend="ital">extr.</hi></sense></entryFree>
arcessitor: <entryFree id="n3410" type="main" key="arcessi_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">arcessītor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n3410.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one that calls</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fetches</hi> another (perh. only in the two foll. exs.): <cit><quote lang="la">nemo arcessitor ex proximo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:6:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 6, 45</bibl></cit>.—Hence, in judic. lang., <hi rend="ital">an accuser</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 29, 1, 44</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
arcessitus: <entryFree id="n3411" type="main" key="arcessi_tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">arcessītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of arcesso.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n3412" type="main" key="arcessi_tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">arcessītus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>arcesso</etym>, <sense id="n3412.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a calling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">summons</hi> (very rare; only in <hi rend="ital">abl. sing.</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">tuo arcessitu venio huc,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:2:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 2, 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <pb n="154" /> <cb n="ARCH" /> cum ad eum ipsius rogatu arcessituque venissem, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:6:15" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 6, 15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 31, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
arcesso: <entryFree id="n3413" type="main" key="arcesso"><orth extent="full" lang="la">arcesso</orth> (and <orth extent="full" lang="la">accerso</orth>), <itype>īvi, ītum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> (<sense id="n3413.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> arcessire and arcessiri, like lacessiri instead of lacessi, freq. and in the best class. writers, though the MSS. and editt. vary very much; cf. Struve, p. 198.—The form accerso, used freq. by Sall., has been unjustly repudiated; cf. Doed. Syn. III. p. 281 sq.; Kritz ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 40:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 40, 6</bibl>, and the grammarians cited by both; <cit><quote lang="la">Dietsch,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:II. p. 145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> II. p. 145</bibl></cit>; Rib. prol. in <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> p. 388</bibl>) [causat. from accedo; cf. incesso from incedo; ar = ad]. </sense><sense id="n3413.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to cause any one to come</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to call</hi>, <hi rend="ital">send for</hi>, <hi rend="ital">invite</hi>, <hi rend="ital">summon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fetch</hi> (while <hi rend="ital">accio</hi> designates merely the calling, without indicating the coming of the person called, Doed. Syn. III. p. 283). </sense><sense id="n3413.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem ad aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:3:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 3, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Blepharonem arcessat, qui nobiscum prandeat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:3:2:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 3, 2, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaeso, hominem ut jubeas arcessi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:5:1:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 5, 1, 29</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:3:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 2, 3, 120</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 6, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:2:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 1, 2, 28</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">arcessiturus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:3:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 3, 2, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 4, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">arcessitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 4, 4, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jussit me ad se accersier,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 3, 4</bibl></cit> Bentl., where Fleck. reads <hi rend="ital">arcessier</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">obstetricem arcesse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:2:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 3, 2, 56</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 7, 6</bibl>; and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:5:44 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 3, 5, 44 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ab aratro arcessebantur, qui consules fierent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:chapter=18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacra ab exteris nationibus ascita atque arcessita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 51 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ejus librum arcessivi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 16, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex continenti alios (fabros) accersi jubet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 11</bibl></cit> Dinter: <cit><quote lang="la">Gabinium accersit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 40:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 40, 6</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 52:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 52, 24</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">60, 4: cunctos senatorii ordinis accersiri jubet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 62:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 62, 4</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 113:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 113, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Agrippam ad se arcessi jussit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:21:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 21, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pisonem arcessi jubet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:14 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 14 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">placere patrem arcessiri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem ab Epidauro Romam arcessendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ityn huc arcessite,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:652" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 652</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:15:640" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 640</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:261" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 261</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sin melius quid (sc. vini) habes, arcesse,</quote> <trans><tr>order it</tr>, <tr>let it be brought</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 5, 6 al.</bibl></cit>—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Illic homo a me sibi malam rem arcessit jumento suo, prov.,</quote> <trans><tr>this man brings misfortunes upon his own head</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:171" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 171</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quies molli strato arcessita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 4</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">somnum medicamentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gloriam ex periculo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:13" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> al.—</sense><sense id="n3413.3" n="B" level="2"> Esp. in judic. lang., <hi rend="ital">to summon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">arraign one</hi>, <hi rend="ital">before a court of justice;</hi> hence, in gen., <hi rend="ital">to accuse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inform against;</hi> constr. aliquem alicujus rei: <cit><quote lang="la">ut hunc hoc judicio arcesseret,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 6</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:chapter=9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Perd. 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne quem umquam innocentem judicio capitis arcessas,</quote> <trans><tr>to accuse of a capital crime</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:14:51" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 14, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem capitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:chapter=11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Deiot. 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecuniae captae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 32:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 32, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">majestatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tumultus hostilis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">veneni crimine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:53" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 53</bibl></cit>; also <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">arcessiri statim ac mori jussus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:37" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 37</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: inscitiae, Nigid. ap <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:14" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 14</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n3413.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> to mental objects, <hi rend="ital">to bring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fetch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">seek</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">derive</hi> a subject, thought, quality, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">a capite quod velimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:27:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 27, 117</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:chapter=9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Top. 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">translationes orationi splendoris aliquid arcessunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:38:156" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 38, 156</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex medio res arcessere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 168</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">longe arcessere fabulas coepi,</quote> <trans><tr>to fetch from far</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 37</bibl></cit>.—Hence, arcessitus (in opp. to that which comes of itself, and is therefore natural), <hi rend="ital">far-fetched</hi>, <hi rend="ital">forced</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unnatural</hi> (syn. durus): <cit><quote lang="la">cavendum est, ne arcessitum dictum putetur,</quote> <trans><tr>that an expression may not appear forced</tr>, <tr>far-fetched</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:63:256" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 63, 256</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frigidi et arcessiti joci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:21" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Lysiā nihil est inane, nihil arcessitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:78" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 78</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 4, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:74" default="NO">9, 3, 74</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:40 al" default="NO">12, 10, 40 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
